story:
THE STORY

My name is Forrest H. D.  Robinson (FHDR).  I am a husband and father of 3 who currently resides in Tallahassee, FL.  I am an active member of the New Hickory Hill PB Church and a student at Florida A&M University.  In attempts to position myself to better serve my family as well as others,  I decided to go back to school to pursue a long lost dream of becoming a physical therapist.

 

THE PROBLEM

At the start of the summer term 2014, my tuition and fees were approximately 6,500 dollars.  I anticipated receiving a financial aid package for the summer; however, to my surprise I had exhausted all my financial aid.  Without the funding, I will not be able to continue with my education.

THE NEED AND REWARD

The goal is to raise $8000.  All funding collected from this campaign will go directly towards paying tuition, fees, and other school related cost. Any amount given will be received with gratitude and thanksgiving.


As a token of appreciation, we have several gift packages.  

  • $10 gift:  A personal phone call from myself telling you how great you are for helping out **Make sure to leave your phone number** and social media acknowledgment.
  • $25  gift:  A FAMU post card with handwritten thank-you note and social media acknowledgment.  
  • $50 gift:  A FAMU Tee-shirt, a FAMU post card with a handwritten thank-you note & a social media acknowledgment.
  • $75 gift:  A FAMU Coffee mug,  a FAMU post card with a handwritten thank-you note & a social media acknowledgment.
  • $100 gift:  A fitness assessment by an ACE certified personal trainer *Assessment must take place in the BIG BEND (Tallahassee) area.  


FAQ:

WHY NOT JUST GET A JOB?  This is a valid question.  I wish I could work.  The school schedule leaves very little room for work.  

WHY NOT JUST SIT OUT A SEMESTER AND WORK?  This is also a valid question.  The program is on a schedule.  If I were to miss a semester, I would have to submit a letter of withdrawal and wait an entire year for the possibility of getting readmitted to the program. 

CAN YOU GET A SCHOLARSHIP?  I have been and continue to search for and submit for scholarships.  I have searched around FAMU and the WEB for other opportunities as well.  Currently have several that I am working on.  At the start of this campaign, I have not been awarded any scholarships. 

WHY NOT JUST GET A LOAN?  Well, I tried.  Unfortunately financial aid was not an option for me during the summer.   I did not become aware of that fact until the summer semester arrived.  I did not have time to prepare in advance.  

WHY DON’T YOU JUST ABANDON THIS CAMPAIGN AND LEAVE SCHOOL?  Trust me, launching this campaign is taking me way out of my comfort zone.  Anyone that knows me can tell you that I am not the one to ask for money.  Before I applied to the program, I did some serious soul searching and praying. I made a promise to myself that I would do all that I can do to get trough the program and turn everything else over to God.  I know all things will work out for my good according to his plan.  I truly believe that its in Gods plan for me to be at this program; therefore I owe it to God to do all that I can.  In the end, if I am unable to raise the money to continue, I will be content that I did all that I could to make this dream work. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Pray for me and my campaigns.  (prayers are so valuable)
  • Share this campaign on your social media platform.
  • Words of encouragement.

Thanks so much for your prayers and support!!!!

story:
What is YoungLife? 

YoungLife is a non-denominational Christian organization designed to bring the Gospel to high school students. Many students have not been exposed to Christianity, or have been turned off by it, and it is our mission to share with them the truth and love that Jesus Christ has for them. 


Prayer,Support, and Donations 

We are heading to Windy Gap Young Life Camp in January, where we will be traveling into North Carolina with our friends from Jackson County High School. The purpose of this camp is to allow students to get away from their usual environment and experience some things they have maybe never seen before. Camp is said to be kids' "best weekend of their year," and we give all of the glory to the Lord. We are absolutely there to have fun, but more importantly, to let students experience the overwhelming joy and freedom that is found in Jesus Christ. In order to first of all, get students to camp and to make this experience incredible for them, we need You. 

Yes, You! 

Whether you are a giver or a doer, you are needed. The most important thing any of us can do is to pray for this ministry, and specifically our trip to Windy Gap in January. This means, praying that the Lord will raise up which students need to be there, provide the money for them to come, give families peace and assurance that their children are in safe hands, and pray for Salvation for all of our friends. If we are not in constant prayer and communication with Jesus, then this ministry is going nowhere. We need your prayers. We also need your support. Just by spreading the word about Young Life and getting students excited, you are doing something huge! For any of this to happen, students have to first be interested. 

The part we have all been waiting for....DONATIONS!!! 

Let's be real, none of us have money growing on trees and we have all been affected by the struggling economy. I completely understand that. However, if you feel the Lord putting it on your heart to give to this organization, I cannot tell you how much of a difference you would be making. Just by giving $10 to this ministry, you are making it possible for more students to hear about the Great name of Jesus Christ. It costs $180 per student to go to Windy Gap for the weekend, so we have a lot of fund raising to do. 


Thank You!

We really do thank you for all that you do. Without this community, Young Life would not be possible, and you are to thank for that. If you have any questions about this ministry, camp, donating, or supporting Young Life, please email me at csb33@uga.edu. 

We love you and are thankful for you!

story:
Peace Education

WE MAKE PEACE is a voluntary based non-profit organization working to spread peace education internationally through our materials, workshops and campaigns. 


We believe Peace Education should be taught in every school in every country of the world. 


After having effectively run peace education campaigns and workshops in Denmark with more than a hundred schools involved, including collaborations with organizations such as UNICEF, Amnesty International and human rights bodies, running pilot projects in UK schools as well as exciting new education programs in Uganda, East Africa, WE MAKE PEACE is now ready to take this experience to the masses. And what better place to start than New York City?


Our Campaign

We are thrilled to have found this platform to raise money for our campaign A PLEAD FOR PEACE: 

We wish to raise $5,000 to carry out an extensive tour of the schools in New York City with the peace education workshop, A PLEAD FOR PEACE. 


A Plead For Peace

A PLEAD FOR PEACE is an interactive workshop. We teach students (aged 8-13 years) how to make peace within, with each other, in the classroom and in society. 

The workshop is based on learning key issues of: 

• Human rights

• Human needs

• Conflict resolution

• Anti-bullying principles

• And the core values that spell out P L E A D:  

P= Positivity  L= Love  E= Empathy  A= Acceptance  and  D= Democracy. 


The program is taught through open debate and student interaction.  


"Peace education is needed not just in societies marked by war, but in all societies that are serious about living in peaceful societies. Peace education is currently not on the curriculum, but should be prioritized right from the top. WE MAKE PEACE makes peace education fun, creative and interactive." Founder Marie Mamonia.  

VIDEO

Watch a YouTube clip with Marie Mamonia speaking about Peace education here. 

Watch a YouTube clip from our UK launch at Camp Bestival here. 

Timeline

We wish to start the tour of the schools this year beginning in Brooklyn, in the fall of 2011, starting from October.

 

The workshop will be held by director and speaker Marie Mamonia. The workshop is interactive and can engage larger groups (150-200 students) as well as class groups (20-30 students).

 

Marie will also be responsible for the project to be both viable financially and achieve its’ goals actively.

 

If you are a teacher and would like to see this workshop in your school, please donate any amount you can, and help us on our way by spreading the word. 

 

If you just think this sounds amazing, as do we:-) then you can help too by sharing this link and donating anything you can spare. It all starts with you. 

 

The Impact

We work with social change. 

WE MAKE PEACE promotes learning that enables student participation in a positive and safe environment. 

We believe in giving students essential personal life skills for personal growth, as well as a set of creative problem-shooting tools, which builds confidence and establish a set of common values for the classroom, and the school necessary for peaceful coexistence. 

This will benefit not only the children involved, but the whole environment at the school, and the local community these children come into contact with (i.e. friends, family, teachers, coaches, social clubs, sports clubs, religious groups and other social groups). 


Without this campaign children are likely to never come across peace education during their primary school years. Children especially from disadvantaged or crime-ridden areas are likely not to develop peaceful conflict resolution skills, and a socially caring, loving behavior towards others in the community. This means a world with more aggression, more bullying, more violence, fear and ultimately more crime. 


When it comes to peace-making it starts with us... Me and you! 

It starts right a root level, learning peace skills at an early age will resonate positively through society at every level. 


What We Need & What You Get

We need cash to make it happen. Your donation will go towards building the props for the workshop (essential part of the workshop are 13 tailored alphabet-suits made out of fabric and foam, stickers and posters for participating schools), transport (to and from schools), promotional articles (print and digital including website updates). 

Even if we don't reach the full campaign amount, we guarantee that your donation will go towards getting this workshop into as many schools as possible. 

What you get is the change to fund something really worthwhile for children in the New York City area. We value your contribution endlessly and will make sure to provide all supporters with briefs and updates on how this project is doing along the way, so you can see just where your money went and how it's all going. Perks include: a peace poster, a signed copy of the children's book A Recipe for Peace (once published) and invitations to any upcoming WE MAKE PEACE events. 


Other Ways You Can Help

YES!! There are many ways you can help. 

 - First of all by making a donation to our campaign. 

 - Secondly share this campaign with all your friends and family members via email and social networks. 

 - Thirdly if you are a teacher (or know a teacher) who would love to schedule this program in at your school please get in contact with us at: info(at)wemakepeace(dot)org


Read more and Follow us on:  

TWITTER

FACEBOOK

WEBSITE


And please go ahead and support us by sharing a link to this page on Twitter and Facebook. 

Thank you for you time and good energy. 

We love you. WE MAKE PEACE ! !

story:
Short Summary

This is a funding project put together for the purpose of helping me complete my last year and obtain my BFA in Music. All proceeds go towards my college tuition. 

What We Need & What You Get

There honestly is no minimum or maximum I am looking for, any amount of funding you can provide is greatly appreciated and will provide me with the possibility of pursuing my artistic aspirations. If you would like to hear my band's material it is online at www.theseaovereli.com and if there are any songs you would like sent to you or tickets to a show etc... all you have to do is ask!

The Impact

I would not be looking for help from my friends and fans unless it was truly needed. My scholarships, as well as many other students', have been greatly reduced this year due to the bad economy. With a steep tuition of nearly 40,000 dollars a year every bit can help.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if it is honestly not possible for you to provide economic help, which is completely understandable in these hard times, it would still be very helpful if you helped spread the word through social media, word of mouth or any other way possible.

story:
BACKGROUND

WHO ARE WE? 

Aid for Kids is a 501 (c) 3 non-profit organization. Our MISSION is to improve the lives of children and families worldwide through food, shelter, education, and healthcare.  We work to identify the challenges children face in low income and impoverished communities, and we implement creative projects to address those issues.  In Vietnam, there is an enormous need for special education support, especially for those born with autism. Therefore, the aim of Aid for Kid's newest endeavor, the AUTISM EDUCAITON PROJECT is to provide training to parents, teachers, and organizations closely affected by autism. IN ADDITION, we will be providing first time education to children living in an orphanage in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. 

WHAT IS AUTISM? 

Autism is a disorder that is not bound by culture or class and it is not determined by ethnicity or environment. It is a disorder of abnormal brain development that affects nearly every part of a child's life. Children born with autism have an extremely difficult time receiving and processing information; they display odd repetitive behavior and are anxious about changes in their environment. A child with autism can find it difficult to communicate with people, to look at or even be touched by other people, and it can be very frustrating for them to learn new things. 

Awareness of autism has risen worldwide but lack of real understanding continues to plague the autism community. In developing countries, like Vietnam, understanding autism is only just beginning. Children with autism are rejected, stigmatized, and even abused; because of the many negative side effects associated with autism. Families are ostracized and parents are regarded as guilty with little social support. 

The story of autism, however, is not one of despair; in fact, it is a story of hope and possibilities. Though put in an almost impossible position, parents and caretakers have not given up hope.  There is no cure for this disorder and it has been shown with appropriate intervention the severity of symptoms can be dramatically improved. Children with autism can learn and they have capabilities to do and become great individuals. The goal of providing autism education is to promote and encourage understanding, hope, and acceptance of people with different learning abilities. 

     What is our Plan? 

Who are we helping and what are we doing?  

"Training the Trainers"

Parents and care providers in the United States have unparalleled access to a vault of knowledge and resources to educate children with autism. In Vietnam, however, caretakers are desperate for support and knowledge of how to educate and how to develop new skills in their children.  The goal of the Autism Education Project is to increase the capacity of support through education for these caretakers by  introducing them to contemporary methods of behavioral and educational therapy. Together, with a team of specialists, Aid for Kids is developing a culturally relevant and feasible training curriculum that will incorporate many of today's leading autism education practices.  

We will work with Tu Xuong Center, an orphanage for children with disabilities including autism and other related learning abilities.  The staff at Tu Xuong, along with selected individuals from the community, including leaders of parent support groups and teachers will receive the training curriculum first.  

 

"Teaching the Children"

Children with autism at Tu Xuong have had limited access to education. However, the Autism Education Project will allow us to provide education to these children.  This is a great opportunity for those who undergo the training curriculum to apply their knowledge in practical hands on experience. It is the combination of real time practice and traditional lectures that makes this project unique. The dual learning process will help to better improve and cement the caretakers knowledge of how to care for and improve the lives of the children with autism who are in their care.

  

PROJECT GOALS

•  Train a staff of educators and caretakers capable of implementing teaching strategies to successfully reach children with autism; 

•  Promote to the greatest degree possible the independent living and participation of the students in their community;

•  Encourage and promote community awareness of both physical handicaps and learning disabilities.

•  Connect and build relationships with professionals and partnering organizations in Vietnam and abroad to ensure the continual productive development of autism education.

•  Gather and distribute donated literacy materials (books, magazines, computer and related software, encyclopedias, reference materials) to provide print materials that will encourage and support reading. 

 

[To learn more about Aid for Kids and explore our other projects visit, aidforkids.org]

 

What YOU can do! How YOU Can Support us!

We are launching a Leadership Capital Campaign with the goal of raising $25,000 by December 31st, 2012. This project will be at the forefront of autism development in Vietnam, and could have the potential to change the lives of thousands of children and their families.  

The Leadership Capital Campaign will help us execute our first stage of the project--to establish an educational center with a core group of trained staff that understands the curriculum we have developed and how to train others. Also, it will help establish an educational facility for the children with autism at the orphanage.  

 

Please help us reach our goal of $25,000 by donating today!  


Your contributions will enable us to develop and provide a quality service--FREE 

With your support:

  • Sponsor the "Training of the trainers," the selected parents, educators, and caretakers whom will receive the training curriculum; 
  • Provide educational materials for the students with autism at the orphanage; 
  • Cover the operational and administrative costs; 
  • Translation of training materials;
  • Creation of an academic space within Tu Xuong Center to teach the students; 
  • Increase our collection of print media such as books
  • Expand our electronic media capabiliities such as assitive language devices, computers.
  • Sponsor specialists and volunteers from around the world to come and help provide further expertise and continue greater development. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If financial contribution is difficult---there are still many ways to support this project.  Here are other ways to CONTRIBUTE: 

 We are collecting educational materials including autism-related books, toys, electronic devices for communication, software and related games, etc.  

 

  • We are looking for volunteers with specialized knowledge in special needs/autism education and development to help the development team build the curriculum content and also to voluneteer their time to come be on sight and provide expertise! 

Finally, 

  •  Please help us make some noise! Use the Indiegogo "SHARE TOOLS!" 

Tell your friends on Facebook, Twitter, blog and any other forms of social media. The more people that hear about this project and the work we are doing the better! 

  • If you have ideas to help further our project please feel free to contact us!

Autism is a disorder that is not bound by culture or class and it is not determined by ethnicity or environment. It is a disorder of abnormal brain development that affects nearly every part of a child's life. Children born with autism have an extremely difficult time receiving and processing information; they display odd repetitive behavior and are anxious about changes in their environment. A child with autism can find it difficult to communicate with people, to look at or even be touched by other people, and it can be very frustrating for them to learn new things. 
Awareness of autism has risen worldwide but lack of real understanding continues to plague the autism community. In developing countries, like Vietnam, understanding autism is only just beginning. Children with autism are rejected, stigmatized, and even abused; because of the many negative side effects associated with autism. Families are ostracized and parents are regarded as guilty with little social support. 
The story of autism, however, is not one of despair; in fact, it is a story of hope and possibilities. Though put in an almost impossible position, parents and caretakers have not given up hope.  There is no cure for this disorder and it has been shown with appropriate intervention the severity of symptoms can be dramatically improved. Children with autism can learn and they have capabilities to do and become great individuals. The goal of providing autism education is to promote and encourage understanding, hope, and acceptance of people with different learning abilities. 
     What is our Plan? 

Who are we helping and what are we doing?  
"Training the Trainers"
Parents and care providers in the United States have unparalleled access to a vault of knowledge and resources to educate children with autism. In Vietnam, however, caretakers are desperate for support and knowledge of how to educate and how to develop new skills in their children.  The goal of the Autism Education Project is to increase the capacity of support through education for these caretakers by  introducing them to contemporary methods of behavioral and educational therapy. Together, with a team of specialists, Aid for Kids is developing a culturally relevant and feasible training curriculum that will incorporate many of today's leading autism education practices.  
We will work with Tu Xuong Center, an orphanage for children with disabilities including autism and other related learning abilities.  The staff at Tu Xuong, along with selected individuals from the community, including leaders of parent support groups and teachers will receive the training curriculum first.  
 
"Teaching the Children"
Children with autism at Tu Xuong have had limited access to education. However, the Autism Education Project will allow us to provide education to these children.  This is a great opportunity for those who undergo the training curriculum to apply their knowledge in practical hands on experience. It is the combination of real time practice and traditional lectures that makes this project unique. The dual learning process will help to better improve and cement the caretakers knowledge of how to care for and improve the lives of the children with autism who are in their care.
  
PROJECT GOALS
•  Train a staff of educators and caretakers capable of implementing teaching strategies to successfully reach children with autism; 
•  Promote to the greatest degree possible the independent living and participation of the students in their community;
•  Encourage and promote community awareness of both physical handicaps and learning disabilities.
•  Connect and build relationships with professionals and partnering organizations in Vietnam and abroad to ensure the continual productive development of autism education.
•  Gather and distribute donated literacy materials (books, magazines, computer and related software, encyclopedias, reference materials) to provide print materials that will encourage and support reading. 
 
[To learn more about Aid for Kids and explore our other projects visit, aidforkids.org]
 
What YOU can do! How YOU Can Support us!
We are launching a Leadership Capital Campaign with the goal of raising $25,000 by December 31st, 2012. This project will be at the forefront of autism development in Vietnam, and could have the potential to change the lives of thousands of children and their families.  
The Leadership Capital Campaign will help us execute our first stage of the project--to establish an educational center with a core group of trained staff that understands the curriculum we have developed and how to train others. Also, it will help establish an educational facility for the children with autism at the orphanage.  
 
Please help us reach our goal of $25,000 by donating today!  
 Your contributions will enable us to develop and provide a quality service--FREE 
With your support:

Sponsor the "Training of the trainers," the selected parents, educators, and caretakers whom will receive the training curriculum; 
Provide educational materials for the students with autism at the orphanage; 
Cover the operational and administrative costs; 
Translation of training materials;
Creation of an academic space within Tu Xuong Center to teach the students; 
Increase our collection of print media such as books
Expand our electronic media capabiliities such as assitive language devices, computers.
Sponsor specialists and volunteers from around the world to come and help provide further expertise and continue greater development. 
Other Ways You Can Help
If financial contribution is difficult---there are still many ways to support this project.  Here are other ways to CONTRIBUTE: 
 We are collecting educational materials including autism-related books, toys, electronic devices for communication, software and related games, etc.  
 

We are looking for volunteers with specialized knowledge in special needs/autism education and development to help the development team build the curriculum content and also to voluneteer their time to come be on sight and provide expertise! 
Finally, 



 Please help us make some noise! Use the Indiegogo "SHARE TOOLS!" 

Tell your friends on Facebook, Twitter, blog and any other forms of social media. The more people that hear about this project and the work we are doing the better! 

If you have ideas to help further our project please feel free to contact us!

story:
Mambo!

Hello!

My name is Saylor Gibbs. I am about to finish my first year of undergraduate study at the University of California, Los Angeles. I plan to major in Neuroscience so that I can attend medical school and become a Neurosurgeon.

I have always been fascinated with medicine and anything involving health education. Within my first weeks at UCLA, I applied and was accepted into the Pediatric AIDS Coalition at UCLA, an entirely student-run philanthropic organization that aims to educate UCLA and the surrounding communities about the stigma attached to HIV/AIDS and the need to prevent the passage of HIV/AIDS from mother to child. Every year, the Pediatric AIDS Coalition puts on a 26-hour Dance Marathon, during which over 1,000 dancers pledge to stay on their feet for 26 hours to raise money and awareness for Pediatric HIV/AIDS. This year, we raised over $515,000 during February's Dance Marathon.

How does this connect to my campaign?

This summer, I will be traveling to Arusha, Tanzania to volunteer for 6 weeks with One Heart Source in a program of health education both in the classroom and in the community. I will be living with a wonderful Tanzanian family so I am in the process of learning Swahili, my third language.  I will be assigned a school and a classroom in which to teach and I'll construct my own curriculum and engage my students in activities and learning both in and out of the classroom. In addition, I will have the opportunity to connect and communicate with the greater community of my village to talk about topics that can help break down the stigma placed on sexual health and HIV/AIDS in Tanzania.

Are you with me?

Earlier this year, I was able to raise over $2,000.00 for the Pediatric AIDS Coalition (well over the required $500.00). I am committed to transparent fundraising efforts and will answer any questions regarding where the money is going and what it is used for.

THE BREAKDOWN:

What I need:

$5,000.00 US

Why I need it:

On May 23, 2012, I have to pay my program fee and travel expenses in order to be able to participate in the program.

What it pays for:

$3,050.00 US is the One Heart Source program fee, which covers - food, clean drinking water, housing, mosquito nets, teaching supplies, manuals, training supplies, English-Swahili training guides, on-site and pre-field orientation, transportation, 24-hour health services, a cell phone with international capabilities, and a volunteer residence permit.

$2,000.00 US will cover travel expenses - domestic and international airfaire and fees, vaccinations, and travel insurance.

Perks:

Donors that donate $50 will receive a t-shirt that I have designed with the One Heart Source logo and an elephant (trunk up for good luck) on the front in vibrant colors.

Why is this important to me?

I believe that everyone has the right to the life that they want for themselves. I decided to volunteer with the hope that I will be able to change lives, but also with the knowledge that I will be changed as well. Throughout the duration of my program, I hope to open the door for greater communication and education from both sides. I have a passion for learning and teaching, and I am unbelievably excited to be able to share that passion with others. I am also excited to engage in the tough conversations about sexual health and HIV/AIDS. Every man, woman, and child, should have the right to live in an AIDS-free generation without the heavy shroud of stigma placed on those with positive status. An HIV-positive status should never determine how a person is treated.

LET'S DO THIS!

I am incredibly passionate about this amazing opportunity that is just out of reach. I need YOUR help to make it a reality.

Spread the word. Share the link. Post a status. Tweet. Sing. Email. Shout it from the rooftops. Whatever you like. Make some noise and help me realize my dream of going to Africa to teach people about HIV/AIDS and prevent the next generation from suffering and loss.

Asante.

Thank you.

story:
Hello and thank you for visiting our site!

    This project is sincerely intended to be a not-for-profit enterprise. We will be returning to Ecuador whether this idea is funded or is not. This is why we have asked the bare minimum of possible costs. Because not one dollar will be buying our plane tickets. All of the money will go towards quality educational material, good books, and supplies to improve and bring the best we can to the poor indigenous kids of Ecuador.
 
     My name is Jeff Koldewyn and my partner is Marisabel Jimenez. Both of us have taught kids for many years and have been employed in the arena of education for over ten. I have worked with Portland Public Schools of Oregon. Marisabel has worked with the Montessori education. Both of us are fluent in Spanish.
     We discovered and fell in love with the Quechua kids when we first visited Ecuador in the month of October 2012. We visited their schools and immediately began working with their teachers. We began teaching free classes out of our friend's home. We coordinated and raised the hopes of the school principals and children or the area. All of them want us to return.
     This we will do. We have been able to save the finiances to get there and live for five months. We are also fortunate enough to have a place to stay and live at while we are there. We have been incredibly blessed to be able to be part of this community.
 
     The money for this project is aimed at providing the best quality of education we possibly can. We intend to purchase and bring a lot of good books with us, which is why the deadline is so important in this project. Because we will have to carry it on the plane with us.
     The average Ecuadorian makes $375 dollars a month for the employed Ecuadorian. Yet, the employment rate sits at around 25%. This makes for a rough living standard and a sub-rate quality of life for the rural indigenous who are lucky to make $2 a day.
     Learning English will give these kids access to better jobs, enhance their experience with foreign tourists, and even give them the tools they need to fight big corporations that want to exploit their land.
      This is why we will return. We are needed and have the ability to really help!
 
      We intend this project to be completely transparent and open. If you read the perks you will see that we are also inviting you to come and see the work we are doing. Luckily, we have dear friends with a home large enough that we have the ability to invite you as our guests.
      This is such a pure hearted people who will welcome you as they have us. You can rest assured knowing that these people truly do need and appreciate the aid that we offer by seeing it with your own eyes. We invite those who pledge more than a $100 dollars to stay at the house for free and to witness what this project really means.
 
       In hopes of making this project truly successful, we have asked the bare mininmum of $2000. However, if we are to exceed this mark we will truthfully put it directly into aiding as many schools as we possibly can with the time we have. There are hundreds of rural schools that can truly benifit from quality material and we would love to reach as far as possible.
 
       Once again I would like to thank you for considering this project and considering them. Without your help, we will still return to Ecuador. But with your help, we will return with wonderful books, paper, and writing tools to share. <3
 
       Please pass the word if you love what you've heard.

story:
Short Summary

Dear friends and family and all else who see this:

The film above is the hospital and university I will be studying at.

For the last four years I have been diligently working on my masters degree in Acupuncture and Oriental Medicine. I am blessed to have done so in a time when our Western world is seriously starting to consider and implement complimentary and alternative care methods.

During my almost 2 years of internships, I had the opportunity to work in a variety of care settings. I began at an integrated community clinic treating everything from migraines to diabetic neuropathy, menstral issues, gastrointestinal disturbance, chronic pain, depression and substance abuse. I interned in a stroke rehab facility not only treating stroke patients, but also spinal cord injuries and brain injury, and I saw substantial results. I provided acupuncture services at a non-profit organization that offers complementary healing approaches to people with life threatening disease. And in my final trimester i worked in a hospital on patients with leukemia, lymphoma, cystic fibrosis, pancreatitis, and much more. Of these places, I felt the hospital was the most naive to acupuncture and how to use it as a functional unit in their setting. I learned that these larger health systems could seriously benefit from more education. They know that Chinese Medicine can be beneficial to patients, as well as helping to relieve some of the financial burdens of modern health care administration, but they just don't know how to fit it into their system.

In China, I will have the opportunity to see first-hand how a hospital fully integrates this ancient wisdom into a modern, professional health care setting. I will have the opportunity to totally immerse myself in the culture for an entire month, taking classes
at Tianjin University and observing in a truly integrated teaching hospital. I hope to bring back some insight on how eastern medicine can work side by side with western medicine to deliver better health with less/no side effects.

My ultimate goal is to pay this wisdom forward by giving informative and inspirational talks to hospitals and the amazing people who work in them. All health care professionals have a responsibility to bring the best care to our patients that is available. You can help me make that happen.

What I Need & What You Get

The funds raised in this campaign will go towards:

  • Food and Lodging= $1150
  • Tuition and Translation= $1050
  • VISA and Healthcare= $240
  • My monthly bills that will need an income= $1060

Your donations can be traded in for:

  • a personal postcard sent from China
  • 30 minute Tuina (Chinese bodywork) session
  • 3 Acupuncture treatments
  • a personal invitation to dinner to hear all about my adventure

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, you can still make a huge impact by passing this on to anyone who may be of interest.

GET THE WORD OUT AND MAKE SOME NOISE!

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

I'm Peter Lurvey, principal of St Aidan's Christan School, a grade 5-9 school.  We partner with Inner City Youth Alive, a Christian outreach organization that provides hope for families and kids.  We work in Winnipeg's tough North End.  How tough?  Within a mile of our little school, there were at least 5 murders in the last two years.  One Monday morning just last month, I came to school and there were police cars all over, looking for two young guys who had stabbed three people in a four block area around our school.  And it was only 9 in the morning.

Our kids have fallen through the cracks of normal schools - like a Grade 5 kid with math skills at Grade 1, or a Grade Seven kid reading at Grade 2. Some of our kids come to us out of the Manitoba Youth Centre - a youth jail.  

We have a small student/teacher ratio - 8 kids to one adult - so we can take time to teach the basics and get kids on to high school.  And we do this on less that 45% of what the local publics schools get per kid.  We are private "funded independent school," but we don't charge tuition.  We give kids breakfast and lunch every day of school.  And we are looking to expand to include new-comer kids who need to learn the basics of English and life in Canada.

What We Need & What You Get

As we grow, we are taking under our wings an "unfunded independent school" run by Francine, a woman who has been teaching new-comer kids - for no pay! - this past year.  Francine's kids are in the same boat as St Aidan's kids - not reading at grade level, headed for gangs, jail, exploitation, with no future and no hope.  Francine and her family sold their suburban home to buy and live in a building in the downtown core area of Winnipeg, so they could run a school for new-comer kids.

As we get ready for 36 new-comer kids at our satellite school in Winnipeg's Clavary Temple, we are figuring out staffing needs - Francine as Vice Principal, a teacher, some Education Assistants, and uh-oh!  We can't afford the Teacher of English as a Secodn or Other Language!  "No trouble," says Francine.  "Take my pay and let's hire that TOESOL teacher."  Finally, after being underpaid for two years, and NOT paid for a year, facing a modest $30,000 income, she says, "Take my pay."  

I would like you to help us pay Francine.  She has dedicated herself to Community literacy and development, helping new-comers learn to speak Englsih, to read, to do math, to do well in school - and many of these kids have NEVER been in school.   And now, on the verge of actully getting paid, she has said NO - give it to where it is needed.  So typical of her.  

Well, we need to pay Francine as our literacy resource person.  We need her to be actually, finally, PAID.  She is vital to our school and to our growth.  Will you help us pay Francine, so we can more effectively keep kids off the streets, out of gangs, off drugs, out of the sex trade?  

The Impact

Want to do something about those kids who drop out of school and get in deep with gangs, drugs, booze, getting pimped, jacking stuff, fighting, killing folks?  Help us give Francine a secure financial base, so she can actually get paid, instead of selflessly giving it up for another, for the sake of the kids.  

Maybe you teach or taught, and you always saw some kid with promise slip away as you had to tend to the 27 other kids in your class.  Give, so Francine can step in where you couldn't.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give to help us raise $30,000 to actually pay Francine, you know someone who can.  Could you share Francine's story with your friends, your folks, your boss, your gramma?  Could you help by sharing a link to this site?  Could you pray?  Ask God to move hearts and wallets?  Bless you.  Bless you.

story:
Hi, my name is Heather DiNunzio, I'm a Fashion Design major at Moore College of Art and Design, with a minor in Business. I would like to raise money through this campaign for my senior collection for Fashion Design. A senior collection for a Fashion Major is 5- 7 garments that were chosen from a larger collection of designs by a critic. From there, the garments chosen are made by the student, who is responsible for all expenses. This collection is the culmination of 4 years of education at Moore, and is one of the most important and critical things that the Fashion Industry looks at when they are looking to hire a designer. 

What I Need & What You Get

The expenses of my collection will be high, because I would like to design lingerie, using fabrics such as silk, satin, chiffon, brocade and damask. These fabrics can run for as much as $75 per yard. Fabric isn't the only thing that is used in clothing, however. Zippers, clasps, buttons, and other embellishments do add up in cost. I am also going to be responsible for providing my models with accesories, including shoes and any jewelry, make up products, and a hair stylist. I have estimated these costs to be about $2000 all together, if not more. 

The perks I am offering are as follows:

$1- Donation Box

You'll recieve my undying gratitude and a thank you email. 

$5- Manners Matter

You'll recieve a hand written, personalized thank you card from me.

$15- Helping Hands

You'll recieve a handmade cotton bag with a drawstring that is about 4" x 4". This can be used for whatever you want, I use them for jewelry.

$40- Designer, M.D.

You'll recieve a handmade, cutomized cotton scrub cap, perfect for anyone in the medical field, and also a thank you email. I've already made about 20 of these for doctors at ECMC Hospital in Buffalo, NY, and have gotten great reviews. 

$65- Dedicated Donor

You'll recieve all of the perks of "Designer, M.D." and "Helping Hands," as well as a handwritten thank you note. 

$100- Educational Enthusiast

Two (2) handmade, customized cotton scrub caps, and two (2) handmade cotton drawstring bags, as well as a handwritten thank you card.

Any extra funds will go towards further expenses of my education, including tuition costs.

The Impact

Any help that you can give me will allow me to get one step closer to achieving my dream of designing lingerie as a career. Thank you for anything you can do!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help financially, that's perfectly ok! Just get the word out about my campaign, and you can also use the Facebook and Twitter tools provided by Indiegogo. 

 

***UPDATE:
For those of you who choose to claim a perk that includes one or more scrub caps or jewelry bags, I'll get in touch with you via email once the campaign ends to discuss color choices. Thank you for your support!

story:
Dear Supporters, 

We are John, Guillermo, and Marina. We’re practitioners of Traditional Chinese medicine; which is the most ancient and well-developed form of holistic medicine. This is the art that includes acupuncture, herbal medicine, massage & body-work, dietary & lifestyle therapeutics, specialized exercises like tai chi & chi kung, and much more.

We live a humble but happy life in the mountains of Costa Rica, close to the city San Isidro del General. Our daily passion is to help our community throughdonation-based treatments & needed education. They return the favor with what they have: perhaps with eggs or bread, sharing their skills & labor, or by learning to treat others in return.

We have already helped countless people. Some patients come with simple cases, others present serious diseases, either case their health and quality of life have been improved significantly. Furthermore, we educate our patients, teaching them the necessary tools they need to achieve a healthy state of being.  

Unfortunately, our efforts are very limited since there are so many people in needand we lack a space sufficient to do our importantwork. Great treatments are not only about working on a person and then sending them away, but include teaching them about food, exercise, rest, and even the mental habits needed to achieve a state of transformative health and well-being.

These practical & inexpensive methods are truly the medicine of the people. We want to return this knowledge to them. For this is the power to heal themselves and those they love, and to prevent further reliance upon an overtaxed and underdeveloped system.

For these reasons we will create a community center of healing & education in the south of Costa Rica, a center that will encourage movement toward wellness, and will serve the community directly. Thanks to your generosity, we will open this center in January of 2014, near the city of San Isidro del General.

Your fundraising charity will be directed toward: renting a space, buying equipment and medical supplies, treatment tables and other furniture, equipment for educational videos, transport for visiting rural communities, the arrangement of daily exercise & meditation sessions, advertising, and practical courses teaching holistic medicine.

We also dedicate funds toward travel into the rural communities to treat & educate the wonderful people there. In these areas there is also an emphasis upon teaching simple organic methods of agriculture, because a vigorous ecology doesn't require harmful chemicals, and produces nourishing food.

Thank you so much for donating to this good cause. Your funds will benefit the local community directly & without extravagance. In fact, this project is already in motion, and your support is helping it become a strong, sustainable movement that will transform the lives of countless people.

Again, Thank you!

story:
Your donation supports the continued growth of a dynamic LGBTQ-led cultural movement sparked by alQaws. Join us as we build on the momentum of over a decade of grassroots and institutional organizing for individual, community, and social change, grounded in the specific history of Palestinian culture. By contributing to our fundraising campaign, you will support our growing gender and sexual diversity work in Palestinian society. Your donation provides alQaws with “core funding”--a reliable foundation to continue our work and ensure our sustainability.

Who We Are

alQaws for Sexual and Gender Diversity in Palestinian Society is the leading Palestinian LGBTQ organization (a formal non-governmental organization) and the only group working on both sides of the Green Line. We work directly with Palestinian civil society to create a sustainable, persistent, community-based social change movement. Active at every level of Palestinian civil society, alQaws supports resilient LGBTQ communities and leads civil society’s critical social engagement with sexual and gender diversity. Drawing from a wealth of activist, professional, and creative capacities, we incite social change on the issue of gender and sexual diversity in relation to broader political struggles and everyday life.

What We Do and Why

alQaws creates opportunities for critical, creative social engagement by creating strong networks, resilient LGBTQ communities, and more open and engaged civil society institutions. Working in multiple geographic locations on both sides of the Green Line (including Yaffa, East Jerusalem, Ramallah and Haifa), and within constraints on Palestinian mobility imposed by Israeli military occupation, we have initiated new partnerships with professional human rights workers, with youth and students, with artists and cultural workers, and with healthcare and education professionals.

alQaws develops diverse and previously non-existent support services for LGBTQ individuals, we organize activist-minded community-building groups, cultural events, and health initiatives, and we lead large-scale artistic cultural production and social change efforts that harness grassroots as well as institutional power. Our most recent direct engagements with civil society include: conducting collaborative research on current attitudes and practices with regard to gender and sexuality in professional civil society organizations; launching a creative multi-media (including original music, video, photography) project engaging youth and artists; and supporting a range of other innovative, creative, cultural and professional projects with women, trans, and youth activists.

Our experienced, critical view of our society affirms that issues of gender and sexuality permeate all aspects of human rights, political, and cultural work. alQaws prioritizes direct work with civil society actors comprised of formal NGOs, informal political and social groups and movements, cultural producers (like musicians and artists), and local media.

We have made significant progress toward our goals to increase and promote alternative approaches to sexual and gender discourse and visibility in Palestinian society and to pave the road for a social justice movement in which LGBTQ rights are recognized and accepted as integral to broader sexual and human rights. It is now more important than ever that alQaws—an LGBTQ Palestinian group—is supported in this work to achieve our desired social change, using strategies informed by our many years of experience and research.

Contribute to Our Vision for the Future

Your support helps alQaws sustain this incredible momentum and to continue expanding and strengthening our support and leadership groups, our leadership-building and educational projects, and our large-scale civil society networking and multimedia artistic and cultural projects. We are confident that our society is ready for alQaws and the issue of sexual and gender diversity to take a more large-scale and visible role in Palestinian society’s vision for social justice, and we hope you will join us.

The main concentrations of our current political projects include Individual wellbeing, Community-building, and large-scale artistic and cultural practice Social Change initiatives. Your donation directly funds these projects.

Individual Support & Services:

Our diverse individual services counteract the lack of counseling services available in Palestine society society that can adequately and positively address sexual and gender diversity and provide support for LGBTQ Palestinians.

  • Support Groups: LGBTQs in various locations meet bi-weekly for supportive discussion and creative exploration around issues of gender and sexual identity, facilitated by a professional counselor and an experienced alQaws activist. We help foster personal growth and a sense of belonging, creating opportunities for group members to repair connections between the self, family, and broader Palestinian civil society. (your $300 donation funds one support group meeting of 10 participants!)

  • National Hotline, or Listening and Information Line (www.alkhat.org): a peer-to-peer multi-platform (online and phone) support service run by a knowledgeable and friendly volunteer support line operator team that responds to calls and chats from LGBTQ individuals. (a $400 donation covers the cost of 2 weeks of support line promotion; $125 covers one half day of volunteer training!)

Building Palestinian LGBTQ Communities:

Our community-building groups, cultural events, and health initiatives promote healthy, strong, and sustainable LGBT social networks, counteracting a disparity of community-based support for open, tolerant and progressive discussions of sexual and gender diversity.

  • Leadership Groups: bi-weekly meetings provide a personal and intellectual space for LGBTQs to explore sexual and gender diversity through a feminist and queer framework. Groups connect individuals to social change initiatives through opportunities to expand newly-formed community networks through cultural and education workshops, meetings, and groups, including reading, writing, cinema clubs and organizational retreats.

  • West Bank Activities: including outreach work, queer youth initiatives, and queer and feminist book clubs in a newly opened safe space for activists. (a $600 donation covers one month of rent at the West Bank safe space)

  • “I Want You Safe”:  alQaws’ health initiative dedicated to producing accessible, friendly, and accurate health information and services for the LGBT community.

  • Palestinian Queer Parties: the largest Palestinian LGBTQ monthly gathering with Arabic Music, drag shows and upwards of 400 attendees (a generous $1,000 donation ensures one Queer Party is fully funded!)

Social Change:

Our large-scale social change efforts aim to harness grassroots power as well as institutional power to advance positive change in relation to gender and sexual issues amongst influential civil society institutions, youth and students, news media, and cultural producers.

  • Engaging Civil Society: Following recommended strategies in approaching civil society institutions resulting from our Human Rights institutions field research (including extensive interviews and a detailed report), a new Networking Coordinator will oversee the successful implementation of our new networking and training initiatives. These initiatives target civil society institutions, including NGO staff members of human rights, feminist, and health organizations, as we seek to spark their alignment with alQaws’ vision of a society-wide embrace of gender and sexual diversity.

  • Networking Coordinator, based in our new Haifa Office: this new position and new space foster and manage the large and growing network of activists joining alQaws. The Networking Coordinator will lead our social change civil society networking initiatives. (your $150 donation pays for one week of rent at our new Haifa Office!)

  • Multi-Media & Music: Our popular music and creative multi-media project, Ghanni A’an Ta’arif / “Singing Sexuality” (www.ghanni.net), engages youth and students on issues of gender and sexuality diversity, identity, political engagement and society. This project builds on the unprecedented massive collaborative artist and activist production we began last year, which included our first full album of original songs, a live album-release concert, and the creation of an interactive online multimedia platform. Your support helps us foster the creation of additional content (including but not limited to songs) for ghanni.net and other media outlets, to address innovative, open and positive discourse on gender and sexual diversity through multi-media community-based production workshops (on animation, documentary, and writing) as well as to expand the existing multimedia online platform for increased distribution, promotion and interactivity. (Fund one new original song with your $400 donation!)

  • Local media: a brand new initiative to encourage local Arabic-language journalists and popular online, print, and radio platforms to write articles that will inspire crucial systematic public analysis of taboo sexuality related issues, including homosexuality and a local discourse of queer identity, politics, and representation.

Support these exciting projects with your donation!

More About the Context in Which We Work

alQaws work crosses locations, media, societal and political boundaries to incite broad social change. Our progress at each level of our work—Individual, Community, Social Change—directly supports building the society we envision, particularly through the connections fostered between these levels. For instance, we mobilize individuals to build community and advocate for the kind of social change that in turn celebrates individual diversity, cultural tradition, and the participation of all members of society.

We continue to experience the impact of alQaws’ increasing local and global political role with a growing number of new members, the international visibility of alQaws’ vocal critique of Israeli misuses of queer issues in the region, and the growing regional and global awareness of our work as an important aspect of broader Palestinian social justice. Thus, we also aim to demonstrate and inspire the inclusion of issues related to gender and sexual diversity as part of broader social justice organizing, and therefore to combat perceptions that LGBTQ organizing is a separate, irrelevant, or foreign form of political, cultural and social action.

We cannot work towards sexual liberation within our communities without addressing the broader liberation of the Palestinian people.To understand the context for our struggle and our evolving strategies, the material and conceptual effects of the ongoing Israeli occupation must be acknowledged.  Our experience of the Occupation testifies to the fact that occupation does not differentiate between LGBTQ and non-LGBTQ Palestinians, and in fact actively contaminates inter-personal relationships and larger political processes. Israeli-imposed military occupation practices, including borders and apartheid walls, impacts and constrains our daily activities and long-term goals.

We continue to work to counteract oppressive structures of racism, socio-economic injustice, militarism, sexism and homophobia that disproportionately affect Palestinians, and to combat pervasive entrenched hierarchical working practices in the most influential institutions working in and with Palestinian societies. Moreover, since our work directly speaks with and to Palestinian society, our work at every level challenges deep-rooted misperceptions and taboos about sexual and gender identity, including homosexuality.

Your donation funds alQaws’ ability to harness this transformative power and to build a sustainable social change movement with LGBTQ communities and sexual and gender diversity at its core.

story:
For the past few years, we have desired to work more closely with the people of Southeast Asia. Through our experiences working with refugees, we have developed a passion to reach out to the beautiful people of this region and empower them through the outlets of education and community development.

This summer, we have an opportunity to do just that, by spending six weeks in Northern Thailand!  Ricky, a first grade teacher, will be using his skills in education and information technology to support the work of an international school in Chiang Rai.  Amy, a graduate student in public health, will be working with a local organization to expand community health services to rural villagers in Thailand.  This is a dream come true for us, and we would love for you to be a part of our journey!

In order to make this happen, we need help to cover the costs of plane tickets and some minor expenses while we are there.  Living expenses in Thailand will be fairly cheap--it's the plane tickets that bear the brunt of the cost.  All of the funds we raise will go directly to covering those basic costs for us to go to Thailand this summer.  Even if we don't raise the total amount, it will still help us to cover costs that we wouldn't otherwise be able to afford (we are a school teacher and a graduate student, after all).

Education and health are some of the most valuable tools for raising people out of poverty and empowering them to reach their fullest potential.  This is what we want to accomplish while we are in Thailand this summer--not simply doing something for someone else, but helping them to realize what they can accomplish on their own.  That's what we're about: raising people up in dignity, speaking life and encouragement over them, and providing them with resources for future success and wellbeing.  

We are also going to Thailand as learners, recognizing that there is so much that we can learn from the experts within these communities about providing education and community health in a different cultural context.  This will be an invaluable lesson for us and will shape us in our future goals of international community development.

Thank you for joining with us on our journey!

For the past few years, we have desired to work more closely with the people of Southeast Asia. Through our experiences working with refugees, we have developed a passion to reach out to the beautiful people of this region and empower them through the outlets of education and community development.
This summer, we have an opportunity to do just that, by spending six weeks in Northern Thailand!  Ricky, a first grade teacher, will be using his skills in education and information technology to support the work of an international school in Chiang Rai.  Amy, a graduate student in public health, will be working with a local organization to expand community health services to rural villagers in Thailand.  This is a dream come true for us, and we would love for you to be a part of our journey!


In order to make this happen, we need help to cover the costs of plane tickets and some minor expenses while we are there.  Living expenses in Thailand will be fairly cheap--it's the plane tickets that bear the brunt of the cost.  All of the funds we raise will go directly to covering those basic costs for us to go to Thailand this summer.  Even if we don't raise the total amount, it will still help us to cover costs that we wouldn't otherwise be able to afford (we are a school teacher and a graduate student, after all).


Education and health are some of the most valuable tools for raising people out of poverty and empowering them to reach their fullest potential.  This is what we want to accomplish while we are in Thailand this summer--not simply doing something for someone else, but helping them to realize what they can accomplish on their own.  That's what we're about: raising people up in dignity, speaking life and encouragement over them, and providing them with resources for future success and wellbeing.  
We are also going to Thailand as learners, recognizing that there is so much that we can learn from the experts within these communities about providing education and community health in a different cultural context.  This will be an invaluable lesson for us and will shape us in our future goals of international community development.
Thank you for joining with us on our journey!

story:
Our Campaign

Hello, I'm Gerry Steinhauer, one of the Directors of EyePAT. We are a not for profit Community Interest Company and are dedicated to keeping children, young people, vulnerable adults and adults safe online and free from bullying.

The film that you have just watched graphically illustrates the impact that bullying and in particular cyberbullying can have. Our workshops deal with these issues in schools across the UK and our campaign, if it reaches it's target, will take over 5000 children out of the firing line.

We intend to provide 60 free anti bullying workshops to schools across the UK during Anti Bullying week 18th to 22nd November 2013.


Why run this campaign

Currently 49% of children will be bullied during their school lives. It is estimated that at least 20 children and adolescents a year commit suicide because of being bullied – this is a conservative estimate based on documented cases known to BeatBullying. It is likely that the actual number is higher, perhaps much higher. (These figures also do not take into account the numbers of young people who attempt suicide but survive.)

According to the National Bullying Survey, more than half of those who reported being bullied had been physically hurt (parents report over 71%); 34% of those physically hurt required attention from a doctor or hospital. 3% of the attacks involved a weapon.

All of the above children have one thing in common, they have all taken their own lives and their deaths are linked to chronic bullying.

The Impact

Happy Kids Don’t Bully workshops are the missing link in anti bullying strategies.

Schools current strategies contain :

  • What bullying is
  • Why bullying is wrong
  • The need to take action to report it if you see it
  • Support for victims using many resources
  • Specialised support staff
  • Peer mentoring / bully buddies
  • Counselling services
  • Suspension or exclusion

The missing link is: Why does the bully bully?

Which is why our program was created.

Its purpose is to get to the root of the problem...... to find out why the bully is bullying and then get them the help they need to stop. We achieve this by allowing the entire group to explore bullying as a concept, the reasons that a bully may have for being one and identifying ways for helping the bully deal with these reasons. 

By the end of the workshop the group as a whole will be aware of why the bully they have been afraid of is doing what they do and how to help them to stop. This is not a pity party and definitely not an easy ride for the bully. They have been made to confront (without being identified) their own background situation, have seen their power over the group disappear and potentially discovered why they act as they do.

If you don’t have a bully you don’t have any victims!!

Happy Kids Don't Bully workshops make it much more difficult for a bully to operate!

Every contribution is valuable - £5 is just as important as £500.
It all gets added to the pot and helps us in our final aim of raising sufficient money to deliver 60 anti bullying workshops at no cost to schools, children's homes and other organisations who would otherwise not be able to afford them.

Your contributions will help to prevent over 5000 schoolchildren from suffering at the hands of bullies during their school lives. Just as importantly your money will also help those same bullies to get the help they need to deal with their issues and stop bullying. We need to raise £25,000 to fund this initiative and create some real improvements in the lives of our children.

Every £300 raised will provide an anti bullying kit for 1 school which will potentially take up to 200 children out of the bullying firing line.
£600 can be used to provide a tutor led day of anti bullying workshops plus a parents session so they know what to look out for.  

Your contributions will provide both of the following:


30 anti bullying workshop kits - these retail at £300 each

These kits come complete with training DVD and full detailed pre and post workshop lesson plans so schools and other organisations can run them in-house.

This is a complete package and includes 4 separate sessions for all ages from Year 1 (4) to Year 13 (18) plus a parental workshop and a whole school assembly presentation. There are follow up workbooks, school and pupil pledges and letters for parents. Young People like to be rewarded for working hard and we provide Trophies, Balloons and Stickers to achieve this.

30 anti bullying tutor led workshop days - these retail at £600 each

The workshops will be led by our highly experienced tutors and include everything that the workshop kits provide plus
  • the tutor(s)
  • up to 4 workshops on the same day
  • an optional parental internet safety and anti bullying workshop in the evening to help parents to better understand what their children see, do and experience.

Your rewards for contributing


All contributors details will be added to a specific contributions page on our website and given to the recipients.

You will also receive a certificate of thanks signed by all the recipient organisations.

You will be able to take up an offer of up to a 15% reduction in the cost of a workshop for your own nominated organisation. This can be a school, a company, children's services organisations, charities etc.. We will provide the workshop of your choice which is relevant to the organisation you nominate.

Our target is 60 free workshops however, we will provide as many free workshops as the funding appeal total allows. If we exceed our target we will increase the number of workshops to match the funding total.

That is a challenge we would love to have to cope with!

Other Ways You Can Help

Contributions are the lifeblood of our campaign but we realise that to achieve our aims we need many contributors giving a little so please pass this message on to as many people as you can.

topping bullying shouldn't be based on the ability to pay. Lets make Anti Bullying week the week you helped to stop bullying and kept a child safe!

Stop children being permanently mentally scarred or even committing suicide because they can't cope.

The more we raise the more children we can protect so tell everyone that you know and use the indiegogo share tools to take this campaign viral!


Help us to make a difference in the lives of our children!!

Thank you

story:
Our Story

What's up? My name is Kristopher Johnson, and I'm from Fairfax County, VA. I'm the Founder/Creative Director of T.M.E.S. (The Movement Entrepreneur Society). My company is inspired by every thing that I love, and turning those things into a business. I'm driven by hip-hop, success, fashion, and especially seeing those around me succeed. My main talent is seeing the talent in others, and motivating them to start pursuing their passion. I believe one should do what they love, and love what they do.


My program is 100% free for all creative high school students that want to get into the entertainment industry. These young people could be anything from aspiring recording artists and video directors, all the way to amazing graphic artists. Or, simply a kid who just wants to start their own fashion label. The goal behind our campaign, which I'm calling, "Access Granted," is to raise money for computers/laptops (for our graphic designers), music equipment (microphones, speakers, etc.), and to upgrade our studio for professional quality. In the end, we'll have dozens of kids working in synergy. Our young graphic designers will be designing the album covers for our young recording artists, and our young photographers will be taking photos at the parties our young promoters will be hosting. It's simply genius.


With my team of business partners behind me, we want to do an amazing thing for our community. The program will be broken up into 4 different departments: "Business Arts," "Recording Arts," "Creative Arts," and "Marketing." Let me break down a little more exactly how it's going to work:


  1. Business Arts - I will lead this portion of the program. I'll be working with participants who all have a different goal to obtain, but which coincides with the entertainment industry. These participants will include party promoters, talent managers, participants that are looking to start their own record label, or even a magazine. I will help them construct a business plan, and give them real life experience by working with the "Recording Arts," and "Creative Arts" departments. I will guide the party promoters, and show them how to book venues, and work out profit splits with club owners. I'll oversee them, but allow them to plan, market, and promote on their own. I already have a great knowledge in doing this, and here's an example: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BdnqycZ0Hzw. Recap: http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_pro...
  2. Recording Arts - This section will be led by Richard "Lyricks" Lee, and Kyle Higgenbothom. Lyricks is the owner of the "SuperNova" studio in Fairax, VA, which we will be running our program out of. He is a phenomenal music artist, whom which has been on tour with the famous rap group, Wu-Tang Clan. Kyle is the lead vocalist for the band "Footwork," and both of these teammates are also from Fairfax County, VA. They will be working with a mixture of young musicians, music producers, disc jockeys, and audio engineers. They will help guide the producers to make the most professional sounding beats possible, further allowing them to choose the best options for their album. They will guide the engineers to do all of the post-production work to make the album sound as crisp and clean as possible. At the end of the program, they will put together a showcase for all of the artists to perform on a stage, and release their material to their peers. As a team, we will also hold workshops with the connections that all of the T.M.E.S. directors have in the area. These workshops will consist of bringing out artists who are already established in the entertainment industry to talk about their story, and what it took for them to make a name for themselves. *For more information on Lyricks, please visit http://www.writelyricks.com/*
  3. Creative Arts - Collin "C.O." O'Brien will be the head here. C.O. is the Owner/Creative Director, and photographer at "Clockwise Clothing." Another Northern Virginia resident, and James Madison University graduate, C.O. will be working with teens that have interests ranging from graphic design, illustration, fashion design, video editing, and photography. He'll help edit/shoot videos, design logos, and much more. Working with the "Recording Arts" program, he'll help build portfolios and gather an ideal amount of material, which will either help participants start up their own business, or help them apply for work/school in their desired craft. *For more information on C.O., please visit http://clockwiseclothing.com/mens.htm*
  4. Marketing - To make sure we're getting the word out properly, there's no better way than to have the social media scene covered. Brandon "B-Wall" Wallace will be in charge of this task. Between Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, and sites such as IndieGoGo, he plans on making sure that these specific forms of communication are taken care of. Updating our audience with the latest information about our artists, events, and news, will be his main focus. B-Wall is the Chief Branding Designer at http://www.bwall.com/.


When it's all said and done, we will showcase all of our artists by having them put on a full performance, and also have copies of their newly packaged CD's available to the public. We will have the Creative Arts department design the flyers, shoot the promotional videos for the finale ceremony, as well as the recap video. We will have the Business Arts department plan the entire show, as well as find the venue, and promote the entire concert/graduation.


We are all great friends, and I really feel like we have the best team in the area. We want to give young people an opportunity to follow their dreams, and create a platform where they can succeed. We want to show them that if you believe in yourself, anything is possible. There's more to life than sex, drugs, alcohol, and a 9-5 job. We're ready to work with these young people, and put our city on the map like never before. We will focus on the D.C., Maryland and Virginia area, and our start date target is January 1, 2012. Join us in this movement, help us change lives, and let's start giving back to the future.


The Impact

The impact we will be making is simple, yet monumental. We're giving talented young people an opportunity to use their abilities that they have been blessed with. There is countless amounts of talent in our community, yet not enough people willing to help guide it. This is a chance for kids to make something of themselves, while it's also an opportunity for everyone else to support the youth, and tomorrow's leaders.


The last thing we want to do is crush a child's dream. If we do not succeed with this campaign, all of our efforts to help groom these children will be shattered. We won't have the necessary tools to help these kids, and nobody wins in the long run. Help us help them, so that we all succeed.


What We Need & What You Get

As I briefly mentioned above, we're looking to raise money for computers, laptops/refurbished iMacs, a conference table, chairs/stools, Final Cut Pro software, Photoshop software, Pro Tools software, cameras, microphones, speakers, money to rent out venues for our performers, etc. All of this will be put directly into the company, and used to help develop our young participants. The computers will be for our graphic artists, the microphones will be for our recording artists, and so on. If we do not reach our entire goal, we're also looking into other sites such as Indiegogo.com. We want to make sure that we raise enough money to have the tools necessary to support the kids. We won't stop until we reach our goal.


Perks?


$5 donation - You'll get a shout out in the next T.M.E.S. video that will be blasted all over our corresponding social media sites! (Facebook, Twitter, etc.)


$25 donation - You'll receive a copy of our first participant's album, "Accidentally Good" by Zach Swartz, along with a shout out in our next video!


$50 donation - Video shout out, a copy of "Accidentally Good," and our hot seller "Give Back to the Future" tee! http://a5.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-snc6/226670_10100228894815432_68122513_47769754_1906736_n.jpg


$100 donation - Video shout out, "Accidentally Good" album, "Give Back to the Future" tee, and the "SuperNova" Studios tee! http://hphotos-iad1.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ash4/294050_170461653040668_100002305040018_338368_993909839_n.jpg


$250 donation - Every thing mentioned above, plus signed copies of all of our students' albums who will end up graduating our program!


$1,000 donation - Every thing mentioned above, plus Lyricks will perform at your next event! (DC, Maryland, VA areas only).


$5,000 donation - Every thing mentioned above, plus Lyricks and the band Footwork will perform at your next event! (Nationwide - We will provide our own transportation/equipment).


*Lyricks sample performance - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nQ2EgbYOTj4. Footwork sample performance - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zoEMkcTy46k

Other Ways You Can Help

Social media is huge! Please do what you can through the "IndieGoGo" site. Use word of mouth. Tell your friends, and your family. Blast our cause on Facebook and Twitter, and don't stop until everybody you know, knows! This is hands down, the coolest, most amazing idea of our generation, and we need your help! Thank you!
