The Human Experience, however, is so much more than a school.  It a space where students can learn, create, and dream in a family context.  It is a vehicle by which we can explore the ways a school can impact a city, and not the other way around.  It is an exploration of the question, "What does it mean to be human?"  A question that, if studied nationwide, could change the way we do education forever.
THE Orlando is one of a kind school with amazingly gifted students.  And we need your help to build it.   What We Need & What You Get The school budget for our first year is $385,000.  We have spent the summer designing the school and speaking to private and corporate donors, yet we still need a substantial amount of funding to open the school on time.  All initial funds raised on IndieGoGo will go toward school expenses, which include uniforms, computers, software, school supplies, meals, field trips, books, and library resources.
As part of our model, each parent is required to pay something towards his or her child's education.  We calculate each family's tuition fees using a sliding income scale.  These tuition fees, coupled with funds raised by private and corporate donors, will total $210,000 ($7000 x 30 students).  This means we need to raise an additional $175,000 in order to meet our school goals.
If we raise ___________________, your generous gifts will help us provide:
$25,000 - Classroom Furniture & Operational Expenses$60,000 - Uniforms & Two Classroom Paraprofessionals$84,000 - Part Time Office Manager, Educational Software, Teacher Computers, Teacher Cell Phones (teachers will be available for homework calls each night)$99,000 - Smart Boards, Mac Pro with Creative Suite Software, Office Copy Machine$125,000 - Office Manager (convert to full-time)$155,000 - Student Computers, Software, and Student Collaboration Lab Furniture$175,000 - Student Field Trips
In return for your financial support, we have created some great Perks for you, including monthly publications, interactive art, personalized songs, a custom Personal Playbook of your own, and much more!



  The Impact Your financial support will:


Empower Students.  Every day, our students will wake up, dress in professional attire, and join the hundreds of movers and shakers that converge on the downtown area.  Each student will become an advocate for his or her family, neighborhood, and community in a place where decisions are traditionally made for them.  They will be empowered, for the rest of their lives, by the knowledge that their voice and their presence carry weight, significance, and impact in the spaces around them. They will discover how they can uniquely add value to the city they call home.

Teach Students to Invest.  The Human Experience strives to not only serve the community, but to also invest in it. We have a shared vision for our city and believe we can contribute to its long-term health and success.  As a school we understand our role in the greater Orlando community, in both the downtown business district and our local neighborhoods.  Students will be encouraged to dream about the future of their city, create solutions to complex problems, and ultimately shape the culture in life-giving ways.  We desire to lay roots in our city’s rich soil, producing stability, protection, and fruit that will benefit its citizens for generations to come. 

Set a New Course.  Over the course of the school year all students will create a working "Personal Playbook," a detailed life plan designed to give each student a clear view of his or her talents, desires, and life goals.  This will enable students to view their education, their interests, and their passions in the context of their greater life story, changing their future career from an endpoint to a pathway to a healthy, meaningful life.  Our students will be empowered with a straight path from Point A to Point B and beyond. 


Posit a Powerful, Game-Changing Question.  "What does it mean to be human?" The Human Experience is a school designed to explore this question, its implications on the education of children, and its overall effect on our families, our communities, and our world.  THE sets itself apart with the belief that each child possesses an inherent right to dignity, respect, and honor, regardless of his or her academic performance, personal struggles, or disciplinary history. This core belief guides everything we do; from the way we structure our daily schedule to our dynamic classroom instruction.  It also affects the ways we interact with others in the community, especially those we perceive as being "different" from us.  We believe an individual's answer to this question reflects his or her beliefs about human life and indicates his or her ability to make competent decisions that value personhood.  


Widen Our Impact.  We believe in the spirit of cooperation.  We recognize that we are connected to the schools around us, whether public, private, or charter, and believe our actions as a school directly affect our brother and sister schools.  We view this as a great responsibility and desire to be an educational resource and source of inspiration for surrounding schools, teachers, and students.   Our model is unique, diverse, and broad in scope, and is designed to be implemented in any school across the country.  This means thousands upon thousands of children and young adults will have access to the practices, resources, and values that we use in our classrooms.


  Risks & Challenges The Human Experience was birthed from a pure desire to preserve and protect our school family.  However, it didn't take us long to understand the gravity of our decision to create a school.  There was no guarantee that our students would be able to follow us.  There was no guarantee that people would support us. There was no guarantee that we would have jobs.
However, our parents and students believed and they stand with us today.  The people we have shared our story with believe.  And we continue to work hard, believing that we will be teaching our kids at the beginning of the school year.
Like our students, the odds were stacked against us from the beginning, but time and time again doors have opened and the people have stepped up to support us. We are an underdog in this fight, but we are stubbornly committed to giving our kids the education and the experiences they deserve.  We are willing to work longer hours and more school days because we know these children on a deep level and we believe in them.
We cannot overcome this challenge without you.  Please consider joining us on our journey to strengthen our little family and positively impact our city.  Thank you for believing in us.  We are so grateful for your support.
  Other Ways You Can Help Even if you can't financially contribute, there are a variety of things you can do to help us on our journey: 

Spread the Word.  If you believe in what we are doing, pass along our story!  IndieGoGo makes it easy to share our campaign through social media.  Over the course of the campaign we will be releasing a series of videos that you can share on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and Google Plus.

Tell an Educator.   Teachers stick together.  If you know someone who works in the field of education, let them know about what we are doing.  They know firsthand the challenges that our school will face in the year ahead. 
Check Out Our Website.  Our website, theorlando.org, has a variety of resources including our mission, our backgrounds, and a donor prospectus.  There's more to the story.  Go check it out!

story:
Our Story

    Erie Basin Resource Conservation and Development (EBRC&D) is a regional organization governed by a local body, covering ten counties in North Central Ohio. Erie Basin was formed to improve the environment and economy of the area. EBRC&D is  a 501(c)3  non-profit organization. 

    EBRC&D has partnered with other conservation organizations providing funding for many worthwhile programs. As part of our conservation outreach we developed S. K. Worm, a six foot tall animatronics earth worm. S. K. Worm is the USDA Natural Resource Conservation Service mascot. A spin off of this project is the S. K. Worm Coloring and Activity books.     

Watch S. K. Worm sing about his passion for soil education!


    Soils are one of the most important natural resources we have in Ohio. The Ohio Department of Education has created Earth Science standards for soils for elementary grade students. Educators need professional resource tools, like the S.K. Worm books, to help teach complex subjects like soil composition, soil conservation, and soil biology. 

The Details

    This project consists of supplying as many copies as possible of the S. K. Worm coloring and activity books to kindergarten and third grade students’  respectively. 

    Information about S. K. Worm can be found at: http://eriebasinrcd.org/skworm.html

    The initial project goal covers EBRC&D’s ten County area. Approximately 15,250 books will be distributed to over 575 classes. The books will help kindergarten and third grade educators in teaching soil structure, soil biology, soil and food relationship, and the importance of this country’s greatest natural resource; its soil.

    Celebrate the International Year of Soil (2015) with us by supporting Operation Soil Education. Information about the International Year of Soils can be found at: www.fao.org/soils-2015/en/.  Check out the video below.


   Our goal is to have these books available to students the week before December 5th "World Soil Day". 

                  


    Having a worm explain soils from its perspective will help educators teach soils in an informative and fun way. The S. K. Worm books will serve as a catalyst to increase student awareness and improve student achievement in Department of Education Earth Science standards for soils. The vast majority of students in Ohio have not had the opportunity to grow up on a working farms and therefor do not have a solid soil food connection. 
    Your donation will help the youth understand that soil is a complex ecosystem that drives life on the planet, that food originates from the soil, not from supermarkets, teach the physical characteristics of soil, and explain how soil can be conserved with proper management. These students will be the decision makers of the future.  It is important for them to understand the value of soil and all it provides. Your gift will also help the students to be better land managers when they grow up.
    We decided to hold our campaign in April because Global soil week is April 19-23, below is their video.

The Cost

    EBRC&D has already paid to have the S. K. Worm books developed, so the cost of the books will only be .35 cents for the activity book and .40 cents for the coloring book. Total funding needed will be $5,758. This includes the cost of printing the book, coordinating distribution, postage, administration and a $40.00 set up charge and $0.05 per book to print recognition for those who donate $5,000 or more.     

    We will add adjacent counties if we exceed our funding goals. Wouldn't it be great if we could cover the whole state?  Only $110,625 to reach over 290,000 Ohio children.

    If we do not meet our funding goal we will seek other funding options to supplement what we raise, If we are still unable to achieve our goal we will reduce our total distribution to each county by the percentage of our goal missed.    

The Perks    

    Besides the satisfaction of knowing you are having a positive impact on future decision makers, we are also offering great perks. Our perks are high quality unique one of a kind promotional items that were developed for the S. K. Worm project. Photos of the perks can be viewed by clicking the Gallery tab above.

Past Success

    Erie Basin RC&D has had the opportunity to work on many conservation projects over the last 22 years. Examples of some of our success would include our annual  mini grant program where EBRC&D provides 6-8 grants of $250 - $750 to local conservation organizations, EBRC&D's Discover  Your World field day for Migrant Worker's Children has been well attended for the past 13 years. EBRC&D developed a six foot tall animatronics earth worm S. K. Worm. The S. K. stands for scientific knowledge.  Since his arrival SK has performed 162 days at 104 events. He has made presentations to 38 schools, 126 classes and 3,168 students. Over 41,216 adults and 33,902 children have enjoyed learning about this country’s greatest natural resource, its soil. S. K. has traveled over 9,307 miles visiting 38 counties and 2 states. S. K. Worm is transported in a trailer modified with a wrap showing a cross section of the state of Ohio starting on the shores of Lake Erie and ending on the banks of the Ohio River. Ohio Geology, Ohio energy sources, and conservation practices are depicted on the trailer.

    Erie Basin RC&D is pleased it has been able to make such a valuable contribution to conservation education through its many outreach projects. In recent years however EBRC&D has experienced the elimination of State and Federal support to the point that Operation Soil Education would not be possible without the generous support of people like you.

Wrap Up

    We understand that you may not be able to make a contribution at this time, but you can still be a big help by making sure your friends and family know about our campaign.

    Ask not what the soil can do for you but rather what you can do for the soil! Helping fund this campaign would be a great start!

    Remember save a worm, go fly fishing!


Questions:

Can I write-off my contribution with my taxes?
    Yes, Erie Basin RC&D is registered as a public 501(c)(3) nonprofit, with a circle of diamonds designation.  Erie Basin RC&D’s tax ID number 34-1689182.

How can I get a tax deductible receipt?
    When you contribute, you will receive an email from FirstGiving (Indiegogo’s nonprofit payments processor) confirming your contribution.  This email receipt can be used for tax deductible purposes. For all contributions over $500, you will receive an official receipt for tax-reporting purposes by email after the campaign ends.

What payment methods do you accept? 
    Indiegogo only accepts major credit cards.

Can I donate from outside the USA? 
    Absolutely! Indiegogo only accepts international credit cards.

How can I make a contribution over $5,000? 
    The nonprofit payment processor (FirstGiving) that is handling the transactions for this campaign is able to accept direct wire transfers for contributions of over $5,000. If you are interested in making a large contribution through a wire transfer to FirstGiving, please contact us at eriebasinrcd@yahoo.com. We’ll connect you with a specialist at Indiegogo who will assist you with the contribution transfer process.

Is shipping included? 
    Yes

Does international shipping cost extra? 
    Yes, but Indiegogo doesn’t allow us to add any extra shipping to the perks, so it is included in the suggested donation price.

I have more questions. Who do I ask? 
    Please email us at eriebasinrcd@yahoo.com to ask your question. We’ll get back to you as soon as we can.

story:
"One of Our Students Told Us They'd Rather Play With Robotics Than Video Games After Coming To a KidStarter Class"


In everything we do, we believe in creating a brighter future for tomorrow. We believe that when uncertainty lies ahead, innovation is necessary. 

The way that we create a brighter future is by providing a space where kids are not only engaged, but are also challenged to make something from next to nothing. Whether turning a banana into a keyboard or learning how to conduct electricity with pink play dough, we empower kids to bring their imagination into existence within a supportive community that nurtures their hearts and minds. By cultivating a love for STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics) topics, children are introduced to a world where the possibilities they create can be put into action. Where there is action, meaningful change can happen. 

Your Funding Will Enable:

We started hosting instructor-led classes in Dallas in early 2014 to only a few students. Within 10 months, the classes exceeded full capacity. One of our classes in October 2014 had over 100 students. Organizations in Boston and LA and other major US cities have called us but we need your help to scale! 

Your funds will help us to support the Maker Movement in the following ways:

  • Create an Online Marketplace for Makers (60% of the Fund) The best courses come from makers themselves. We want to create a platform for makers to submit their projects and we'll handle the supply chain and delivery, while paying makers for their ideas.  
  • Hire More Teachers (40% of the Fund): We can't afford to fly teachers from Dallas to teach in other cities so we need to hire and train more teachers in more cities. We'll start with Boston and LA first. 

Here is what a Kid learn from one of Kidstarter Class

1st Step, they look through all the "raw material" of the product. 

2nd Step, they work with their peers or parents! and They work really hard and focused. 


3rd Step, they put them together so it will start walking and a smile on their face! 




Thank You!

Please help us support the Maker Movement and continue to inspire kids to geek out, have fun, and be themselves! We consider it a blessing to have made it this far and need your help so we can do all the things we need to do, and do them well. 

#NationOfMakers

"This is a country that imagined a railroad connecting a continent, imagined electricity powering our cities and towns, imagined skyscrapers reaching into the heavens, and an Internet that brings us closer together.  So we imagined these things, then we did them.  And that’s in our DNA.  That’s who we are.  We’re not done yet.  And I hope every company, every college, every community, every citizen joins us as we lift up makers and builders and doers across the country"

President Obama

Remarks at the White House Maker Faire, National Day of Making on June 18, 2014


Our Team:


Perks!

#IAmAMaker T-shirt

 

Insect Bot

Build an intelligent insect from a kit! You can program it to walk or turn.



Frequently Asked Questions

Is KidStarter a non-profit? Can I write off my contribution on my taxes? 
KidStarter is a for profit organization.

Does KidStarter have any major donors?
KidStarter is 100% privately funded, and it was a business incubated by DFW Excellerator, which specializes in helping start-ups accelerate their business. We've gone as far as we can on our own which is why we need your help!


Can I donate from outside the USA?

Absolutely! Indiegogo  accepts international credit cards, We can also take Paypal payment


What payment methods do you accept?

Indiegogo accepts all major credit cards and paypal


Big Thanks to Our Community Supporters!

story:
For English scroll down

לעברית לך למטה


                       Przyjaciele!

Wspólnie z bratem napisaliśmy książkę o polskich korzeniach Izraela. Na dzień dzisiejszy mamy 500 stron maszynopisu, dużo oryginalnych zdjęć i niepublikowanych materiałów. Książka to efekt 7 lat pracy, zbierania materiałów z archiwów w Austrii, Polsce, Ukrainie i w Izraelu. Jeśli wszystko przebiegnie bez kłopotów  to pozycja ukaże się nakładem wydawnictwa "Austeria". 

Wiecie jak duzy był wkład Polaków w budowę Izraela?, Czy wiecie, że w przedwojennej Polsce budowano kibuce służące jako ośrodki szkoleniowe przed emigracją? Wiedzieliście, że to w Polsce urodził się pierwszy premier Izraela i wielu innych polityków, którzy przeszli do historii?  Jeśli na co najmniej jedno pytanie odpowiedzieliście przecząco - wspomóżcie ten projekt. Odkryjmy razem ten kawałek historii Polski i Izraela. Jeśli możecie wspomóc projekt nawet najmniejszą wpłatą - świetnie, jeśli nie- udostępnijcie ten post u siebie, to również będzie duża pomoc. Dzięki!!!


Hello everyone! 


Who are we?

I was volunteering in a Kubbutz in Arava Valey. I was working on a farm cows, waking up every morning at 3.30 and milking the cows as a pro:) I've met many good people. I came back changed. Better person. New born.

My brother works at University in Cracow,  He teaches History and he already published a few books - "The Jews in Cracow. Study of the Elite of the city. 1850-1918" as well as book about the Freemasonry in Cracow.

And dozens articles....

Me and my brother we collect money so we can finish our project that has started 7 years ago. We wrote a book about "Polish roots of Israel". In our book you can find stories about Zionists from Poland that built Israel, documents from archives from Ukraine - never published before, information about Kibbutzim that were built in Poland and then used as training camps for youth  before they emigrated to Erec and many others. It's finished now and it has 500 pages. We just need more money to close everything. We have initial agreement with Publishing House ("Austeria" - they printed in polish "Jewish State" by Theodor Herzl"). Everything goes the right direction and the plan is to publish it in the Spring 2015. If we achieve to collect enough money we would really like to print it in Hebrew and in English as well. As you know translation and other expenses costs a lot of money and we already spent a fortune for researches in Austria, Ukraine, Poland and Israel.


Even 1$ will be much appreciate!


!!!!! חברים וחברות


מי אנחנו? התנדבתי שנה בקיבוץ שבעמק ארבה. גרתי עם קיבוצניקים, עבדתי ברפת, כל יום קמתי ב3.30 בבוקר והלכתי לחלוב פרות - זה היה שנה טובה ביותר בחיים שלי. אוכל בחדר אוכל, אש במדבר. הכרתי אנשים טובים, ולמדתי הרבה מהם. חזרתי משם בן אדם אחר , כאילו נולדתי עוד פעם.

אח שלי עובד באוניברסיטה הפדגוגי בקרקוב, הוא מלמד היסטוריה והוא כבר כתב כמה ספרים בין היתר - "היהודים בקרקוב. המחקר על האליטה של העיר 1918-1850" וספר על התולדות של הבונים החפשיים בקרקוב.

אנחנו מכינים לפירסום את הספר "השורשים הפולניים של ישראל". אנחנו מתכננים להופיע אותו באביב הקרוב עם הוצאת "אוסטריה". הם פרסמו בפולנית "מדינת היהודים" מאת בנימין זאב הרצל. הספר מיועד לקהל רחב שמעניינים גם בהיסטוריה וגם בהווה של ישראל. ספר הוכן קודם כל בשביל תלמידים, עיתונאים, אנשים עסקים, דיפלומטים, תיירים וצליינים. ספר נגמר, יש לו 500 עמודים. ספר שלנו כולל מסמכים מאוקראינה שלא פירסמו לפני. המסמכים האלה קשורים עם ארגונים הראשונים הציונים שהיו באירופה מרכז-מזרח, ומנציחים ההשגים של ציוניים מאזור הזה. אתם גם תמצאו תיאור של קיבוצים שהוקמו בפולין והשתמשו על ידי צעירי כהכשרה לפני עליה לארץ. הרבה תמונות וכל מני דברים מעניינים  

!!!!!אפילו 1 שקל יזור
story_txt: For English scroll downלעברית לך למטה                       Przyjaciele!Wspólnie z bratem napisaliśmy książkę o polskich korzeniach Izraela. Na dzień dzisiejszy mamy 500 stron maszynopisu, dużo oryginalnych zdjęć i niepublikowanych materiałów. Książka to efekt 7 lat pracy, zbierania materiałów z archiwów w Austrii, Polsce, Ukrainie i w Izraelu. Jeśli wszystko przebiegnie bez kłopotów  to pozycja ukaże się nakładem wydawnictwa "Austeria". Wiecie jak duzy był wkład Polaków w budowę Izraela?, Czy wiecie, że w przedwojennej Polsce budowano kibuce służące jako ośrodki szkoleniowe przed emigracją? Wiedzieliście, że to w Polsce urodził się pierwszy premier Izraela i wielu innych polityków, którzy przeszli do historii?  Jeśli na co najmniej jedno pytanie odpowiedzieliście przecząco - wspomóżcie ten projekt. Odkryjmy razem ten kawałek historii Polski i Izraela. Jeśli możecie wspomóc projekt nawet najmniejszą wpłatą - świetnie, jeśli nie- udostępnijcie ten post u siebie, to również będzie duża pomoc. Dzięki!!!Hello everyone! Who are we?I was volunteering in a Kubbutz in Arava Valey. I was working on a farm cows, waking up every morning at 3.30 and milking the cows as a pro:) I've met many good people. I came back changed. Better person. New born.My brother works at University in Cracow,  He teaches History and he already published a few books - "The Jews in Cracow. Study of the Elite of the city. 1850-1918" as well as book about the Freemasonry in Cracow.And dozens articles....Me and my brother we collect money so we can finish our project that has started 7 years ago. We wrote a book about "Polish roots of Israel". In our book you can find stories about Zionists from Poland that built Israel, documents from archives from Ukraine - never published before, information about Kibbutzim that were built in Poland and then used as training camps for youth  before they emigrated to Erec and many others. It's finished now and it has 500 pages. We just need more money to close everything. We have initial agreement with Publishing House ("Austeria" - they printed in polish "Jewish State" by Theodor Herzl"). Everything goes the right direction and the plan is to publish it in the Spring 2015. If we achieve to collect enough money we would really like to print it in Hebrew and in English as well. As you know translation and other expenses costs a lot of money and we already spent a fortune for researches in Austria, Ukraine, Poland and Israel.Even 1$ will be much appreciate!!!!!! חברים וחברותמי אנחנו? התנדבתי שנה בקיבוץ שבעמק ארבה. גרתי עם קיבוצניקים, עבדתי ברפת, כל יום קמתי ב3.30 בבוקר והלכתי לחלוב פרות - זה היה שנה טובה ביותר בחיים שלי. אוכל בחדר אוכל, אש במדבר. הכרתי אנשים טובים, ולמדתי הרבה מהם. חזרתי משם בן אדם אחר , כאילו נולדתי עוד פעם.אח שלי עובד באוניברסיטה הפדגוגי בקרקוב, הוא מלמד היסטוריה והוא כבר כתב כמה ספרים בין היתר - "היהודים בקרקוב. המחקר על האליטה של העיר 1918-1850" וספר על התולדות של הבונים החפשיים בקרקוב.אנחנו מכינים לפירסום את הספר "השורשים הפולניים של ישראל". אנחנו מתכננים להופיע אותו באביב הקרוב עם הוצאת "אוסטריה". הם פרסמו בפולנית "מדינת היהודים" מאת בנימין זאב הרצל. הספר מיועד לקהל רחב שמעניינים גם בהיסטוריה וגם בהווה של ישראל. ספר הוכן קודם כל בשביל תלמידים, עיתונאים, אנשים עסקים, דיפלומטים, תיירים וצליינים. ספר נגמר, יש לו 500 עמודים. ספר שלנו כולל מסמכים מאוקראינה שלא פירסמו לפני. המסמכים האלה קשורים עם ארגונים הראשונים הציונים שהיו באירופה מרכז-מזרח, ומנציחים ההשגים של ציוניים מאזור הזה. אתם גם תמצאו תיאור של קיבוצים שהוקמו בפולין והשתמשו על ידי צעירי כהכשרה לפני עליה לארץ. הרבה תמונות וכל מני דברים מעניינים  !!!!!אפילו 1 שקל יזור

story:
Stöd Våra Små Vikingar!

An important aspect of Swedish School is hosting fun events both children and parents enjoy - Viking VM is certainly one of those times! 

The kids will compete against students in 37 other Swedish Schools all over the world. October 18th is the big day when the competitions take place. 


Please help support our little vikings and the Swedish School of Fort Lauderdale ! Any contribution - big or small - is greatly appreciated .

This is an excellent opportunity to support your grandkids, nieces and nephews, cousins and friends in their efforts to learn Swedish.

Hosting exciting events cost money. Providing educational tools and a nice place to study does as well. Fundraising and support from the Swedish Community both locally and in Sweden is crucial as to ensure that we're able to keep our membership fees low so that everyone can join.

The goal of the Swedish School is to teach children about the Swedish culture and language. Our mission is also to provide for our children a sense of belonging in the Swedish community, an opportunity to form lasting friendships with other Swedish children, and an understanding of what it means to be Swedish. 

We want to open doors for our children, and enable them to study, work and live in Sweden if they should so desire.

Tusen Tack för Ditt Bidrag!

Thank you for Your Support!

story:
Who am I?

My name is Avril and I am currently teaching English in an after-school programme run by Teach For Palestine in Balata Camp, Nablus, the Occupied Palestinian Territories. There are over 20,000 registered refugees in Balata, making it the most highly populated camp in the West Bank. The camp was founded in 1950 and is approximately 2.5 square kilometres. I teach 3 classes of children aged 7-13 years old. Having taught in France and Ireland already, I can honestly say that these kids have astounded me with their enthusiasm and motivation to learn. Our programme is voluntary and free for the children and they are so excited to come to class everyday! If you want to read more about my English teaching adventures in Balata, please check my blog on http://yafainbalata.wordpress.com/

Teach for Palestine brings internationally trained teachers to the West Bank to work with kids. TFP’s holistic, interactive approach has proven effective in mentoring students and developing fluency. The average student at TFP acquires 350 new words and advances slightly more than one grade level in reading each semester. After their initial exposure to international teachers, student’s verbal fluency increases exponentially and continues to grow rapidly throughout the program. Moving beyond the classroom, our communicative and compassionate approach draws out and engages children who have suffered from violence, abuse and oppression the better part of their lives. This year, as well as working in Balata, we are also working in New Askar Camp, Salem village and Deir al Hatab village. For more information, please check our website on http://teach-for-palestine.org/

Why am I fundraising?

My kids have been working very well for the past 6 weeks and I want to reward them with a special treat- a trip to the zoo! There is one zoo in the West Bank, in Qalqilya, which is about 45 minutes from Nablus. My plan is to take them there one Thursday after school to see the animals and maybe have some sweets. I know it sounds like a very simple idea but a lot of these kids have never gone outside of Nablus and the majority have never been to the zoo. We recently learned about animals and they loved the topic- there's a poster of wild animals in the classroom and they look at it before the start of class and tell me all the names. I think they would nearly be sick with excitement to have a zoo trip!

So what do I want?

I'm not asking for much! In total, I need to raise about 150-200 euro for this trip ( I already have a donation from my wonderful former students at Gael Cholaiste Chill Dara to put towards this) so I am asking you for the price of a pint...roughly 5 euros. I am very conscious that in these recessionary times people don't have a lot to spare, but if you literally have one drink less the next time you go out, you can give a child a nice day out. These kids get excited when they have a new pen in class so imagine how thrilled they would be to have a trip. The zoo itself isn't expensive, its the transport that is driving up the price- petrol is expensive here.

If you really can't give up your pint, then don't go to Abrakebra/Supermacs/McDonald's after a night out and give me the money instead- good for your waistline and for your soul! Or skip your takeaway coffee, or your pricey magazines, or even your daily chocolate bar for a week and make a donation to me!

If you can give more than 5 euros that would be absolutely amazing...even 1 euro would help! My kids and I would be eternally grateful to you :)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to give anything, please share this campaign with your friends, family and colleagues. Any excess money will be donated to TFP so it will all go to a good cause.

If you're friends with me on Facebook please check my 'Balata' album to see the students you are helping!

 For more information on TFP, please check our website on http://teach-for-palestine.org/

story:
Our Story:
International Theatre & Literacy Project (ITLP) started in 2005 by giving 21 Tanzanian teenagers a chance to speak freely and independently about themselves, their village and their families through theater and playwriting workshops. This arts education gave them an opportunity to voice their opinions while improving their English and self esteem. The success of that one program blossomed into what ITLP is today - ITLP has served thousands of children in five developing countries: Tanzania, Rwanda, Ethiopia, South Africa and rural India. With your help, ITLP can return to South Africa this summer.

The Mission:
ITLP uses theater as a means of social uplift for children in developing nations.  The ITLP theater workshops are designed to inspire new possibilities for children’s lives and foster leadership skills to benefit them and their community and country. With the help of volunteer artist-educators, students write and perform their own original works. Last summer, over the course of 2 weeks, 45 students wrote and performed two original plays about their lives in their township—Philippi, South Africa-- which was then performed for their community.

The students, teacher and parents of Philippi have written to ask us to return. But we need your help!

If we are able to raise $5,000, we can return to South Africa and work with 25 new children for two weeks. Raising $10,000 will provide us the resources to work with 50 students for three weeks.

How Your Money Will Be Used
Every dollar received will go directly to funding the 2013 Philippi workshop. The more you donate, the more children we can work with and the longer we can extend our stay.

Here’s are some of the costs involved:

  • Plane tickets, Room and Board, and local transportation
  • Props and Supplies for the play
  • Stipend for SA collaborating teachers
  • ITLP $500 Textbook donation to Ithemba Labantu Centre


The Perks
We have some great perks as a thank you for your donation. They include an advanced viewing of the trip's documentary. a beautiful hand made Maasai bracelete and a personal note from an ITLP student.

For our most generous donors we have perks that include a one-hour personal performance from renowned storyteller, poet and musician, David Gonzalez. David will perform in your home or a school of your choosing (http://www.davidgonzalez.com)

For a donation of $1,500 you recieve and all expense paid dinner with ANDREWANDREW. renowned cultural provocateurs and performance artists, recently featured on HBO “GIRLS” -- and all benefits listed above (http://www.andrewandrewdotcom.com)

Why This Is Important
Reading, writing, public speaking and the courage to reinvent yourself are essential for upward mobility in the developing world. The children we work with seldom have the chance to cultivate these skills, let alone experience any form of arts education. ITLP workshops give children the opportunity to experience theater for the first time and instruct local teachers and community members on how to continue to use theater as a way of building vital life skills long after the workshop is complete.

But don’t take our word for it: here are some quotes from former ITLP students:

“Thank you ITLP. You helped me think outside my think. ”
“I lit my voice up like the sun in the workshop!”
“Now I know - everything is possible”
“You gave me wings I didn’t know I had!”

Want to help but can’t spare the money? Please share!

  • One of the best ways you can help is to link your friends and family to this page with a personal email. Do you know anyone who would love to back this project?
  • You can also go to Twitter, Facebook, G+, or your blog and share the project link. There’s some convenient share buttons above.

To learn more about the ITLP please visit our website: http://www.itlp.org/

Thank you so much for reading and contributing to the success of this project!

story:
Happy New Year & Thank you... 

The campaign is complete and we are happily over our financial goal. Thank you for being a part of this work and my life. 

(PHOTOS BELOW: cooking Christmas feast, me with some young OTEPIC friends) 

(PHOTO BELOW: Dec 22, winter celebration gratitude circle at OTEPIC) 

UPDATE: 

The goal is reached... AND you can still contribute!!!! 

Thank you for such a wonderful outpouring of love, support, money, curiosity and affirmation. It is nourishing to feel connected in the trust of the global circle and is truly a gift... to me, to the OTEPIC community and I know will have ripples into other areas as well. 

As there is still energy moving, if you feel to contribute, there are plenty of ways that the funds can and will be used. Philip, I and others are discussing an indigenous tree planting initiative in the area involving a wonderful man with a local tree nursery. There is also the possibility of paying forward some of the funds to the permaculture project connected to PRI Kenya and Joseph Lentunyoi, who is sponsoring the training course next month. Philip has also expressed desire for a 2-3 day council training for the OTEPIC volunteers and community. 

I appreciate your trust in me and will do my best to listen deeply for how to distribute the funds. And also if you want to donate more specifically, please let me know where you would like the funds to go, and I will do my best to accommodate. 

(PHOTO BELOW: OTEPIC pilgrimage to Mount Elgon)

My Story

Hello friends! I am currently in Kenya as a part of a larger global pilgrimage - a journey of discovery of how I am to serve in these times of change, to bear witness to what is happening in the world, to connect with humanitarian projects and to open to a bigger dream. My trip to Kenya weaves three threads. First, I was invited to co-offer a council training for a peace project, International Peace Initiatives, where last year friends, mentors and collaborators with Beyond Boundaries built an earthen peace hut as well as supported a community of listening through sharing the practice of council. Last week Siri Gunnarson and I led a two-day follow up training for the community as well as held an introduction to council for a local women's group. I also came to visit the permaculture projects of Joseph Lentunyoi, with PRI Kenya (Permaculture Research Institute – Kenya). Joseph co-taught an inspiring Permaculture Design Course in California this summer with Warren Brush, of Quail Springs Permaculture Farm and Regenerative Earth Farm, where I was asked to share council as a community building practice and in which I participated as a student. I also came to support and learn from the work of Philip Munyasia, whom I met in 2010 at a peace research community, Tamera, in Portugal, where he was studying permaculture practices and alternative technologies. I was struck by his humility and dedication as well as his humor and warm-heartedness and we became allies and friends.     

What Is Being Supported 

Philip has the opportunity to attend a permaculture teachers training course in Kenya taught by my dear friend and teacher, Warren Brush, who has been invited by Joseph Lentunyoi and PRI Kenya to offer this training on January 13-17, 2014. This is a great opportunity for Philip to strengthen his teaching skills and grow his local and international network in order to serve more people more effectively. It is also a great opportunity to connect these peace workers who are all dear to me. 

As all of Philip’s resources - time and money - go directly into his project, I am campaigning to support his participation in this course. 

The course costs $500, and an additional $200 is needed for transportation and travel expenses. 

If additional funds come in, they will not be turned away... monies will go toward supporting a tree planting initiative. (PHOTO BELOW: tree nursery at Mt Elgon with another Philip) 

What is Being Served

In 2007 after completing his education in bio-intensive agriculture in Kenya, Philip received sponsorship to study in California with John Jeavons, author of How to Grow More Vegetables and then to Tamera in Portugal to study permaculture and peace principles. He then returned to his home town and founded OTEPIC (Organic Technology Extension and Promotion of Initiative Center) to empower his community. Philip is a visionary, community catalyst, activist and educator.

I have spent some time now with Philip and the OTEPIC community over the past weeks in his home place of Kitale, in Northwest Kenya. OTEPIC serves and supports many people in the local community, primarily women and youth, providing alternatives for many youth coming out of the slums. OTEPIC has developed two community education centers with demonstration gardens and integrated alternative technologies and is now in the process of visioning and designing a new piece of land to become an inter-tribal peace village - a model for sustainable living, research and training. Every day at any one of the sites, many children and young people are found working in the gardens, feeding the bio-gas system, getting water at the well, cooking for the many volunteers... Many people are also now busy working on the latest project - an earth bag peace hut. The hut is a joint project of OTEPIC with the Global Campus - an international group of "peace-workers-in-training" mainly from Tamera, and is connected to a lineage of earth bag huts catalyzed by Beyond Boundaries. Together we, the international community and the local community, have shared in council, had women's circles, cooked ugali (maize) for 40 people, planted seeds, sang and danced, moved soil, prayed. And most recently 30 of us went on a pilgrimage to Mount Elgon (Tulwetaab Kony), the source of the River Zabwani which flows adjacent to the future OTEPIC peace village and is the main source of water for the region. The 4321 meter high mountain is about an hour's drive by car, and most local residents have not been there. 

I know that Philip will continue to learn and grow and bring his latest knowledge and inspiration back to the community to share and empower others. It is a joy to work with him and the OTEPIC community. 

(NOTE: the above video is from last year and now OTEPIC is developing the new land!!! PHOTO ABOVE: me with some of the young women of OTEPIC. BELOW: the first council in the first structure - earth bag peace hut - on the new land) 

Gratitude 

Thank you to Philip, Joseph, Warren, Karambu, Siri, Gigi, Marlow and others for inspiring me to get here. And mostly thank you to each of you for taking the time to read about what is moving in my heart. There are so many ways to "kneel and kiss the ground" as poet Rumi says. I feel moved to do what I can to support the community here through furthering Philip's education as well as connecting projects and people devoted to peace and regenerative living. Thank you for any contribution you are moved to make toward this vision. 

If you are not able to contribute, you can help in other ways - Spread the word. Envision a world of peace and abundance. Send a good thought. Send me an email with questions and comments. Plant a tree. 

Links to Partner Organizations 

OTEPIC

PRI Kenya 

Quail Springs Permaculture Farm 

Regenerative Earth Farm

IPI 

Beyond Boundaries 

The Ojai Foundation's Center for Council Practice 

My Blog
story_txt:
Happy New Year & Thank you... 
The campaign is complete and we are happily over our financial goal. Thank you for being a part of this work and my life. 
(PHOTOS BELOW: cooking Christmas feast, me with some young OTEPIC friends) 


(PHOTO BELOW: Dec 22, winter celebration gratitude circle at OTEPIC) 
UPDATE: The goal is reached... AND you can still contribute!!!! Thank you for such a wonderful outpouring of love, support, money, curiosity and affirmation. It is nourishing to feel connected in the trust of the global circle and is truly a gift... to me, to the OTEPIC community and I know will have ripples into other areas as well. As there is still energy moving, if you feel to contribute, there are plenty of ways that the funds can and will be used. Philip, I and others are discussing an indigenous tree planting initiative in the area involving a wonderful man with a local tree nursery. There is also the possibility of paying forward some of the funds to the permaculture project connected to PRI Kenya and Joseph Lentunyoi, who is sponsoring the training course next month. Philip has also expressed desire for a 2-3 day council training for the OTEPIC volunteers and community. I appreciate your trust in me and will do my best to listen deeply for how to distribute the funds. And also if you want to donate more specifically, please let me know where you would like the funds to go, and I will do my best to accommodate. (PHOTO BELOW: OTEPIC pilgrimage to Mount Elgon)My StoryHello
friends! I am currently in Kenya as a part of a larger global pilgrimage - a journey of
discovery of how I am to serve in these times of change, to bear witness to
what is happening in the world, to connect with humanitarian projects and
to open to a bigger dream. My trip to Kenya weaves three threads. First, I was
invited to co-offer a council training for a peace project, International Peace
Initiatives, where last year friends, mentors and collaborators with Beyond
Boundaries built an earthen peace hut as well as supported a community of listening through sharing the practice of council. Last week Siri Gunnarson and I led a two-day follow up training for the community as well as held an introduction to council for a local women's group. I also came to visit the permaculture projects
of Joseph Lentunyoi, with PRI Kenya (Permaculture Research Institute – Kenya).
Joseph co-taught an inspiring Permaculture Design Course in California this summer with Warren Brush, of Quail Springs Permaculture Farm and Regenerative Earth Farm, where I was asked to share council as a community building practice and in which I participated as a student. I also came to support and
learn from the work of Philip Munyasia, whom I met in 2010 at a peace research community, Tamera, in Portugal, where he was studying permaculture practices and alternative technologies. I was struck by his humility
and dedication as well as his humor and warm-heartedness and we
became allies and friends.     What Is Being Supported 
Philip has the opportunity to attend a permaculture teachers training
course in Kenya taught by my dear friend
and teacher, Warren Brush, who has
been invited by Joseph Lentunyoi and PRI Kenya to offer this training on January 13-17, 2014. This is a great opportunity for
Philip to strengthen his teaching skills and grow his local and international
network in order to serve more people more effectively. It is
also a great opportunity to connect these peace workers who are all dear to me. 
As all of Philip’s resources - time and money - go directly into his project, I am campaigning to support his participation in this course. The course costs $500, and an additional $200 is needed for transportation and travel expenses. If additional funds come in, they will not be turned away... monies will go toward supporting a tree planting initiative. BELOW: the first council in the first structure - earth bag peace hut - on the new land)

story:
Short Summary

The Watershed Project is a non-profit based out of Richmond, CA that is passionate about inspiring communities to understand, appreciate, and protect their local watersheds. Bye Bye Basura (the Spanish word for "trash"), is the first step in an ongoing pollution prevention program and educational exchange between San Pablo, California and sister city, Manzanillo, Mexico. Twice a year we visit Manzanillo to teach Mexican youth about their watershed and the little things we can all do to make a positive difference for our shared ocean. Mexican and American youth learn through engaging, hands on activities and are able to exchange ideas about marine debris internationally. This year we need your help raising money to pay for our intern, Pia's, flight to Manzanillo! We hope that she will be able to come along and share what she has learned about marine debris with the youth and possibly even have a life changing experience at the same time.

What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to find an affordable flight for our intern, Pia, to fly down to Manzanillo Mexico from the Bay Area. The money from this campaign will be used to directly finance her flights to and from Manzanillo for a first trip in October and a second in early spring of 2014. Pia is excited to share what she has learned about marine debris and the human impact on our shared ocean.  She is passionate about passing on our lessons about out environment and our watersheds to Mexican youth. 

The Impact

The Bye Bye Basura program kicked off in 2010 and it has grown more and more each year. Youth from San Pablo CA, and sister city, Manzanillo MX are able to learn about and share their own experiences with marine debris in their watershed. We hope that this year, Pia can share her passion for a healthy enivronment through her knowledge and excitement. Any donation is greatly appreciated! Let's send Pia to Manzanillo!

story:
Help me go to school to become a midwife!

Ever since I was a little girl I wanted to be a mother. I was born with a genetic disorder called Phenylketonuria {P.K.U.} that at one time made pregnancy and motherhood impossible for people like me. Due to recent research and controlled metabolic treatment, my dream was realized and I have been blessed to have the children that I longed for, feeling fulfilled in a way that I never imagined.

I soon realized after the peaceful home birth of my son twelve years ago that another calling would soon make it's path known to me and thus began my journey of caring for and mothering other mothers. I knew that I was to be a midwife. With small babies and children to raise and care for, I heeded the advice of my midwife to wait until my children were older to pursue midwifery but the drive and passion would not leave me. I became a childbirth educator and birth and postpartum doula in order to serve and be with childbearing women in what little ways I could while juggling family and home. I spent time teaching classes in my home and in their homes, rallying for better birth choices in my state, supporting midwives, attending births of my friends and loved ones and clients, while usually getting little sleep and making little to no money. This was not a job, this was a passion. I have been honored to witness the beautiful births of amazing women, becoming mothers for the first and subsequent time. I have been witness to their transformation and to their babies' peaceful entries into this world. I have spent many bleary nights counseling and listening to women , helping to educate them about their choices as well as guiding them toward more faith and trust in themselves and their own bodies. I have cried with women through the telling of their birth stories and as they processed their grief and pain and joy. I have held their hands and their backs and their legs and cried with them while they welcomed their baby into this world, in awe of their strength and amazing power. My passion has been to help them have a better, safer birth that they will remember forever. I have been becoming a midwife.

As a mother of many young children, the goal of  midwifery has seemed unreachable both due to time and financial constraints. I have put midwifery studies on hold more than once due to these issues but now that my children are older and are excited about supporting me through this journey {they love to see the pics of the new Mommies and babies when I arrive home from a long birth!} I am feeling that pull once again and this time I am answering it.  The financial burden seems overwhelming to me at times and has caused me to waiver in the past. Yet, I know that as each day passes by it is one less day I have to truly serve women in the way that I feel called to.

One thing I have learned in the most painful way a person can learn is that life is short and we may not be here tomorrow. Every day is a gift and this moment is all we have. I refuse to live with regret. So, I am reaching out to my family and friends. I truly can't do this without your help and support!

A Gift For You

I don't like asking for help without being able to help others in return so I am offering a special gift for each contribution. This is my way to thank you for your generosity. The gifts you receive are yours to keep or to give away to someone else. I love paying it forward.

Here is what I am offering for each contribution:

*25. donation = Citrus Bliss Hand Lotion: Citrus Bliss Hand Lotion softens and hydrates skin and enlivens the senses with the delightful aroma of Citrus Bliss Invigorating Blend. The essential oils included in the lotion are: wild orange, lemon, grapefruit, mandarin, bergamot, tangerine, clementine and a hint of vanilla. Great relaxing blend! With benefits that extend beyond elevating mood and reducing stress, Citrus Bliss has natural, potent compounds with cleansing properties. Makes a great gift. Retail value $8.67.

*50. donation =Citrus Bliss Hand Lotion, Citrus Bliss Bath Bar, & Peppermint and Wild Orange Lip Balm. Enjoy a bottle of silky smooth citrus bliss hand lotion, a Citrus Bliss bath bar with milled oats, and natural emollients from coconut, sunflower, safflower oil and shea butter. The bar is free from harsh, artificial fragrances and colors and other ingredients that can be irritating to the skin. You will also receive a yummy Lip Balm with shea butter, mango seed butter, and sweet almond oil infused with dōTERRA peppermint and wild orange essential oils. Makes a great gift for someone. Retail $24.32

*100. donation= Spa Hand and Body Lotion & one 15 ml. bottle of Lavender Essential Oil.  The Spa Hand and Body Lotion is fragrance free, light-weight, and is perfect for hydrating the skin and powerful when combined with an essential oil of your choice. Contains a perfect blend of antioxidants, botanicals, and humectants with cruciferous vegetables  to help build the skin's natural protection and environmental defenses. Lavender essential oil has been cherished for its unmistakable aroma and its therapeutic properties for thousands of years and is used for its calming and relaxing qualities. Use the lotion with a few drops of lavender oil on your hands and body for it's many relaxing and soothing properties. Retail value $47.33. 

*150 donation = Introduction to Essential Oils Kit, Spa Hand and Body Lotion, & Lip Balm. The Introduction to Essential Oils Kit includes an introductory audio CD and booklet and three 5 ml bottles of Lavender, Lemon, and Peppermint essential oils. The stunning presentation box also includes suggested uses of the included oils providing an immediate experience of the life-changing benefits of essential oils. Also included is the Spa Hand and Body Lotion.  This fragrance free, light-weight lotion is perfect for hydrating the skin and is even more powerful when combined with the essential oil or blend of your choice. The way to silky, smooth skin lies in the perfect blend of antioxidants, botanicals, and important humectants. Extracts of cruciferous vegetables contribute to the formula's ability to help build the skin's natural protection and environmental defenses. You will also receive a yummy lip balm with wild orange and peppermint essential oils. Retail value $52.33.

*200 donation= Spa Mist Vapor Diffuser and the yummy essential oils of Lavender and Wild Orange. SpaVapor Advanced Wellness /The Spa Vapor Ultrasonic Mister! The ultrasonic technology creates an ultra fine mist. This diffuser is BPA free and offers a convenient on/off and led light switch on the front of the unit. The unit is easy to use and simple to clean. Just add a few drops of oil into your tap or bottled water (not distilled), and turn any room into a healing, relaxing oasis within seconds. Enjoy the beautiful and tranquil led light display of 6 fading colors to further enhance your relaxation experience. You will also receive two 15 ml bottles of Lavender and Wild Orange essential oils.Cold-pressed from the orange peel, wild orange is excellent for energizing and revitalizing. It is also commonly used as an effective tool for uplifting mood, as well as for its wonderful citrusy aroma. For aromatic, topical, or dietary use. Makes a great gift. Retail value $104.00 

*350. donation= Lotus Diffuser, 15 ml bottle of Serenity Essential Oil, and $150. gift certificate for doula services OR 15 ml. bottle of Frankincense Essential Oil.  The Lotus diffuser The Lotus diffuser uses a highly efficient real time atomization technology to effectively diffuse essential oils into the environment. The essential oils are atomized into minute ion particles and active oxygen anions, which are more easily absorbed by the human body than oils diffused by conventional diffusers. This diffuser uses real time atomization technology to effectively diffuse essential oils into the environment. You will also receive a 15 ml. bottle of Serenity oil. Serenity is a blend composed of individual oils with known calming properties which create a sense of well-being and relaxation. Lavender, sweet marjoram, roman chamomile, ylang ylang, sandalwood and vanilla bean all create a subtle aroma ideal for aromatic diffusion or topical application. You will also receive $150. gift certificate for birth doula services either for yourself or gifted to a friend. Must be for someone in the Phoenix area. If you do not have someone to gift the doula services to, you may choose a 15 ml. bottle of Frankincense instead. Perhaps the most precious of the ancient oils, frankincense is highly sought after by modern consumers for its many uses, including relaxation, immune support, and mood enhancement. For aromatic, topical or dietary use. Total retail value of diffuser, oils, and doula services $310. Total retail value for oils and diffuser $243.

*500. donation= Family Physician Kit, 5 ml bottle of Helichrysum, and $200. gift certificate for doula services.  The Family Physician® Kit is a collection of ten nurturing essential oils, including six single oils and four blends. The stunning box includes tips for using the oils, as well as an audio CD teaching listeners how to care for their family's everyday health needs with simple and safe methods using the ten essential oils included in this kit. Includes 5 ml bottles of Lavender, Lemon, Peppermint, Melaleuca, Oregano, Frankincense, Deep Blue®, Breathe, DigestZen®, and On Guard to help families address a multitude of health issues. One of the most sought-after essential oils, helichrysum has traditionally been used for its soothing and regenerative effects. The rare essential oil of helichrysum is distilled from the flower cluster of an evergreen herb and is highly prized by essential oil users. I have used it for pain and healed a 3rd degree burn, preventing scarring. For aromatic and topical use. Also, you will receive a $200. gift certificate toward labor doula services for home, birth center, or hospital. This can be gifted to someone else- and must take place in Phoenix, Arizona. Retail value for the kit, helichrysum, and doula services $466.67.

Any contribution you can make would be appreciated and I hope that I will be able to gift you with something that you will enjoy! Use it for yourself or give it to someone else! Let's all help one another!

*Finally, here's a break down of how your contributions will be used:

*Midwifery Training Program- 1st Phase {one year}- $2500.

                                                      2nd Phase {Clinical Immersion}- 6-9 mos. $1750.

                                                      3rd Phase- Internship $TBD

*Neonatal Resuscitation Certification- $50-$240.

Breakdown: Book, Test, and Training

*CPR/First Aid Certification for Healthcare Professional- $100.

*Current Midwifery Apprenticeship - {Gas Mileage, Supplies, Childcare}- $2000.

*Midwifery Textbooks- $1600.

Total Breakdown:

Varney's Midwifery 5th edition- $153.

Anne Frye's Holistic Midwifery Vol 1 & 2- $199.50

Understanding Diagnostic Tools- $61.75

Anatomy & Physiology for Midwives- $34.

Midwifery: Best Practice- $42.

Optimal Care in Childbirth- $46.

Bates Guide to Physical Examination- $74.

Prof. Ethics in Midwifery Practice- $54.

Healing Passage- $140.

Birth Emergency Skills Training- $34.

Midwifery Mind and Spirit- $43.

Breastfeeding Answer Book- $45

The New Midwifery- $45

William's Obstetrics- $27

Bestfeeding: Getting Breastfeeding Right- $22

Practical Skills Guide for Midwifery- $80

Womanly Art of Breastfeeding- $13.

Human Labor & Birth- $80

Drugs in Pregnancy/Lactation- $44

Medication and Mother's Milk- $37

Neonatal Resuscitation Textbook 6th edition- $35

Assessment and Care of the Well Newborn- $45

Old's Maternal-Newborn Nursing &Women's health Across the Lifespan- $74

*Midwifery Tools/Equipment- $1500.

Tool Breakdown:

otoscope- $27., gloves - $10, urine strips- $12, doppler - $800, Fetascope- $125, reflex hammer- $3., watch- $3, birth tub- $500, blood pressure cuff & stethoscope- $45, pen light- $5, birth bag- $50

*Advanced Midwifery Practicum at Maternidad la Luz - $4900.

Total Breakdown- $2400. for the tuition & $2500 room, board, food

*NARM Study Retreat {one week before the exam}- $1000.

*NARM Exam to become a Certified Professional Midwife- {required for licensure to practice midwifery in the state of Arizona}

                                                     Application & Exam Fees- $2,000.

Estimated fees needed= $17,590.

*If my funding goal of $1000. is not reached, a 9% fee will be charged by Indiegogo. The rest of the funds will then be used toward the above expenses. If my funding goal for midwifery school is reached or exceeded, only a 4% fee will be charged by Indiegogo and all the rest of the  funds will go toward the above expenses of almost $18,000. total.

The more I am able to raise, the less fees I will be charged and more of the contributions will be used toward my schooling! So any amount no matter how small will benefit my education and I truly appreciate your contribution! 

The Impact of a midwife for every woman:

The United States spends about $98 billion dollars for hospitalization on pregnancy and childbirth and our maternal mortality rate has doubled in the past 25 years! This is despicable! The United States ranks 50th in maternal mortality - which means 49 other nations in the world do better at keeping mothers alive than the United States does! This can change! 

Recent research shows that midwifery care improves maternal health and mortality rates and birth outcomes. A recent article also shows that midwife-led births have better outcomes and women are more satisfied with their care. Click on the link and read what those women have to say about midwifery care!

Giving birth is something that women will remember for the rest of their lives. Having given birth six times myself, I can remember each birth as if it were yesterday. I can hear the sounds of my babies crying for the first time, the smell of their newborn head the moment I first held them, and the warmth in my arms as they laid in my arms- their mouths open and searching for something to eat. I remember every smell and noise and specific words that were spoken. I remember how I felt as they each came into the world and sometimes if I smell or hear something similar it takes me back to their birth days. I tell them their stories and they love to hear how they were born. We will be telling our stories until we die. Twice I almost lost my life giving birth while I was under the care of an obstetrician. While I am grateful to utilize the surgical services of the obstetrical profession when they are necessary, the majority of women do not need a surgeon to give birth. The more midwives we have for women, the better our outcomes will be and the better chance women will have for a safer, more peaceful birth.

I want to be apart of that! I wholeheartedly support the idea that more midwives = better care for women and babies. Women are the ultimate decision makers. They need more midwives to choose from and we need to revolutionize maternity care in this country to improve maternal and child health.

I am grateful to be here to tell my story. I will continue to tell my stories, as we all do, until the day my time on this earth is over. It is who I am. It is who we all are. We are all our stories and experiences. We all have so much to share with one another.

I hope you will choose to be apart of this too by helping me reach my goal of becoming a midwife. I am honored to serve women during this most memorable and important time in their life. It truly is a calling for me. With your help, I will be able to offer more choices for women in my own community. We can all do something to improve our world- just a little bit at a time- and in small ways.

Other Ways You Can Help

Times are hard for everyone, which is why I am struggling to afford my education. I understand that you may want to contribute but for whatever reason are not able to. I understand and appreciate any help that you can give. If you can spread the word about my campaign and pass this on to others using the share tools, I would greatly appreciate it! Thank you so much and have a great day!
