story:
Save a Kamlari Girl

Help her break free from slavery with EDUCATION

Right now there is a young girl in Nepal who is just about to be sold as a slave.
She is the commodity, her parents are the sellers and whoever ‘buys’ her will be her master. Forever.

She doesn’t know it yet, but sexual and physical abuse will become a part of her life. She’ll live in poverty that you and I can’t even imagine and she will know nothing else till the day she dies. And she is barely 11-year-old.

This girl and many like her are called Kamlari girls.
There are thousands of them (many as young as 6-years-old) living in the indigenous Tharu community in Nepal, a place where countless families barely survive on less than €2 per day.
Books and schools are way out of their price range and so most Kamlari girls never get access to education…

But, it doesn't have to be that way! And that’s where we and YOU come in.

What We Do

Open Circles FOUNDATION is the philanthropic arm of Open Circles ACADEMY - a visionary educational institute empowering over 180,000 entrepreneurs to create a better world by fulfilling their greatest potential.

Realizing that the first step in creating a better world is a better education, we took on ourselves, as the non-profit foundation, the mission to transform the education system in the world. 

For over 10 years we support educational projects we believe have the potential to change lives for good. During these years we partnered with some of the most successful and respectful philanthropic organizations in the world like:

  • Triodos Bank - supporting the Uganda Rural Development School for girls in Uganda (2008).
  • Virgin Unite - supporting the Richard Branson Center for Entrepreneurship in South Africa (2013).
  • Barefoot Collage and WWF - bringing solar light and training village grandmothers to become solar engineers in rural Madagascar (2014).
  • Pencils of Promise - building 4 primary schools in rural Laos (2015).

By partnering with leading charities and organizations, Open Circles Foundation CONTRIBUTES to causes that desperately need our help.
And we’re doing it again with this crowdfunding campaign - Save a Girl.

Right now we are calling on YOU FOR HELP!

The Power of Education

Please join us to save young girls and break them free from slavery and abuse through the power of EDUCATION.

For our 2016 campaign, we’ve partnered with Room to Read, an award winning,  non-profit organization whose goals align with ours. Like us, they envision a world where all children can get access to quality education, reach their full potential and contribute to their community and the world.

Instead of a life of slavery, this 11-year-old girl - and so many others like her - will be free to receive the education she deserves. With YOUR help, she will avoid the horrific fate that looked inevitable and have a completely different life as a consequence. 

And the change will ripple through the community.

Once this 11-year-old girl breaks out of the Kamlari cycle, she'll be better educated and equipped to help others around her. 

It's not just about helping girls of this generation - by freeing and educating these girls, we're empowering them to change the future of their children and their community for generations to come. 

To thank you for your generosity we want to give the gift of education to you as well:

And the more girls you help us save, the more we give you in return….

We have some really great perks and rewards for you. We’ve devised a simple and easy way for YOU to really make a difference to these Kamlari girls with 4 Enlightenment Millionaire Packs:

  1. Save ONE girl and we’ll give you a FREE ticket to our newest seminar Enlightened Millionaire.
    You'll also get a signed copy of Nisandeh's new book,     The Enlightened Millionaire.
    And... On top of that, a special 'thank you' mention in the book.
  2. Save FOUR girls and the gifts get bigger...
    Join Vered and Nisandeh for an exclusive dinner in their favorite restaurant.
    And, of course, all of the gifts from the save one girl pack as well (see above). 
  3. Save TEN girls and we're going to go wild...
    Get all the gifts from the save one girl pack (see above) and...
    Join 2 of our advanced weekend trainings of your choice as our VIP guest (including private dinners with Vered or Nisandeh).

  4. Save FOURTY girls and we'll get very close...
    Get all the gifts from the save one girl pack (see above) and...
    Come and stay as our guest in our dream house in Tenerife, for a vision week, where we will help you identify, strategize and plan your next phase in business or life.
    Oh yes... and we'll put your picture on the new book's cover and your bio inside the book...

By helping Nepal's Kamlari girls get a chance at education, freedom and prosperity you too get educational gifts that put you on the path to wealth, freedom and contribution.

What Else Can You Do?

Share the Save a Girl Campaign and help save even more Kamlari girls. 

Don't stop with showing you care with your donation!
Please take a moment to spread the word about this campaign by sharing it with your networks - Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, Google+ and anywhere else.

Together we can eradicate this custom of Nepal's slave girls - so please make sure everyone in your circle is aware of the problem and of the only REAL solution - education!

Let's give the Kamlari girls a second chance!

Answering Your Questions

How much money from this campaign goes directly to the girls?

EVERYTHING minus the costs of IndieGoGo, PayPal, and the book's S&H costs.

How can I pay?

We accept Paypal and major credit cards

Can I keep track of the progress of the Save a Girl campaign and what happens afterwards?

Yes! We’ll keep you up to date on our progress over the coming weeks so you know how the campaign is doing. We'll also be regularly posting videos, blogs and social media updates on the girls of Nepal and how your contribution is making a difference.

Can I donate from anywhere?

Anywhere in the world and at any time before April 21st, 2016.

When and how will I receive my gift?

The Enlightened Millionaire seminar takes place on the 24th of June, 2016.
You will get your e-ticket as soon as the campaign is over. If you can't attend the live seminar - we will send you the video recording around September. 

You will get your copy of The Enlightened Millionaire book during the live seminar.
If you can't attend the live seminar, we will ship the book to you in the first week of July.  

You will get access to online programs in the first week of July.

If you contributed to join us for dinner or for a vision week in our home in Tenerife, our office will be in contact with you to coordinate a suitable date.

Do you have any other questions?

Please post any other question you have in the comments box below and we’ll get back to you as soon as we can.

We Really Appreciate Your Support

Thank you for saving our girls!

She doesn’t know it yet, but sexual and physical abuse will become a part of her life. She’ll live in poverty that you and I can’t even imagine and she will know nothing else till the day she dies. And she is barely 11-year-old.


This girl and many like her are called Kamlari girls. There are thousands of them (many as young as 6-years-old) living in the indigenous Tharu community in Nepal, a place where countless families barely survive on less than €2 per day. Books and schools are way out of their price range and so most Kamlari girls never get access to education…


But, it doesn't have to be that way! And that’s where we and YOU come in.
Many Kamlari girls are freed, but are in desperate need of education and care
 What We Do
Open Circles FOUNDATION is the philanthropic arm of Open Circles ACADEMY - a visionary educational institute empowering over 180,000 entrepreneurs to create a better world by fulfilling their greatest potential.
Realizing that the first step in creating a better world is a better education, we took on ourselves, as the non-profit foundation, the mission to transform the education system in the world. 
For over 10 years we support educational projects we believe have the potential to change lives for good. During these years we partnered with some of the most successful and respectful philanthropic organizations in the world like:


Triodos Bank - supporting the Uganda Rural Development School for girls in Uganda (2008).

Virgin Unite - supporting the Richard Branson Center for Entrepreneurship in South Africa (2013).

Barefoot Collage and WWF - bringing solar light and training village grandmothers to become solar engineers in rural Madagascar (2014).

Pencils of Promise - building 4 primary schools in rural Laos (2015).






By partnering with leading charities and organizations, Open Circles Foundation CONTRIBUTES to causes that desperately need our help.And we’re doing it again with this crowdfunding campaign - Save a Girl.


Right now we are calling on YOU FOR HELP!

The Power of Education 
Please join us to save young girls and break them free from slavery and abuse through the power of EDUCATION.


For our 2016 campaign, we’ve partnered with Room to Read, an award winning,  non-profit organization whose goals align with ours. Like us, they envision a world where all children can get access to quality education, reach their full potential and contribute to their community and the world.
Instead of a life of slavery, this 11-year-old girl - and so many others like her - will be free to receive the education she deserves. With YOUR help, she will avoid the horrific fate that looked inevitable and have a completely different life as a consequence. 
And the change will ripple through the community.
Once this 11-year-old girl breaks out of the Kamlari cycle, she'll be better educated and equipped to help others around her. 
It's not just about helping girls of this generation - by freeing and educating these girls, we're empowering them to change the future of their children and their community for generations to come. 


&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;p&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;
&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/p&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;
&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;h3&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;YOU are this Girl's ONLY Chance&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/h3&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;
&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;p&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;span style="font-family: 'Benton Sans', Helvetica, sans-serif;letter-spacing: 0px;background-color: initial;"&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;Our mission today is to save 1,000 Kamlari girls - and together we believe we can and &amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/span&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;b style="font-family: 'Benton Sans', Helvetica, sans-serif;letter-spacing: 0px;background-color: initial;"&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;WILL&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/b&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;span style="font-family: 'Benton Sans', Helvetica, sans-serif;letter-spacing: 0px;background-color: initial;"&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt; do it. We need &amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/span&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;b style="font-family: 'Benton Sans', Helvetica, sans-serif;letter-spacing: 0px;background-color: initial;"&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;YOUR SUPPORT&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/b&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;span style="font-family: 'Benton Sans', Helvetica, sans-serif;letter-spacing: 0px;background-color: initial;"&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt; - this 11-year-old girl needs you.&amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/span&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/p&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;
&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;figure&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;span style="letter-spacing: 0px;background-color: initial;"&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;With your support in the Room to Read's&amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/span&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;span style="letter-spacing: 0px;background-color: initial;"&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;Girl’s Education program, &amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;b&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;Kamlari girls are getting a second chance.&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/b&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt; Probably the only chance they’ll ever get.&amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/span&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/figure&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;figure&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;span style="letter-spacing: 0px;background-color: initial;"&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;br&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/span&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/figure&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;figure&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;span style="letter-spacing: 0px;background-color: initial;"&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;They are set free from slavery, go to school, get vital educational skills, vocational trainings and mentorship &amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;b&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;so they can flourish and make a better life&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/b&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt; for themselves and for their children and grandchildren.&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/span&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/figure&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;figure&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;span style="letter-spacing: 0px;background-color: initial;"&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;br&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/span&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/figure&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;figure&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;p&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;Room to Read’s successful program saves hundreds of Kamlari girls every year - and we want to make a significant impact in 2016 - &amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;b&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;will you join us?&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/b&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/p&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/figure&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;p&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/p&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;
&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;p&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;
&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/p&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;
&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;p&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;img src="<a href="http://danieih100.onehundred.axc.nl/cf_help.jpg" target="_blank" rel="noopener">http://danieih100.onehundred.axc.nl/cf_help.jpg..." style="width: 621.694px;height: 367px;background-color: initial;"&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp; &amp;amp;amp;amp;nbsp;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;span style="font-size: 12px;text-align: right;background-color: initial;"&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;Helping a Kamlari girl break out of her master's physical and mental grasp&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/span&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;br&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;&amp;amp;amp;amp;lt;/p&amp;amp;amp;amp;gt;



How YOU Can Make a Difference

Any contribution gets us closer to giving another girl a future and helping her break free from slavery - but obviously the more you give, the more girls we can help.
One year of secondary education costs just €250 per girl, per year.
When you join us, together we can help raise enough money to help 1,000 girls break free of the cycle of poverty, abuse and hopelessness.


Just think about €250 for a moment… it’s the same as you’re charging for a few hours work, the cost of your kid’s game console or a couple of trips to the supermarket, right? 
For our 11-year-old Kamlari girl it’s the difference between a life of slavery, abuse and degradation and life of freedom, fulfillment and possibilities. 




A Kamlari girl Going to school.

Our Thank You Gifts (Perks)






To thank you for your generosity we want to give the gift of education to you as well:And the more girls you help us save, the more we give you in return….
We have some really great perks and rewards for you. We’ve devised a simple and easy way for YOU to really make a difference to these Kamlari girls with 4 Enlightenment Millionaire Packs:





Save ONE girl and we’ll give you a FREE ticket to our newest seminar Enlightened Millionaire.You'll also get a signed copy of Nisandeh's new book, The Enlightened Millionaire. And... On top of that, a special 'thank you' mention in the book.


Save FOUR girls and the gifts get bigger... Join Vered and Nisandeh for an exclusive dinner in their favorite restaurant.And, of course, all of the gifts from the save one girl pack as well (see above). 

Save TEN girls and we're going to go wild...Get all the gifts from the save one girl pack (see above) and...Join 2 of our advanced weekend trainings of your choice as our VIP guest (including private dinners with Vered or Nisandeh).
Save FOURTY girls and we'll get very close...Get all the gifts from the save one girl pack (see above) and...Come and stay as our guest in our dream house in Tenerife, for a vision week, where we will help you identify, strategize and plan your next phase in business or life.Oh yes... and we'll put your picture on the new book's cover and your bio inside the book...



By helping Nepal's Kamlari girls get a chance at education, freedom and prosperity you too get educational gifts that put you on the path to wealth, freedom and contribution.
Educating freed Kamlari girls is essential for their survival
What Else Can You Do?


Share the Save a Girl Campaign and help save even more Kamlari girls. 
Don't stop with showing you care with your donation!Please take a moment to spread the word about this campaign by sharing it with your networks - Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, Google+ and anywhere else.
Together we can eradicate this custom of Nepal's slave girls - so please make sure everyone in your circle is aware of the problem and of the only REAL solution - education!
Let's give the Kamlari girls a second chance!



Answering Your Questions

How much money from this campaign goes directly to the girls?


EVERYTHING minus the costs of IndieGoGo, PayPal, and the book's S&H costs.
How can I pay?
We accept Paypal and major credit cards




Can I keep track of the progress of the Save a Girl campaign and what happens afterwards?
Yes! We’ll keep you up to date on our progress over the coming weeks so you know how the campaign is doing. We'll also be regularly posting videos, blogs and social media updates on the girls of Nepal and how your contribution is making a difference.
Can I donate from anywhere?
Anywhere in the world and at any time before April 21st, 2016.


When and how will I receive my gift?


The Enlightened Millionaire seminar takes place on the 24th of June, 2016.You will get your e-ticket as soon as the campaign is over. If you can't attend the live seminar - we will send you the video recording around September. 


You will get your copy of The Enlightened Millionaire book during the live seminar.If you can't attend the live seminar, we will ship the book to you in the first week of July.  


You will get access to online programs in the first week of July.


If you contributed to join us for dinner or for a vision week in our home in Tenerife, our office will be in contact with you to coordinate a suitable date.

Do you have any other questions?


Please post any other question you have in the comments box below and we’ll get back to you as soon as we can.


We Really Appreciate Your Support
Thank you for saving our girls!

From the bottom of our hearts, thank you.

story:
I have recently been accepted into the Visual Arts master's degree program at UNAM (Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México - National Autonomous University of Mexico). After two years of working in Mexico as an english teacher and creating video in my spare time, I realized that what I truly wanted was to continue to study in the traditional sense, to dedicate the majority of my time to my craft and to deepen and strengthen my skills as a visual artist. I'm currently researching, working on various collaborative projects around the city (my focus is in Urban Art) and have just begun to write the first few sections of my thesis. 

My program offers a scholarship to the majority of students which allows them to dedicate their time to studying. Unfortunately, due to some complications with my application, I was not accepted for the scholarship.  I am continuing to apply to various grants and scholarships, and will re-apply for my program's scholarship in the coming February—however, I am currently struggling to pay for my first two semesters. 

With your support, I will be able to fund my time in school from October to February; which will allow me to create multiple films, videos, performances and installations, to spend the majority of my time researching my thesis, and to write the beginnings of my thesis. 

 

What is my thesis about and why study in Mexico?

The idea of my thesis has been directly influenced by my time in Mexico. Being physically distant from the US, it has been fascinating seeing the image that the country constructs of itself and projects to both it's own citizens and to the rest of the world. This ideal American image tends to be patriotic, powerful, just, rich and healthy (in the recent year the true image has been changing drastically). To investigate this phenomenon of the country's constructed image, I am studying the image of John F. Kennedy—a president who, to this day, has an impeccable public image (in the US and throughout most of the world), but who was privately very sick (with illnesses such as Addison's disease, digestive problems and the use of various painkillers). Much of this information was withheld from the public—and I suspect that if the public at the time did know about his health problems his image would not be the powerful and handsome one that comes to mind when we think of JFK today.

The media has the power of creating such an image, therefore I will be focusing on the influence of television as well as political cartoons in Kennedy's presidency. My thesis will be divided into multiple parts. The first part will discuss Kennedy's close relationship to television and how this reinforced his powerful and healthy image within US borders. The second part will investigate how this image of JFK was received in Mexico through Mexican political cartoons during that era. The third part will explain my artistic process relating to the experimental films that I make in regards to the propagandistic and ideal images of Kennedy and how these images contradicted his reality.

The idea is to use the particular story of John F. Kennedy as a metaphor for the current state of the country as a whole—one that is filled with sickness yet still tries to maintain its powerful, just and "healthy" image.

Studying in Mexico allows me to stay objective to the ideal images of the US. It permits me to open up this conversation to Mexican citizens who are also influenced daily by the images they receive of the US. This conversation lets my thesis become more of a collaboration, a place to share different sides of the story, rather than a one-sided idea of a place that I come from.

 

 

Thank you in advance for any donation you are able to make! If you are not able to make a monetary donation, please consider sharing my campaign with friends and family.

story:
Hi!

We are Son and Hai - two Vietnamese software engineers based in the UK. We have been close friends from our Oxford University days.

Phạm Anh Sơn (left) and Mạc Duy Hải (right)

We love technology and solving problems. We strongly believe in the power of technology to make life better. So we thought to ourselves, what can we do to make the ever-expanding Vietnamese community here in the UK better?

So, what is the problem?

All SVUK forums/pages have always had a section for people to buy, sell, trade things and advertise their services. In recent times, it exists under the form of the Facebook event page SVUK Marketplace. However it has a lot of problems, among them:

  • Sheer amount of posts and prioritisation of those with new likes and comments result in poor visibility for both advertisers and audience


  • There is no reliable search or filter function

  • Notifications and messages do not always work out. If people are not Facebook friends, their messages may not go into the usual Inbox

(for illustration purpose only)

  • Lack of administration and accountability, especially when disputes happen. Posts can be deleted without a trace - even though SVUK is not responsible for resolving these disputes, it leaves a lot of buyers at a loss when they are in trouble

... and many more.

The page, albeit very unusable and difficult to manage, is still extremely popular. This reflects a great demand for a good, central and free advertisement board among the Vietnamese society (notice: not just students) in the UK.

We would like to gather a team of Vietnamese software engineers and build a new, better version of the SVUK Marketplace as a community project. We have codenamed this project "Project Spring Roll".

What are we going to do?

We will gather a team of Vietnamese software engineers and build the website from scratch. Here is a glimpse of what the website would look like in our vision:

Zoom

That means it is not just a regular website - it is a complete end-to-end web system. As proposed to SVUK administrators, our Minimal Viable Product (MVP) will include these features:

  • The main advertisement board, split into different categories (Buy/Sell/Wanted etc) with a clear and easy-to-use listings view.
  • Facebook registration, sharing function and social plugin for ease of use and transition.
  • A fluid process for composing new advertisement with a certain level of spam countermeasures
  • A comprehensive user interface for administrators.
  • Support for one-time advertisers and recurring advertisers (businesses etc).
  • An internal ranking algorithm to ensure fair visibility to the advertisers.

For a start, we will not support these kinds of ads: essay-writers for hire, money transfers and similar ones since they are either usually questionable in morality or legality.

Active development will start from now and we estimate that our first beta test will commence in 6 months' time.

We said this would be free, so why is this campaign here?

We would like to stress that we are doing this project in our own time for free. Then what is this Indiegogo campaign for if not raising funds?

  • We can afford better things with more financial freedom, including development tools, better servers, etc. And better tools contribute greatly to a better product.
  • We estimate £600 can sustain the service for a while: that'd be worth 1 year of (acceptable) server resources to host the website and hopefully some left to acquire any other tools if we cannot find them open-source/for free.
  • Then why raising more?

Because both of us have a growing frustration when we attend Vietpro events - whether as hosts or guests: there are too few Vietnamese students in the UK pursuing a technical degree, while software is eating the world out there. Building the new marketplace website is a good showcase of our skills, but we would also love to inspire others in different ways, which leads to the next part...

Code workshops

[Son] - Back in the day in Vietnam, I often read 2 popular IT periodicals: PC World VN issue A* and e-Chip. As a fun-loving but programming-illiterate schoolboy, all I cared about in those magazines was the video game and tip-and-tricks columns.

However, it was e-Chip's motto that impressed me the most even to this day: "Tin học như cơm bình dân" (can be understood as "IT for everyone"). And it was reflected in their more exciting, casual style of writing. So we took some inspiration from that to bring to you "Quán code bình dân", like "quán cơm bình dân" but for code - a series of meetings, hack sessions and code workshops (free admission) in London as part of Project Spring Roll.

Each workshop will have different theme, topic and level of difficulty. However, we will focus heavily on things that are related to the project at first, then open up to more general topics if we see that the level of interest grow. We will send out a registration form and the details for each workshops via various means of communications beforehand.

*PC World Vietnam had 2 separate issues: A for the more general population and B for the technical crowd. Of course, back then I didn't understand a word in issue B. Everybody used to be a newb.

Other Ways You Can Help!

Would you kindly spread the word?

The more people know about this project, the better it is, and there is no better means of PR than the word of mouth. Our efforts to contribute to the community will be nothing if nobody knows about it. You can Like our Facebook page or subscribe to our newsletter to keep up to date with our development process and latest announcements!

We are looking for more people to work with us!

It is not just an ordinary website, we are building a whole system from the ground up with the latest technologies, and this is definitely not a two-man job. We are looking for either professionals like us or students with a passion and good aptitude for coding to make this happen together!

If you are interested in the technical sides of things and want to take part in our core development team, please go to famanson.github.io/spring-roll for more info!

Join our workshops! (Yes, admission is free)

We will not even wait till our Indiegogo campaign expires to organise these workshops either. If you have any matters that you'd like to discuss with us in person, that would be our best chance to catch up! Furthermore, these workshops will be closely related to what we do to build the new marketplace website so if you wish to join our team, it would be a good introduction to our workflow and the technologies we use.

Even better, if you know about the stuff we would talk about and want to contribute, you can help us prepare the lessons, too. Please do not hesitate to step forward!

We want to hear from you!

We love to hear your opinions. Please share with us just about anything you find relevant regarding this project. Especially if you are a buyer or seller who uses the SVUK Marketplace, please do come to us with feature requests and ideas.

We can be reached at ukspringroll@gmail.com

Because both of us have a growing frustration when we attend Vietpro events - whether as hosts or guests: there are too few Vietnamese students in the UK pursuing a technical degree, while software is eating the world out there. Building the new marketplace website is a good showcase of our skills, but we would also love to inspire others in different ways, which leads to the next part...Code workshops[Son] - Back in the day in Vietnam, I often read 2 popular IT periodicals: PC World VN issue A* and e-Chip. As a fun-loving but programming-illiterate schoolboy, all I cared about in those magazines was the video game and tip-and-tricks columns.However, it was e-Chip's motto that impressed me the most even to this day: "Tin học như cơm bình dân" (can be understood as "IT for everyone"). And it was reflected in their more exciting, casual style of writing. So we took some inspiration from that to bring to you "Quán code bình dân", like "quán cơm bình dân" but for code - a series of meetings, hack sessions and code workshops (free admission) in London as part of Project Spring Roll.Each workshop will have different theme, topic and level of difficulty. However, we will focus heavily on things that are related to the project at first, then open up to more general topics if we see that the level of interest grow. We will send out a registration form and the details for each workshops via various means of communications beforehand.*PC World Vietnam had 2 separate issues: A for the more general population and B for the technical crowd. Of course, back then I didn't understand a word in issue B. Everybody used to be a newb.Other Ways You Can Help!Would you kindly spread the word?The more people know about this project, the better it is, and there is no better means of PR than the word of mouth. Our efforts to contribute to the community will be nothing if nobody knows about it. You can Like our Facebook page or subscribe to our newsletter to keep up to date with our development process and latest announcements!We are looking for more people to work with us!It is not just an ordinary website, we are building a whole system from the ground up with the latest technologies, and this is definitely not a two-man job. We are looking for either professionals like us or students with a passion and good aptitude for coding to make this happen together!If you are interested in the 
technical sides of things and want to take part in our core development team, please go to famanson.github.io/spring-roll for more info!Join our workshops! (Yes, admission is free)We will not even wait till our Indiegogo campaign expires to organise these workshops either. If you have any matters that you'd like to discuss with us in person, that would be our best chance to catch up! Furthermore, these workshops will be closely related to what we do to build the new marketplace website so if you wish to join our team, it would be a good introduction to our workflow and the technologies we use.Even better, if you know about the stuff we would talk about and want to contribute, you can help us prepare the lessons, too. Please do not hesitate to step forward!We want to hear from you!We love to hear your opinions. Please share with us just about anything you find relevant regarding this project. Especially if you are a buyer or seller who uses the SVUK Marketplace, please do come to us with feature requests and ideas.We can be reached at ukspringroll@gmail.com

story:
Who am I

I'm Avneesh Chhabra, a student of the prestigious Film and television Institute of India. 

I have been studying at the FTII for a PGD in Film editing and have successfully completed one year of this 3 year course. This prestigious school only accepts 12 editing students per year and I was lucky enough to be selected out of 5000 candidates who appeared for the entrance exam .To be on this course has been my dream since I was studying engineering or working with HCL Technologies. I wanted to be a film-maker.

I started my film education on my own with some savings from my job which enabled me to pay the fees for first year here. Now I wish to complete what started as a dream -complete my education, learn as much as I can and then finally start to practice this art and craft on a high professional level after being groomed here in FTII.

What do I love to do

Make films.

It took long to discover, but finally I know what I would love to give my life to.

MAKING FILMS.

I have reached here after traversing paths like computer coding jobs, business sourcing, theater, writing and much more. But now that I am here, I know it's all I would need ever.

My film - making experience

I have written directed and edited a couple of films here as part of my first year curriculum. I have working knowledge of cinematography and sound design and have practiced the same in other student films.

The films we shall make during our academic stay here in FTII would be screened at various film festivals both national and international.

The FTII is a ONE OF ITS KIND FILM SCHOOL IN INDIA. 

I am sure you watched 3 idiots, Guzarish, Swayamvaram, Jaane bhi do yaaro, Uski roti, Black and Slumdog Millionaire  without knowing that their creators have a thing in common. Their educational background.
International film-makers are regularly invited as tutors at FTII, sharing their experience with the students. It's the best environment to experience education, learn from cinema professionals and through making films. 

Impact over one's education and career

The course is three years, full time. Following this intense PG program, graduates have the chance to start a career in film-making, creating influential pictures for the screen.This won't happen over the night and will require to continuing the hard work, but the school will prepare you enough to be a cinema professional up to the industry's standards. 

Money makes the world go round

The good news is that I was selected at this competitive and prestigious film school and have completed one year, but to be able to study here I would need to submit my fees for second year which comes out to be close to USD 900,
If I fail to do so, the good news turns into bad news and I lose my place on this amazing course.
With your help, I'll be turning this good news into great news and I will be able to fulfill my dream.

Why am I asking for help

Financially I can't do it by myself.I have the drive to do it,but don't have enough resources.

I can work part time by giving tuitions but that would suffice only to cover my living expenses in Pune which include food and travel majorly.

The school will hardly leave any free time to get a job.

The possibility of a loan was also ruled out when the bank officials came to know that the school does not offer any placements after the course.

Sharing is caring

SHARE! SHARE! SHARE! This is equally important and makes a difference to me, so, please, share it with some love.I believe amazing things happen when people join forces.Use Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, write an e-mail to your friends with the campaign link. Remember, you are not just giving your money or time, you are investing in someone's future, giving the opportunity to follow their dream. This is something that can never be expressed in dollars. 
Writing THANKS with capital letters and shouting it out loud for everyone who wishes to help.


Respectfully yours,

Avneesh Chhabra

story:
1,600+ Ethiopian Children Received a Bag. Now Help Us Fill it Up!


Each year since 2007, students and faculty from the School of Physical Therapy at Regis University have traveled to Ethiopia in collaberation with Project Mercy, a non-profit international relief and development agency in southwest Ethiopia.   

Project Mercy is located in Yetebon, an area of endemic poverty with very limited access to clean water, medical care, and education.  Beginning in 1993 Project Mercy has worked to address the critical needs of this community and have successfully developed infrastructure, started and maintained a hospital, and currently provide local children with a K-12 education. 

There are nearly 1,600 children in the Yetabon area who attend school at Project Mercy.  Many of these children walk miles to school each day.  Because backpacks are not readily available, children either carry their supplies or use plastic bag as bookbags.  

In October 2013, Regis University School of Physical Therapy students arrived at Project Mercy for several weeks of volunteer work: teaching classes on health and wellness, providing physical therapy services, educating local care providers in basic medical and physical therapies, and even helping with school and hospital maintence. It has been an annual and sometimes semi-annual service trip which is highly anticipated by both Project Mercy staff and students as well as the Regis community.  But this year they had a special surprise for the students.  Each child at the school received an unexpected gift: a simple cinch bag!  A bright, sturdy, roomy bag to support each child's journey of receiving an education.  

Now we need your help.  Another group of physical therapy students will travel back to Yetebon in the fall of 2014.  It is our goal to continue to supply the students with cinch bags as well as basic supplies to fill those bags.   

What We Need & What You Get

We are reaching out to our family, friends, friends-of-friends, co-workers and YOU to help us support the cause Project Mercy stands for. A school bag to a child at Project Mercy is an amazing gift and a smile on 1,600 children's faces is worth more than words can explain.

Our goal is to raise $3,500 to help pay for the cinch school bags provided to all 1,600 students at Project Mercy. 100% of your donations will go directing towards offsetting the cost of the bags and supplies for the children. 

The Impact

Line up of 1,600 students with no idea what is about to happen, gifts are not common in Yetebon and therefore a very special thing.

Time for bag hand out and to see all the children's faces light up!


Such a simple gift made 1,600 children happy and worry free. They deserve an education and providing school bags will help them continue on their journey of learning the curiosities of the world. We thank you for helping us support this cause.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone will be able to contribute financially to this cause but helping us spread the word towards continuing the educational project at Project Mercy, is a gift worth more then something money could buy. 

If you prefer you can support Project Mercy directly. Either way, you can make a difference!

story:
Hello, I am Clayton, I'm a Brooklyn, NY Resident, but a Charlotte Native. I have always been deeply invested in the Fading History of Charlotte, the largest, and  (arguably) the best city in North Carolina. 


When you think of a Southern city, you think of the old world charm of Charleston, Savannah, St. Augustine, but its not the case for every southern city. Unfortunately, due to short-sightedness, constant growing pains, and corporate greed, the city has done very little to preserve its once rich history. Through the 60s, 70s and 80s, the city adopted a "less is more" attitude towards urbanity, and demolished historic neighborhoods, beautiful hotels, train stations, department stores, all in the name of "change." 


On June 25th, 2014, another great treasure was taken from us! The Queens Park Sign, a wonderful 1950s era sign that has been sitting on the corner of South Blvd and Freeland, for the better part of a half a century. It marked the site of the last drive in movie theatre in Charlotte Area, which closed unceremoniously in 2006. The sign is being taken down to make way for a massive Office, Retail, and Residential project developed by Pappas Properties. The sign is being removed, once again, in the name of change. 


Charlotte is a city with very little to call its own anymore. Everything is new and shiny, and untouched. While I am not nostalgic for Queens Park Cinema itself. I am Nostalgic about the quickly fading history that is receding just a little more everyday. Please help kick start our first campaign to SAVE CHARLOTTES HISTORY!

What I'd like to do is raise $100,000 big ones! With this money we will purchase the Queens Park Sign from Pappas Properties/RJ Griffin, and refurbish, and gift it to VGBG/NC Music Factory. The leftover money would be donated to Charlottes Up and Coming Rail Trail.

Charlotte’s Rail Trail will be a vibrant public park that winds through the very heart of our city, where the unexpected can be found around every bend.

The 3.3 mile trail will connect communities and knit together neighborhoods from Sedgefield, Southside Park, Brookhill, Dilworth, Wilmore, South End to Uptown. But it will belong to everyone in the Queen City.


The Rail Trail will become the place to discover cafés and bars, explore galleries, see artists at work, stumble upon an impromptu concert, stroll with your family, or relax on a bench and watch the city come alive around you.


The walkway alongside the Blue Line already exists, but it could be so much more. With the help of passionate supporters, today’s trail will be transformed into a network of gardens, public art, unique spaces and activities, and an endless string of places to sit, eat and play. The hardest part of building a park—acquiring the land—is already done and a foundation has been laid. Let’s turn it into something extraordinary.

This isn't JUST about saving a sign. Its about setting a precedent. Its about showing that we care about our history, and that we will not settle for it being torn down. Any contribution helps, big or small. 
The PERK: Saving a Piece of History. 


I am going to do everything in my power to get this going. All proceeds will go towards buying the Queens Park Sign and contributing to the Rail Trail.

RISKS:
• If things fall through with the Sign, proceeds go towards funding for the rail trail. With that said, WE WILL DO EVERYTHING IN OUR POWER MAKE THIS HAPPEN!

• IF PAPPAS DONATES SIGN Proceeds will go towards helping refurbish the sign and also helping the rail trail. 


For More Info on everything: 

http://www.charlottecentercity.org/charlotte-rail-trail-vision/

http://cinematreasures.org/theaters/4745

http://www.pappasproperties.com

story:
Summary

Here at Projek Pelita, we strongly believe that education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.

As the Malay saying goes, ‘Ilmu Pelita Hidup’. Education - be it inside or outside of the classroom - is an essential key to the development of society. 

However,  in many developing countries, there is a major shortage of reading materials and other educational resources, especially for students living in rural areas. Worse, these children often live in poverty, and therefore cannot afford to buy books and other educational needs. 

Therefore, our aim in Projek Pelita is to help the underprivileged to achieve their dreams. There is no greater return than investing in education.

What We Need & What You Get

The funds would be used mainly to: 

  • To provide underprivileged children with revision books, stationery and interactive practice books to help improve their educational outlook. 
  • To introduce Pelita Educate, a private tutorial arm to assist children in improving their education standards. 
  • To increase the support offered to individual children in living in care homes (e.g. orphanages) including the development of new activities to inspire and increase interest in reading and education.
  • To support any other additional educational initiatives which encourage students to raise their achievement levels.
  • To assist any other core activities that is currently run by our organization such as book drives and refurbishment of rural area libraries.
  • To expand our reach to other South East Asia countries hence this fund will greatly help us in achieving our goal! 

The Impact

Since its foundation, Projek Pelita has:

  • Collected more than 65,000 books - which were then channelled to more than 58 rural area libraries, schools and orphanages.
  • Projek Pelita has established our very own library - known as Projek Pelita Pustaka - to provide a conducive environment for the underprivileged students to study and learn. We are aiming to open 3 more libraries by 2015 (currently 2 libraries - total 5) 
  • Projek Pelita successfully hosted the largest book drive in Malaysia's history - a record of 58,576 books in 7 days with the achievement being recorded in the Malaysia Book of Records.
  • Won 1st Runner Up for the myHarapan Hope Awards in the Education Category - recognizing Projek Pelita as one of the best youth-led organization in Malaysia
  •  Won 1st Runner Up for the DiGi Most Inspiring Internet for Good Awards.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, please:

  • Share this page in your Facebook or Twitter page! 
  • Help us by becoming one of the Projek Pelita Volunteers where you could be in action!

"If somebody had to leave this world, they deserve to leave it beautifully. Everybody deserves that. No matter how rich or poor you are, at the end of the day, you leave this world with what you brought to others. It in not the measure of what you achieved, but what you made others achieve."

story:
We are a first year charter school called the American International School of Utah. Our school is  trying to raise money for a club known as DECA (Distributive Education Clubs of America) that will train students in the school in business.


DECA has existed for around 70 years and it has impacted the lives of over ten million students, educators, school administrators and business professionals since 1946. Their goal is to provide the experience to prepare the emerging leaders and entrepreneurs of tomorrow. Their guiding principle is to explain how we fulfill our mission by addressing what we do and the outcomes we expect. This club allows its members to become more academically prepared, community oriented, professionally responsible, and experienced leaders. 

However, to begin this club, we require funding for expenses such as the entrance fees as well as transportation to DECA competitions and conventions. Technology that is important in our modern day business world will also be purchased from the funds which will allow us to simulate real life business experiences. With $10,000 of funding, our school's DECA club will be able to securely lift off and become available to the 600 students in the middle school and elementary school in years to come as well as the 300 high school students right now. Funding for DECA at our school will allow us to potentially change the lives of the one-thousand students present. 

A question that may be being asked is "How do I know that your club will become successful with the funding?" The people running the program are highly qualified and have high credentials. Tara Dimoh, who is ... Lee Basquin, who has judged at local, state, and national level for multiple DECA competitions is our other director.  Furthermore, our DECA president has competed at the International Career Development Conference and can effectively communicate advice so that all students may replicate her success. Furthermore, how do you even know that DECA is effective in training people for the future? Jay Leno, the host of NBC's The Tonight Show with Jay Leno from 1992 to 2009 was a member of DECA as well as Katie Couric who has been a television host on the Big Three television networks in the United States. Those are a few examples but imagine if you helped fund one of those people to become successful. You are investing in a better future.

It is recognized that all the funding may not be used during this year if our students do not manage to compete at a standard that students at the International Career Development Conference compete at. However, all the excess funding of this year will carry onto next year. Each year, our program will develop more and more to become a successful club in American International School of Utah. This is only possible through the support of the community. All the funding we can get will allow us to expand our club into a program that allows the success of students and in turn, the success of our generation. 

Help Secure the Future of our Nation!
story_txt:
We are a first year charter school called the American International School of Utah. Our school is  trying to raise money for a club known as DECA (Distributive Education Clubs of America) that will train students in the school in business.

DECA has existed for around 70 years and it has impacted the lives of over ten million students, educators, school administrators and business professionals since 1946. Their goal is to provide the experience to prepare the emerging leaders and entrepreneurs of tomorrow. Their guiding principle is to explain how we fulfill our mission by addressing what we do and the outcomes we expect. This club allows its members to become more academically prepared, community oriented, professionally responsible, and experienced leaders. 

However, to begin this club, we require funding for expenses such as the entrance fees as well as transportation to DECA competitions and conventions. Technology that is important in our modern day business world will also be purchased from the funds which will allow us to simulate real life business experiences. With $10,000 of funding, our school's DECA club will be able to securely lift off and become available to the 600 students in the middle school and elementary school in years to come as well as the 300 high school students right now. Funding for DECA at our school will allow us to potentially change the lives of the one-thousand students present. 

A question that may be being asked is "How do I know that your club will become successful with the funding?" The people running the program are highly qualified and have high credentials. Tara Dimoh, who is ... Lee Basquin, who has judged at local, state, and national level for multiple DECA competitions is our other director.  Furthermore, our DECA president has competed at the International Career Development Conference and can effectively communicate advice so that all students may replicate her success. Furthermore, how do you even know that DECA is effective in training people for the future? Jay Leno, the host of NBC's The Tonight Show with Jay Leno from 1992 to 2009 was a member of DECA as well as Katie Couric who has been a television host on the Big Three television networks in the United States. Those are a few examples but imagine if you helped fund one of those people to become successful. You are investing in a better future.

It is recognized that all the funding may not be used during this year if our students do not manage to compete at a standard that students at the International Career Development Conference compete at. However, all the excess funding of this year will carry onto next year. Each year, our program will develop more and more to become a successful club in American International School of Utah. This is only possible through the support of the community. All the funding we can get will allow us to expand our club into a program that allows the success of students and in turn, the success of our generation. 

Help Secure the Future of our Nation!

story:
Talkin' 'bout a Revolution...

This winter, the coalition government in the UK announced sweeping changes to university tuition fees that set higher education in Britain to be the most expensive in Europe.


Students voiced their discontent in widespread protests that brought news footage into our homes reminiscent of the 70s and 80s; from horses charging marchers, to the windows of Conservative Party office being kicked in by an angry mob. However, one occupation's success at holding their University and generating amazing amounts of support suggested that something different was happening here.


We - directors Isis, Srdan and Ludo - are three filmmakers that have been with a group of University College London students with a passion for change since day one.  We have seen them come together and organize themselves using Twitter, Facebook and YouTube to make their belief in the fundamental right to an affordable education heard across the country and around the world.  Their occupation, a classic 60s sit-in with a Twitter-feed twist, has seen the beginning of the strongest student movement in 40 years.


From their first occupation right through to the huge protests across London on 26th March we have recorded these amazing characters create technology that will change the face of protest forever, as well as become friends.  We believe we have a story that both captures a moment in time and will have massive resonance for the future.  And we need your help to complete it.


No Ifs, No Buts, We Need to Make Film Cuts!

We've shot hundreds of hours of footage right from the heart of the protests - with unique and exclusive access to our characters that hasn't been seen on any news programme or magazine article.  This film charts both the political and the personal to show the world that protest is vital, and can make a difference.

We want to tell this story of peaceful and innovative protest as quickly and as broadly as possible. 

By completing the film and showing it at festivals, on TV and in public screenings, we'll share a story and a world that means more today for a world in crisis than ever before.

You & Us, Not Them & Us

So far, we've made this by the seat of our pants and with the support of our producers. 


We've had no funding and this has meant we've been free to capture the story as it happens, right at the heart of things.  But now we need to get down to it and edit all this great material! 


We're asking for you to help us reach our $10,000 target which will pay for our super low budget post production process - essentially an editing team to help us put the film together so that we can get it out there to you, to students across the world and to a broader audience that might normally dismiss such protests as cliched student antics, when we can see this is anything but. 


We've put together a whole set of levels at which you can help us out - all with a fun educational twist - from a shiny gold star right up to a PhD in Real Social Networks, you can be part of a project that is charting changing the face of a generation.


Wave Your Placard!

Please also help by spreading the word.  As you can see from the links below, we have a Facebook page, a Twitter account and a website for the film.

 

Also please let us know your thoughts, ask us your questions and help us on the way to tell a really urgent story as soon as possible.

story:
Our Story

We are the Building Dreams Studio. We want to empower our next generation to go out and do the things that may seem impossible. We want to encourage them that with hard work and dedication, you can achieve you dreams. We are teaching the fundamentals of acting/singing/dancing plus a little extra. We want to teach performing arts because we as teachers are very passionate about this kind of career, but also within performing arts it teaches creativity, hard work, teamwork and the ability to be outgoing and go out of the box. We are located in Orlando, FL and want to reach out to kids and schools that may not have a lot of funding for the arts.

 

 There is no child that cannot benefit from learning about the performing arts. It teaches confidence, teamwork, and creativity. Without a program like ours, children may not have the opportunity to express how they are feeling in a world run by business oriented minds.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 We are going to need a permanent facility, where we can rent it and put dance floors and mirrors and be able to transform the space right for our studio. We are also going into schools and we wish for our look to be as professional as possible, getting matching shirts with our logo and doing different ways of advertising. We do not have other funding resources at the moment except for our own pockets. If we do not reach our goal on this website, we will still continue on with the project with whatever money is raised. The teachers at the studio are professionally actors and we will be having productions in the future in which all supporters will receive a special discounted rate to attend.

 

We are really looking forward to this project and we ask you to please get the word out by sending this to whoever you can think of, especially those who want to see this next generation succeed and make a better tomorrow. There are some "share tools" that will make this easier. Thank you so much for the support!

story:
Please help Women’s Refugee Commission find and fund a video journalist! The goal? To visually showcase an on-the-ground mission and ultimately raise awareness for displaced women and children. Join our journey to improve lives! 

The Background

-               43 million people in the world are displaced by conflict

-               80% of these are women, children and youth

-               Most are displaced for an average of 17 years

Women’s Refugee Commission (WRC) Mission: Our mission is to improve the lives and protect the rights of women, children and youth displaced by conflict and crisis. We research their needs, identify solutions and advocate for programs and policies to strengthen their resilience and drive change in humanitarian practice.

OKAY, GREAT! But…what does that really mean?

What does that research look like? How does that help WRC identify solutions? How are they actually helping people?

Our thoughts exactly.

The Challenge

The WRC has the unique challenge and opportunity to focus solely on research and advocacy. HOWEVER, because the WRC isn’t a service-based organization (e.g. they’re not travelling to refugee camps to provide food, clothing, shelter etc.) it’s relatively difficult to explain what they do and why it’s important.

Rather than addressing individual problems, Women’s Refugee Commission seeks to address the source of these problems.

So we thought – instead of trying to explain all this, why not try to show it?

The Solution

Step 1: Raise enough funds to sponsor a video journalist who will travel to a refugee camp alongside the Women’s Refugee Commission and document their research.

Step 2: Hold a competition to find a video journalist who is willing to volunteer their time and talent for a cause.

Step 3: Produce a video that helps the public ENVISION THE MISSION (i.e. a video that showcases both a real field-work mission and highlights how this contributes to the Women’s Refugee Commission primary mission, vision, and goals.)

How You Can Help

- Treasure !

  • Please donate to project Envision the Mission
  • The Breakdown:
    • 5 day trip to Southeast Asia / Africa
    • $1800 for flight
    • $500 lodging
    • $200 food
    • $300 travel insurance
    • $200 on ground transport
    • $1000 for production/administration costs and other expenses
    • $4000 Total

 - Talent !

  • Are you a talented video journalist interested in volunteering and travelling? Please submit your resume and a 2-3 minute video recording to Envision the Mission - Video Contest! 
    • Deadline: April 1, 2013
    • Submit your best narrative or experimental video about why you should be picked as a sponsor video journalist for the Women’s Refugee Commission.
    • This is where you can be creative. We are open to just about anything!
    • For more information on the contest, please click here.

 - Time !

  • Please help us spread the word – post our link on your social media platforms!
  • Please take some time to familiarize yourself with the Women’s Refugee Commission website – they’re doing a bunch of cool things to help people – we promise you’ll be impressed!

Who We Are

We’re a group of young volunteer professionals looking to make a difference. We were introduced to the Women’s Refugee Commission through the Mountbatten Institute - an organization of which we’re proud alumni. Please note we are not being compensated for our efforts. If you have any questions or comments, we would be MORE than happy to discuss these with you. Please contact us at EnvisiontheMission@gmail.com

Many thanks in advance for your support, 

Amanda Adamcheck

Lauren Chan

Christina Chang

Nicole Maisonville

Amanda Ray

Evan Spano

Envision the Mission is a sponsored project of Women’s Refugee Commission, a non-profit organization. Contributions for the purposes of Envision the Mission must be made payable to, Women’s Refugee Commission, and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

The Women's Refugee Commission is affiliated with and is legally part of the International Rescue Committee (IRC).

story:
My name is Harris Moore. I am the Director of the Celtic & Prehistoric Museum located in Dingle, Co. Kerry, Ireland. Two personal friends of mine in Nepal have pleaded with me to help their families, and I have promised them I would do my best. Their homes were both destroyed by the earthquake there on April 25th. The scale of the devastation in Nepal is beyond comprehension, and so it can be difficult to decide where to target one's donations. It can also be unnerving wondering where one's money will actually end up, or how much will be tapped away by "administrative costs". As for myself, I have decided to focus on the people I know personally and care about. I feel better knowing exactly where my money is actually going, and I hope you will share that confidence when you give. All funds raised during this drive will be transferred into the bank accounts of these two families...100% of it...end of story.

My friend Micheal Parajuli's family home is (was) in Kavre District (east of Kathmandu), an area which was hit very hard. He is currently working long shifts in a factory in South Korea for low wages and sending basically everything he earns back to his family. He estimates he will be stuck there for 4 to 6 more years. His father, mother, and brother are currently homeless, living in a makeshift tent.
My friend Ramesh Pradhan is a ceramic artist who until a couple weeks ago ran his business from his home in Bhaktapur in the Kathmandu Valley which was also largely obliterated. His family consists of nine people... including his 72 year-old mother and the families of his two brothers. Sadly, one of his brothers, Suresh was killed when the house collapsed. They are all currently homeless...and it is raining.
Fortunately, houses in Nepal are far cheaper than what we are accustomed to here in the west. $20,000 will cover rebuilding BOTH houses and get BOTH of these families off the street. If we collect more than $20,000, any excess funds will go into helping the next family, and hopefully even the next...there is no danger of running out of homeless families there anytime soon, unfortunately. 

Let's do this. Please help. 





Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
*Please note that Canadian tax receipts will be issued following the close of our campaign


Heart to Heart

"I discovered that it’s okay to argue. Before I thought that it’s not okay to argue and everyone has to agree. I was afraid of disagreement but now I found out that it helps us to move forward, to understand and talk about things so we can improve them."

- Sivan Polonski, 2014 participant

The Heart to Heart program brings a group of twenty Israeli teenagers to Canada every summer. Half of our participants identify as Palestinian Israeli, and half as Jewish Israeli. Upon arriving in Canada, the group spends two and a half weeks living together at Camp Shomria, an overnight summer camp near Ottawa. Daily activities include team-building workshops, camping trips, and facilitated dialogue about the narratives, politics, and power dynamics that participants face in their daily lives at home. The group also visits Parliament Hill in Ottawa, and spends four days living with Canadian host families while touring Toronto. The time spent in Canada is a focal point for the group, but it is complemented by workshops for participants at the Givat Haviva campus and in their respective communities leading up to and after their trip.


Why We Exist
Heart to Heart was founded in 2011 as a partnership between the Givat Haviva Education Foundation in Israel and Hashomer Hatzair/Camp Shomria in Canada. Givat Haviva is an Israeli non-profit organization dedicated to promoting mutual responsibility, civic equality, and cooperation among divided groups in Israel. Givat Haviva ensures parity between Palestinian and Jewish Israeli leadership at every administrative level, and was awarded the UNESCO Prize for Peace Education in 2001.

Heart to Heart was founded as a response to the structural inequity and racism in Israeli society. We do not believe that peer-education among Jewish and Palestinian Israeli youth is the entire solution to creating an equitable, shared society. However, we do believe that it is an important part of the solution. As we head into our fifth year, Heart to Heart has equipped 80 program alumni with newfound perspectives and skills and the motivation they need to determine for themselves what a solution may look like, as well as how they can continue contributing to it. 

At Heart to Heart, we are building a generation of leaders who will both recognize the importance of creating a truly shared society, and possess the skills they need to make it a reality. We hope you will join us in continuing to make this incredible journey a reality for the next generation of Palestinian and Jewish Israeli leaders.

Educational Goals
Our program is built on four central educational goals; 1) Critical thinking and reflection; 2) Group-building, communication, and teamwork; 3) Adaptability, autonomy, and resiliency; 4) Achieve a balance between hope and realistic expectations. Click HERE to learn more about our educational programming.

What We Need and What Happens If We Exceed Our Goal?

After a successful four years of Heart to Heart we know that this program has a profound impact on our participants, their families and communities, as well as the community at Camp Shomria and in Toronto. To make this program a reality we need the support of people like you who understand the importance of this kind of work.

This year our target of $90,000 represents the cost of running the Heart to Heart program,  the cost of creating an amazing 30 minute documentary film (to be subtitled in Arabic and Hebrew so that the participants can use it to share their experiences with their schools and communities once it is fully funded) and $27,000 to launch an alumni program in time for this year's participants return to Israel at the end of the summer. We have set our fundraising goal at $5,000 which represents only a fraction of what it takes to make all of this a reality. We are hoping to far exceed our goal with your help!

Alumni Program
We know that Heart to Heart is a program that creates real impact. We also know that in order for this impact to be sustained over the long term, participants must have an ongoing learning process and structure of support when they return to Israel. That is why we are excited to launch our Heart to Heart Alumni Program.

At the end of this summer, Heart to Heart will have 100 alumni - it is our hope to be able to launch the program in time for this summer's participants' return to Israel after the program so that they will be able to be the first ever group to transition directly into a continuation program. To launch our alumni program we need to raise an additional $27,000.

For further details regarding the alumni program please contact Jenny Isaacs at jennyaisaacs@gmail.com

Other Ways to Donate
Aside from our Indiegogo campaign home, you can also donate to Heart to Heart by cheque, credit card over the phone, or through Canadahelps. For details please go to our Heart to Heart website by clicking here. 

Other Ways You Can Help
There are many ways to support the program, aside from making a financial contribution. Attending the reception to learn more and meet this year’s youths, hosting a participant during their stay in Toronto, and helping to spread the word by talking to your friends and  family and sharing our campaign online are all greatly appreciated!

If you are interested in helping out in any way, please contact the Program Coordinator at heart2heart@campshomria.ca. 

Tax Receipts
We are able to issue tax receipts for donations made via Indiegogo! To receive a tax receipt please ensure that you collect a perk and leave us your home address so we can issue the receipt! Please note that all tax receipts will be issued by Hashomer Hatzair, the umbrella organization of Heart to Heart. 

Thank you for your support!
