 discovered that it’s okay to argue. Before I thought that it’s not okay
 to argue and everyone has to agree. I was afraid of disagreement but 
now I found out that it helps us to move forward, to understand and talk
 about things so we can improve them." 
- Sivan Polonski, 2014 
participant
The Heart to Heart program
 brings a group of twenty Israeli teenagers to Canada every summer. Half
 of our participants identify as Palestinian Israeli, and half as Jewish
 Israeli. Upon arriving in Canada, the group spends two and a half weeks
 living together at Camp Shomria, an overnight summer camp near Ottawa. 
Daily activities include team-building workshops, camping trips, and 
facilitated dialogue about the narratives, politics, and power dynamics 
that participants face in their daily lives at home. The group also 
visits Parliament Hill in Ottawa, and spends four days living with 
Canadian host families while touring Toronto. The time spent in Canada 
is a focal point for the group, but it is complemented by workshops for 
participants at the Givat Haviva campus and in their respective 
communities leading up to and after their trip. Why We ExistHeart to Heart was founded in 2011 as a partnership between the Givat Haviva Education Foundation in Israel and Hashomer Hatzair/Camp Shomria in
 Canada. Givat Haviva is an Israeli non-profit organization dedicated to
 promoting mutual responsibility, civic equality, and cooperation among 
divided groups in Israel. Givat Haviva ensures parity between 
Palestinian and Jewish Israeli leadership at every administrative level,
 and was awarded the UNESCO Prize for Peace Education in 2001. Heart to Heart was
 founded as a response to the structural inequity and racism in Israeli 
society. We do not believe that peer-education among Jewish and 
Palestinian Israeli youth is the entire solution to creating an 
equitable, shared society. However, we do believe that it is an 
important part of the solution. As we head into our fifth year, Heart to Heart
 has equipped 80 program alumni with newfound perspectives and skills 
and the motivation they need to determine for themselves what a solution
 may look like, as well as how they can continue contributing to it.  At Heart to Heart,
 we are building a generation of leaders who will both recognize the 
importance of creating a truly shared society, and possess the skills 
they need to make it a reality. We hope you will join us in continuing 
to make this incredible journey a reality for the next generation of 
Palestinian and Jewish Israeli leaders. Educational GoalsOur program is built on four central educational goals;
 1) Critical thinking and reflection; 2) Group-building, communication, 
and teamwork; 3) Adaptability, autonomy, and resiliency; 4) Achieve a 
balance between hope and realistic expectations. Click HERE to learn more about our educational programming.What We Need and
What Happens If We Exceed Our Goal?After a successful four years of Heart to Heart we know that this 
program has a profound impact on our participants, their families and 
communities, as well as the community at Camp Shomria and in Toronto. To
 make this program a reality we need the support of people like you who 
understand the importance of this kind of work. This year our
 target of $90,000 represents the cost of running the Heart to Heart 
program,  the cost of creating an amazing 30 minute documentary film 
(to be subtitled in Arabic and Hebrew so that the participants can 
use it to share their experiences with their schools and communities once it is fully funded) 
and $27,000 to launch an alumni program in time for this year's 
participants return to Israel at the end of the summer. We have set our fundraising
goal at $5,000 which represents only a fraction of what it takes to make all of this a reality. We are hoping to far exceed our goal with your help! Alumni ProgramWe
 know that Heart to Heart is a program that creates real impact. We also
 know that in order for this impact to be sustained over the long term, 
participants must have an ongoing learning process and structure of 
support when they return to Israel. That is why we are excited to launch
 our Heart to Heart Alumni Program.At the end of this summer, Heart to Heart will have 100 alumni
 - it is our hope to be able to launch the program in time for this 
summer's participants' return to Israel after the program so that they 
will be able to be the first ever group to transition directly into a 
continuation program. To launch our alumni program we need to raise an 
additional $27,000. For further details regarding the alumni program please contact Jenny Isaacs at jennyaisaacs@gmail.comOther Ways to DonateAside
 from our Indiegogo campaign home, you can also donate to Heart to Heart
 by cheque, credit card over the phone, or through Canadahelps. For 
details please go to our Heart to Heart website by clicking here. 

Other Ways You Can HelpThere are many ways to support
the program, aside from making a financial contribution. Attending the reception to
learn more and meet this year’s youths, hosting a participant during their stay
in Toronto, and helping to spread the word by talking to your friends and
 family and sharing our campaign online are all greatly appreciated!If you are interested in helping out in any way, please contact the Program
Coordinator at heart2heart@campshomria.ca. 
Tax ReceiptsWe are able to issue tax
receipts for donations made via Indiegogo! To receive a tax receipt please
ensure that you collect a perk and leave us your home address so we can issue
the receipt! Please note that all tax receipts will be issued by Hashomer Hatzair, the umbrella organization of Heart to Heart. 
Thank you for your support!

story:
My name is Olesia Kosiuk, I’m Ukrainian and I live in Ivano-Frankivsk (Ukraine). Before I start talking about my project let me tell you a couple of words about myself.

I’m a professional translator. I work with French, English and Ukrainian languages. Ukrainian being my native language, English and French I learned at the Ukrainian National Schevchenko University. I graduated with a Master Degree in 2007. Then I continued my studies in Paris, where I managed to improve my French. After my studies I came back to Ukraine and started to work as translator.

I started translating books three years ago, when I met sisters from the Incarnated Word Congregation (the Servants of the Lord and the Virgin of Matara), who have one of  their convents in Ivano-Frankivsk. I translated a children’s bible of the French author Sophie de Ségur and this book was published recently (“La Bible de la Grand’Mère’’ or “Бабусина Біблія” in Ukrainian). At that time I started learning Spanish with the sisters in order to translate books for them from Spanish as well. It appeared to be quite easy after French language, and my Spanish teachers say I’d be able to translate from Spanish soon. But of course I need to practice it.

….

Now I have an opportunity to improve and practise Spanish: to go to Argentina and work as a volunteer in the home for children run by the sisters Servants of the Lord and the Virgin of Matara in San Rafael. The idea is, that helping sisters with their everyday duties and communicating with children and sisters, I’d be able to improve my Spanish and make it good enough to translate. I also hope to do something good for these children, deprived of parents’ attention. I do really hope to get myself a lesson of love in this place and to become a better person too.

…..

With the money I earned for the translation and with some borrowed money I managed to buy a round trip ticket to Argentina. More precisely, to Buenos Aires. The dates are the following: going to Argentina on 1.03.2016 and come back to Ukraine on 26.05.2016.  And this is where I need your help…

……

I need your financial support to be able: to go to Kyiv and pay French visa fees  and inevitable visacenter fees (as our plane goes through Paris where we stay one day) - around 86 USD; to come from my town Kyiv to take a plane, round trip -20 USD;  to take a bus from Buenos Aires to San Raphael (round trip) -156 USD; to take a bus (round trip) to go to Iguazu  waterfalls  or to visit San Carlos de Bariloche -220 USD (which is just an option);  to buy things I need for the trip -200 USD; and to have some 300 USD with me (as I’m going to stay in a foreign country for 3 months). Makes totally 982 USD. But in my fundraising campaign I’m asking for 1200 USD. If I manage to raise all this money, I’ll buy souvenirs for friends and family, and those who supported me in this adventure. Even if I don’t raise this amount, every dollar or euro will be of a great help to me.

As to my potential sponsors, I promise to send a postcard from Argentina or buy a small souvenir for those who will contribute to make this trip possible . But now, even before I left, I can send you the book of Sophie de Ségur ‘’La Bible de la Grand’Mere’’, which I translated into Ukrainian.

….

You might wonder in what way my trip to Argentina can be useful for people or for You personally. I hope that the book that I’ve translated, and those I’ll translate in the future, will be read by adults and children.  Hope that some of them will learn something new or find answers to some of their questions. You might say that since I’m translating into Ukrainian (for now), I’d better ask Ukrainians to help me with the trip. I did ask my friends and they helped me to pay the entire price of the ticket. But honestly, a trip to Argentina is pretty expensive for most of Ukrainians. Please don’t think that I want somebody else to pay my trip, it’s just I couldn’t earn more by myself, unfortunately. And of course, being a volunteer, I don’t have an obligation to go anywhere else in Argentina (see Iguazu waterfalls or  any other sightseeing), but Argentina is so far away and expensive for Ukrainians, that I’m not sure I’ll get back there soon or at all.

If you can’t support me financially, but you  know somebody who might help, please share this information with this person. Your prayers will be also appreciated. Thank you. Olesia.

story:
_____________________________________________________________________________

OUR IDEA

_____________________________________________________________________________

What Do You Know?

Think about this: Millions of experienced industrial and technical professionals all around the globe have accumulated a huge amount of knowledge…and most of it is just sitting unused on their computers!

How valuable would all that idle knowledge be if those professionals had a simple, streamlined way to share it with each other?

Fact #1:  All over the world, individuals have stores of Idle Knowledge Inventory.

Fact #2:  Everyone knows something.  Someone needs what you know.

Fact #3:  Knowledge is a commodity that can be “MINED”

Fact #4:  Opportunities abound in the shared economy (Airbnb and Uber have proven this!)  

3pdoc is a Global Sharing Resource for Industrial and Technical Professionals.  Our prototype website, opening November 20th, 2015, allows professionals in any industry to search, buy and sell copyright-free plans, policies, and procedures in editable format (see more details below).

But we have an even BIGGER, BOLDER, GAME-CHANGING idea based on the four facts above. We are raising funds to build the infrastructure for our patent-pending, fully collaborative “Knowledge Mining Community” that will revolutionize the future of document sharing worldwide!

____________________________________________________________________________

THE KNOWLEDGE MINING GOLD RUSH

____________________________________________________________________________

It is widely accepted that information is now the world’s most valuable currency. This means the global Idle Knowledge Inventory represents a virtual gold mine! Our vision for the next generation of 3pdoc is to: provide a unique, collaborative organization for our customers; help users build their own communities within specific areas of knowledge; market and promote our patent-pending knowledge claim structure; and expand revenue-generating opportunities for EVERYONE. Here are the various ways that community members can participate in 3pdoc’s Knowledge Mining Gold Rush:

Claim Holders

Claim holders “Stake their Claim” to an exclusive body of knowledge and lease that claim each year for $99.  Claim Holders receive a Certificate of Claim with a unique numerical identifier, which reserves the exclusive rights to their knowledge territory and protects against claim jumpers. Examples of a Knowledge Claim may be:

  • Asbestos Abatement, California

  • Infectious Diseases – Ebola

  • Oil Field Preventative Maintenance, Texas

As a 3pdoc Claim Holder in good standing, you can:

  • Invite up to 150 “Miners” to join your claim and sell their documents in your territory

  • Approve all documents sold within your Claim

  • Release Miners from your Claim  

  • Earn 5% of the purchase price for every document sold by one of your “Miners”

  • Earn 70% of the purchase price for every document that you sell, personally

  • Purchase and manage multiple Claims

  • Have all your upload fees waived

Maintaining a Claim

Of course, as a Claim Holder, you must take care of your Miners and maintain your territory.  We wouldn’t want all that Idle Knowledge to be, well… Idle!  So you’ll need to agree to a few standards to keep your Claim status.  Don’t worry, they’re just common sense to a successful businessman or businesswoman like yourself! Things like promoting your Claim (your Miners can help), maintaining a minimum level feedback rating, minimizing the backlog of documents requiring approval, taking care of your customers, and so on.

Miners

Miners apply through the 3pdoc portal and are invited to join a Claim by the Claim Holder.  They have documents to sell that are relevant to the Knowledge Claim.  As a Miner:  

  • You receive 70% of the purchase price of every document you sell

  • Your products will enjoy special promotion by 3pdoc and the Claim Holder as part of the Knowledge Claim category

  • Your uploads are all free!

  • You can belong to multiple Knowledge Claims

Miner Responsibilities

Miners have their duties, too!  To help your Claim Holder be a success and support your mining community, you need to do your part by:

  • Participating in marketing the Claim through blogs, posts, tweets, etc.

  • Maintaining a minimum average customer feedback rating

  • Resolving customer complaints in a timely manner

Miners can be released from a Claim for not meeting minimum requirements of performance or quality.

Prospectors

Prospectors are independent.  They sell their documents but are not affiliated with a Knowledge Claim.  Miners who have documents not related to a Claim to which they belong, may also sell them under the Prospector category.  

As a Prospector, you:

  • Receive 70% of the purchase price of every document you sell

Prospector Responsibilities:

  • Resolve customer complaints in a timely manner

____________________________________________________________________________

WHAT WE HAVE NOW

_____________________________________________________________________________

The current 3pdoc prototype website (opening November 20th, 2015) allows professionals in any industry to search, buy and sell copyright-free plans, policies, and procedures in editable format.  It was designed to reduce the cycle-time used daily in every company around the world to produce documents meeting regulatory and business requirements, such as:

  • New ventures

  • New clients

  • Regulatory compliance

  • Business requirements

  • Sales Initiatives

  • And more….

Our pioneering website eliminates the tedious, time-consuming methods of the past and makes your job so much easier! It’s the end of:

  • Searching the internet;

  • Downloading PDF documents;

  • Converting them to Word

  • Merging several together to fit your needs; and,

  • Fighting embedded formatting

…just to produce a useful document that legally leverages the expertise of other industrial and technical professionals.

3pdoc makes it easy to search and find the documents you need with no copyrights and in editable format! And once you tweak the document for your specific purpose, you can turn around and re-sell it!

____________________________________________________________________________

WHAT WE NEED

____________________________________________________________________________

_____________________________________________________________________________

PERKS

_____________________________________________________________________________


Knowledgist

You rock! You want to help make the world a smarter place and plan to keep an eye on things to see how 3pdoc evolves. We will keep you posted with updates, add your name to our THANK YOU page, and invite you to upcoming virtual and live events

Knowledge Prospector

Pan for gold! You're intelligent, you’re busy and you understand the value of the 3pdoc concept. But you are all about getting stuff done and saving money!  Get a 2.5% discount on every document you purchase for 1 year.

Knowledge Miner

Mine for Free! You have documents to sell and don't want to pay upload fees. We will waive the standard $0.99 per document upload fee for 1 year, unlimited. Purchase documents at the regular price.

Knowledge Engineer

Get More Gold! You want to earn extra money for making sales on 3pdoc. Receive an extra 2.5% for each and every document you sell for 1 year. (70% + 2.5% = Woohoo!). You'll still pay the regular upload fee of $0.99 per document.

Knowledge Supervisor

Get it all! You have documents to sell and you want to optimize all of your revenue potential. Contribute at this level and we will waive your upload fees AND give you an extra 2.5% on every sale for one year!

Knowledge Claim Holder

Stake Your Claim! Jump into the Knowledge Gold Rush early and speculate on probable reserves. In the next version of 3pdoc (estimated launch Summer 2016), you can claim one area of knowledge expertise for one year, invite up to 150 miners to join your claim, and earn 5% of every sale they make! Contribute early to reserve your Claim. Lease may be renewed annually at the regular rate of $99.

Eureka!

Stake 5 Claims and get one free! Now you're a knowledge land baron! With six Claims and up to 900 Knowledge Miners working your Claim for one year, you're creating community, making the world smarter, and collecting 5% royalties!  Leases may be renewed annually at regular rate of $99 per Claim.

The Mother Lode

Hit the Mother Lode! Stake 10 Claims and get three more free. With 13 Claims and up to 1,950 Knowledge Miners working your Claim for one year, you're creating community, making the world smarter, collecting 5% royalties and changing the game! Leases may be renewed annually at regular rate of $99 per Claim.

Knowledge Mill Operator

Underwrite the Mine! We will place your brand name, logo and website URL/link in a prominent place on 3pdoc for 1 year as a valued website sponsor. Your business will also be listed in any media-related materials.

Platinum Patron

Go Platinum! This is an exclusive opportunity to partner with 3pdoc and take it to the next level. Plan a business lunch with both 3pdoc founders anywhere in the world (restrictions apply) to discuss future plans and potential collaboration.

_____________________________________________________________________________

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

_____________________________________________________________________________

Don't forget, money isn't the only way you can help us with this campaign! If you have no money, fret not, here’s what you can do:

  • SHARE SHARE SHARE! Yes, that's right, share this campaign like crazy.  You’re friends and colleagues want to know!  You can share this Indiegogo page or the 3pdoc homepage on any of your preferred social sites. Forward a link, like us, tweet about us, write a blog, and reach out to your LinkedIn groups.  We can't get funding if people don't know this campaign exists. These options are all easily accessible with the share buttons below.

  • Tell Your Friends - LITERALLY. Call them, talk to them, help create some excitement and catch up in the meantime! Don’t just use your keyboard.  

  • Tell us that you love the idea!  Comment, send us messages, whatever!  We want to know that this campaign can help better professional lives.  We want to know that 3pdoc is something that you see value in!!  


In Gratitude,
David S. Beadle, CEO | Founder
Deidra Mitchell, COO | Co-Founder

SHARE SHARE SHARE! Yes, that's right, share this campaign like crazy.  You’re friends and colleagues want to know!  You can share this Indiegogo page or the 3pdoc homepage on any of your preferred social sites. Forward a link, like us, tweet about us, write a blog, and reach out to your LinkedIn groups.  We can't get funding if people don't know this campaign exists. These options are all easily accessible with the share buttons below. 
Tell Your Friends - LITERALLY. Call them, talk to them, help create some excitement and catch up in the meantime! Don’t just use your keyboard.  
Tell us that you love the idea!  Comment, send us messages, whatever!  We want to know that this campaign can help better professional lives.  We want to know that 3pdoc is something that you see value in!!  

In Gratitude,David S. Beadle, CEO | FounderDeidra Mitchell, COO | Co-Founder

story:
Who We Are

Our names are Michael, Matt, Aron, and Carl, and we are a group of students at the University of Tennessee, Knoxville working to promote the Shooting for Women Alliance (SFWA) in order to help them raise money for resources that they need. More specifically, we are attempting to raise $1,000 to aid them in acquiring ammunition, travel expenses to conferences, office supplies, and gun cleaning supplies.

Shooting for Women Alliance, founded in 2003 by Susan and Rob Rexrode, was inspired by Susan’s horrifying experience of being held hostage at knifepoint in her home for five hours, and then stalked for two years afterwards. After this, she decided to dedicate her life to the education of women, as well as men and youth, in self-defense in the form of firearms, and to the enjoyment of shooting sports.

(Susan Rexrode [bottom right] and some of her students)

Recently, SFWA has become a nationally recognized organization for their efforts in educating women in self-defense. Just this past February, Susan presented the awards on behalf of the Shooting for Women Alliance at the Ladies ' Choice Awards at Shot Show 2015 in Las Vegas.

(They have fun at SFWA!)

What We Need And What You Get

SFWA is in need of cleaning supplies for their training firearms. This is especially important because firearms may malfunction if they are not clean, causing serious injury to the person firing the gun. Also, the SFWA regularly attends conferences in different locations of the United States, and they are in need of funds to cover their travel expenses which range from lodging, airline tickets, and registration fees. Finally, we need to raise money for ammunition, which is used in their classes.

Donations of any amount are greatly appreciated. However, if you donate $15 you will receive a SFWA pin. If you decide to graciously donate $30, you will receive a pin and a shout out on our Facebook page. For donations of $75, you will receive an SFWA pin, free enrollment in their “What Women Want” class, and a year membership to the shooting range, a value of over $300.

Who It Helps

Shooting For Women Alliance assists the community by educating women and their families on firearm safety and procedure. Your generous donations will ensure that these firearm safety classes will continue to be offered to those in our community who need them most.

(One of the SFWA’s many seminars)

Other Ways You Can Help

Other than monetary donations, you can help the SFWA by volunteering at the shooting range, or by donating ammunition and office supplies such as printing paper, printers and computers to the range directly. Another way to help this organization is to like our Facebook page (link below) and spread the word about this wonderful organization on social media.

To find out more information on how you can help, please call Susan or Rob Rexrode at (865) 329-3293 or email them at susan@shootingforwomenalliance.com.

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Shooting-for-Women-Alliance/248487042010

story:
Stage for Change is cultural capital.

Stage for Change is dialogue.

Stage for Change is your story.

Who We Are

We believe that individuals' stories can be used as dynamic tools to improve communities, institutions, and society. Stage for Change strives to develop and implement strategies for translating individuals’ narratives into effective solutions.

Because solutions to improve the world are embedded in people’s stories, we strive to identify, formulate, and disperse the stories.

We, the co-founder and executive director of “Show Some Skin” established at the University of Notre Dame, wish to carry our significant work beyond the Notre Dame community by establishing an independent nonprofit called STAGE FOR CHANGE.



Our Story

Since 2011, the Show Some Skin initiative has collected anonymous monologues from our community (students, faculty, and staff) around the issues of identity, inclusion, and difference. Each year we presented these selected narratives as community theater productions. Then we brought the monologues back into the classrooms and trainings for students, faculty, and staff. For the past four years, our production Show Some Skin has enjoyed SOLD OUT performances for two to three nights with venues holding 300+ people.

Show Some Skin has received immense support and approval on campus since its beginning. Audience members have called it “powerful and thought-provoking” as well as “eye-opening.” The response affirmed the need for this type of space within our community. 


Stage for Change Inc. will continue to spread our  “Show Some Skin” model of leveraging the unspoken and unheard stories within a community on identity and difference to promote understanding, be a platform for dialogue, and a catalyst for change. Our goal is to share the lessons we have learned with campuses and communities across the nation.

Students and faculty gathered for a post-show discussion.


How You Can Help!

Your contribution will help us get off the ground! We are already incorporated within the state and wish to move forward to become a nonprofit! For more information check out our promotional video and our TedTalk to understand more the value of that Stage for Change hopes to bring to communities.


Please consider donating to our campaign. We appreciate all contributions. Here is a list of all the things your contribution will go toward:

Application fee for nonprofit tax-exempt status

Protection for the monologue database

Developing workshop pamphlets for professors

Developing diversity training pamphlets

Publishing costs

Licensing Fees

Marketing Materials

Conferences costs to share the model with other educators and administrators

Bringing the model to another university!

Thank you for your support and consideration. Stage for Change is a 501(c)(3) non-profit with tax-exempt status.  Please help us reach our goal! Even if you cannot donate we ask that you please continue to support us by sharing our story with others, centering your own narrative, and listening to the stories of others!

Thank You!

story:
Imagine what it would be like to live without being able to properly utilize one or all of your senses. Being able to utilize the five senses is something that people often take for granted. Unfortunately for much of the special needs community, the use of the senses and some fundamental skills are not simple accomplishments.


We are Binghamton University students raising money for ACHIEVE. This facility provides many opportunities for people who face challenges because of their various disabilities. ACHIEVE makes it possible for these individuals to have a sense of normalcy and be able to participate in activities that match their skill and interest levels. Individuals at ACHIEVE are often able to work and volunteer in the community, as well as interact with other people who have similar special needs.


ACHIEVE is a valuable resource for people with developmental, physical, intellectual and other disabilities in Tioga and Broome counties. This organization has been the largest voluntary provider of opportunities and services for individuals with disabilities in this area for the past 64 years. The goal of ACHIEVE is to advocate for people with varying disabilities and provide an augmented quality of life for these members of the community. ACHIEVE offers many different programs for the improvement and success of people in the community who have disabilities. These programs include, a day habilitation program, vocational services, resident services, summer programs, family support programs, and more.


This semester, we met some workers and participants involved in the day habilitation program at ACHIEVE. We learned that the Sensory Room is a wonderful tool which helps the many of the special needs participants improve their sensory skills by giving them opportunity to experiment with their senses such as touch, smell, sight, or sound. The Sensory Room is an outlet for people who may not always be able to communicate what they want or need. Some people with special needs may not always know how to cooperate and interact with their changing sensory output, so they tend to deviate from properly utilizing their senses. Giving them an alternative outlet can help them learn to express themselves with auditory, visual, and tactile growth.


The Sensory Room has many activities for individuals to involve themselves in such as a light board that reacts to verbal cues or noises, a bubble tube for visual stimulation, and a variety of other activities which improve the tactile and motor skills that special needs populations often have difficulties controlling.


Our goal as Binghamton students is to raise $1,000 for Touch Board Panels for the Sensory Room. A touch board panel is a compilation of different tactile exercises which allow individuals to express themselves in a positive and effective manner. These panels also help with improving hand-eye coordination, color recognition, cause and effect, and logical thinking.


Helping us raise money for these panels will make a big difference in the lives of those who need it. With the help of the Touch Board Panels, participants will continue to learn how to properly use their senses and how to improve their interaction skills and relationships with others. The panel helps increase functional skills, and decrease behavior that could be potentially self-harming. Please help us in any way you can. Whether you can donate, or just simply share our campaign, it will be a step in the right direction in helping touch the lives of those who need it.

story:
Toronto Waterfront Marathon. Oct. 18, 2015. 26.2 miles.

I'm running not for myself, but to help save a language. Xaayda Kil -- or Xaad Kil in the north -- is the native tongue of the Haida nation, from the islands of Haida Gwaii off the northwest coast of British Columbia. The language is a Canadian cultural treasure, and it is in danger.

It is spoken fluently by only a few dozen people, many of whom are in their 70s and 80s. The "Language Warriors" of Haida Gwaii have been fighting valiantly for decades to preserve their language for future generations. They need our help.

When I fundraised two years ago by running the Brooklyn Marathon, all money went to the publication and distribution of free Haida-language children's books in local elementary schools.

This time, funds will help with projects like an annual language bursary in the local high school, production and distribution of the first-ever Haida dictionary, and multi-day language "boot camps" in the village of Masset,

Pledge me today, and funds will go to local organizations like the Skidegate Haida Immersion Program (http://on.fb.me/19qw43p), which aims to preserve the Haida language through classes, books, scholarships, recordings and apps.

Haawa (Thank you!)

story:
Hi,

I’m Zouhir Chahoud and I’m a Software Engineer who wants to help Syrian refugees, as well as refugees from other Arabic-speaking countries gain a living on their own.

By now, I’m sure everyone has already heard about their plight: forced by wars that seem unending to flee their homes, these refugees have suddenly found themselves in countries they know very little about, without speaking the language and with very little chances of getting a job there.

So far, more than two million refugees have entered Europe alone in 2015 and the beginning of 2016, which has led to what is now generically called “Europe’s immigration crisis”. Aside from the stunning two million, other millions of refugees (primarily Syrian, Afghan and Irakian) are now in Turkey, Jordan or Lebanon.

Sadly, the governments of the countries currently hosting refugees are overwhelmed by the influx, which creates severe economic and social pressure. Perhaps the hardest task these governments have to face is integrating the refugees who don’t speak the local language into the workforce. Luckily, JavaScript is a universal language and, more importantly, it’s a language that, once learnt, it can help immigrants HELP THEMSELVES.

My plan:


There are countless NGOs that work alongside governments in all countries that harbor immigrants to help them with basic necessities like food, clothing and shelter. However, this is not something that can be sustained in the long run. If we join hands, we can actually do something that will help immigrants make a living for themselves.

Briefly put, I intend to teach all Arabic-speaking immigrants JavaScript for free, in their mother tongue. Within six months, they should be able to land their first entry-level job or their first freelancing gig. Afterwards, the sky is the limit!

In order to support my students, I plan to have various articles on JavaScript and programming in general translated into Arabic, as well as counsel them on soft skills they need to get a job or a freelancing gig..

Why JavaScript?

Aside from my love for it, I chose JavaScript because:

-  It’s the programming language of the future

-  It’s very versatile: you can apps for web, iOS and Android mobile platforms as well as OSX, Linux, and Windows computer

-  According to a recent 2016 StackOverflow survey, up to 69% of software developers are self-taught and they still make more money than some computer science graduates

-  It’s easy to learn and use – at least at a basic level

Your Contribution

As an Arabic speaker, I can prepare the course material in this language as well as interact with the students as often as they need me to. There is a limit to the time I can allocate to this, as well as to the funds, so this is where you come in:

- Translating articles and tutorials hand-picked by me, as well as white papers from English to Arabic with a freelance translator. The Internet is filled with amazing resources, but so few of them are in Arabic and I plan to change that!

- Some of the greatest minds behind excellent frameworks have written articles, e-books and white papers -- all types of content that would be extremely beneficial and motivating for students if we can translate them into Arabic

-  Getting respected members of the JavaScript community to record guests course and translating them into Arabic

-  Recording equipment

-  Paying for the platform and learning management system hosting resources as the scale of this project is bound to grow and we will need sturdy solutions.

Together, we can help refugees EMPOWER themselves!

The beginning

When I first had this idea, I didn’t think that I would get such an amazing and overwhelming response.

My initial announcement was re-tweeted over 185 times in the first 24 hours. People that I admire a lot supported my initiative: the founder of Elastic, CouchDB and JSConfeu maker, O’Reilly book author Eric Elliott and Google Engineer Addy Osmani  — thank you, guys, your support means the world to me!

In the same 24 hours, I already got 35 responses from people who are serious about learning JavaScript and want to commit. I am so happy to see the interest this has generated, more than I had ever hoped it would. So, my initiative seems bound to turn into something much bigger. I plan to setup a platform where we can all communicate, exchange information and get to know each other — I can no longer simply rely on Skype, as I had planned. Plus, I will create video courses in Arabic, I’ll translate some must-see ones in English and create written code and demos, as well.

About myself

My name is Zouhir, I was born and raised in Syria. I’m currently a Consultant Software Engineer based at the Commonwealth Bank of Australia, the country’s leading bank. But more important than my job is my passion for science and for education. At the age of 17, I won a national web programming award and I was a physics pioneer for two years in a row before that.

I strongly believe that my passion for the right kind of education is what put me on the path that I am now and that I absolutely love, so it is time for me to give something back. I am a fluent Arabic, English and JavaScript speaker and I am more than happy to combine these three skills in order to help people who desperately need some stability in their lives right now.


Don't forget to spread the word! Every share counts towards making this project  become reality!

story:
I am working with an grassroots group called the Newtown Action Alliance to make sure that the Sandy Hook tragedy results in changes that make our communities safer.  As a part of this strategy, the NAA organizes trips to Washington DC every three months to meet with lawmakers and the media to keep the issue of gun violence in the forefront.

I would like to go with the NAA to DC on September 17th-18th for the 9 month anniversary of the shooting.  And I would like to bring a gun violence victim, survivor or family member from another part of the country, with me.

It will cost approx. $500 to send me and a colleague from another community to DC for this trip so that our voices can be heard, and so we make sure that they do not forget.

I have pledged to raise money to help pay our way and I am asking for your support.   Even a small donation of $12.14 would be a helpful symbolic gesture. $26.00 would be even more symbolic and helpful.  Really, any amount you can offer would be terrific and very much appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your support of this important cause.   Please email me at dave@daveackert.com if you have any questions.

-Dave

PS.  Here is a link to the NAA website for more info:  www.newtownaction.org

Here is a link to a video from the last trip to DC in June for the six month anniversary:  http://www.theday.com/article/20130614/MEDIA0101/130619786
story_txt:
I am working with an grassroots group called the Newtown Action Alliance to make sure that the Sandy Hook tragedy results in changes that make our communities safer.  As a part of this strategy, the NAA organizes trips to Washington DC every three months to meet with lawmakers and the media to keep the issue of gun violence in the forefront.
I would like to go with the NAA to DC on September 17th-18th for the 9 month anniversary of the shooting.  And I would like to bring a gun violence victim, survivor or family member from another part of the country, with me.
It will cost approx. $500 to send me and a colleague from another community to DC for this trip so that our voices can be heard, and so we make sure that they do not forget.
I have pledged to raise money to help pay our way and I am asking for your support.   Even a small donation of $12.14 would be a helpful symbolic gesture. $26.00 would be even more symbolic and helpful.  Really, any amount you can offer would be terrific and very much appreciated.
Thank you in advance for your support of this important cause.   Please email me at dave@daveackert.com if you have any questions.
-Dave
PS.  Here is a link to the NAA website for more info:  www.newtownaction.org
Here is a link to a video from the last trip to DC in June for the six month anniversary:  http://www.theday.com/article/20130614/MEDIA0101/130619786

story:
Click here to watch video.

A PARENTS WORST NIGHTMARE

The children in Moore, Oklahoma and thier parents need your help. Women Recharged, LLC and our supporters are raising funds to purchase items for children. The worst nightmare for hundreds of moms and dads occured; not being able to provide safety and less worry, thier normal life back and something as simple as a bottle of water to thier children.

Our Volunteer Team will personally go and shop for these items to ensure they land in the hands of the children that need them. You will be notified once the distribution occurs:)

Many losing everything - we hope to relieve some of the parents stress by providing for thier children. This will be a LONG process to rebuild, and we know that, but anything you can so will help.

As a mother, there are certain things I want for my children - a feeling of safety, food, thier own blanket, and thier "stuff" - these children don't have any of thier "stuff." It's just the right thing to do.

**************PLEASE SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN*****************

WHAT LITTLE BOYS AND GIRLS NEED

The need is great and as we know, children need everything all the time. This is no different. The funds will be used to purchase these items.

  • Diapers
  • Socks
  • Underwear
  • Clothing
  • Shoes
  • Blankets!!
  • Toiletries (soap, toothpaste, toothbrushes, combs, brushes etc)

 

WHAT THIS MEANS FOR CHILDREN

Your donation means a baby will have clean diapers and clothing, proper toiletries and maybe a small stuffed toy to help the parent (s) STRESS a little less about the well being of thier child (ren) - so they can focus on rebuilding what they have lost.

WHAT ELSE CAN YOU DO

Whether you can or can't make a financial contribution there are still things you can do to help!

  • SHARE the link for this campaign
  • Local to OKC? Volunteer with others who care, contact Redcross.org.

 

Thank you,

 

Aprille Franks-Hunt

*Photo Source: AP

story:
Short Summary

  • We are an NGO {Non-Government Organization} located in Bugembe, Jinja, Uganda.
  • We work to keep children in their families and out of orphanages.
  • We are asking you to partner with us in providing for the educational needs of families at our center.
  • By making a one time donation of as little as $25 you will get to see the children + caregivers we serve in Uganda learn and grow!

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our goal is to raise $10,000 this Fall. All proceeds will go toward the educational needs of our center over the next year. We have FIVE one time funding options you can choose from!
  • $25 - Buys 2-3 children's books for the early childhood center.
  • $50- Pays the cost of one caregiver to attend our business class.
  • $100- Pays one month's salary for Juliet, our part time Income Generation Director. {Juliet teaches the business class and works with each caregiver to help them learn or strengthen a skill they can then turn into a small business.}
  • $200- Pays one month's salary for Julie, the teacher at our early childhood center.
  • $500- Pays for 3-4 grants given to caregivers who have been through + graduated our business class. {Upon graduation from our business class, caregivers are able to apply for small grants helping them start their small business. These grants are legally bound and come in the form of goats, cows, sewing machines, charcoal stoves, etc.} 
  • For each of the FIVE one time funding options you also will get something in return!
  • $25- You will get a footprint cutout {inspired by the Abide Logo} with your name or the name of someone you love on the classroom wall at our center.
  • $50- You will get a footprint cutout {inspired by the Abide Logo} with your name or the name of someone you love on the classroom wall at our center AND a photo and short write up about the caregiver you are helping through our business class.
  • $100- You will get a footprint cutout {inspired by the Abide Logo} with your name or the name of someone you love on the classroom wall at our center AND you will get ONE handmade jewelry item made by women here in Uganda.
  • $200- You will get a footprint cutout {inspired by the Abide Logo} with your name or the name of someone you love on the classroom wall at our center AND we will plan a special activity with the children at the center {think boat ride, nature hike, relay races, etc.} and we will take a picture of the activity and share it with you!
  • $500- You will get a footprint cutout {inspired by the Abide Logo} with your name or the name of someone you love on the classroom wall at our center AND a one-on-one Skype meeting with one of the families benefiting from the grants you are helping us provide.
  • Regardless of whether or not we meet our goal, all funds will go to the educational needs of the families at our center.

The Impact

  • All contributions help us educate and empower caregivers + children in Uganda. By donating, you will be partnering with us in helping provide families with the skills and resources they need to stay together.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you aren't able to donate, you can still help us reach our goal!
  • It's easy! Share this campaign with your friends and family and tell them why you believe in Abide + why they should help us make it to $10,000 this Fall.

Learn more about our program model here:

abidefamilycenter.org

story:
Who I Am

Born and raised in rural Wyoming, I thought I knew something about about being isolated.  We didn't have a street light or a retail outlet of any kind.  Then in 2010, I went to Thailand where I learned the cold realities that the peoples of the developing world face. I knew the Hmong language from previous work I had done in San Diego with Hmong refugees, so I was in a position to help.  I became acquainted with Baan Ayui--a school commited to ending human trafficking in northern Thailand.   With a committed founder (you're awesome, Sue) and a great model, they have the potential to help the poorest families fend off the lurking threat of traffickers.

At the end of the day, I'm just a guy.  I don't own an NGO, and I don't draw a salary from this.  Donate.  You'll be glad you did.  I will post pictures of the product once it is purchased.

Who They are

The Ayui Foundation is an organization established in Chiang Rai province, Northern Thailand that provides a hostel (Baan Ayui) and educational support for poor, vulnerable, at-risk, ethnic Akha hilltribe teenagers, promoting the importance of education. We support both boys and girls aged 10 and older. We focus on providing practical support, educational opportunities and a safe, warm and loving environment for Akha hilltribe adolescents. 

Baan Ayui

Baan Ayui is run on a day-to-day basis by an Akha couple who live with the children. The children have daily chores and weekly activities include: discussion groups on topics related to hilltribes and teens; hostel meetings; traditional Akha embroidery; Akha songs and dances; guitar lessons and Thai, computer, art and English lessons from volunteers. Baan Ayui works to instill pride in cultural heritage, imbed the importance of education and actively assist with identifying and achieving future pathways for each house member after graduation.

The Akha Hilltribe

The Akha hilltribe is one of the nine main ethnic minority groups living in the mountainous Northern provinces of Thailand. They originated from China and settled in Chiang Rai province over 250 years ago, however, they still exist as a minority group who are often treated as second-class citizens. Economic hardship stems from being forced to join a cash economy after centuries of relying on barter economy and being self-reliant farmers, producing their own food and clothing. Many Akha people lack proper legal documentation to make them eligible for Thai citizenship and are considered illegal immigrants, even in the country of their birth. Without legal documents and citizenship, many Akha people cannot obtain a driving license or school graduation records, and cannot open bank accounts, rent/buy housing or take any legal action if they are exploited by employers. Limited land and government forest restrictions means many Akha people now do hired manual labor to support their families.

As each hilltribe has its own distinct language and culture, the Thai language is not their mother tongue, which makes school more difficult for hilltribe children. Educational opportunities are limited in many hilltribe villages and there are great social problems facing their communities, including drug use, drug trafficking, HIV/AIDS, prostitution and exploitation.

Our Students

For the 2013 school year, we have 18 Akha youth (5 boys and 13 girls) living at Baan Ayui. The children come from poor backgrounds, many from single-parent families whose parents have separated, or with one parent dead or in jail. Living at the hostel decreases the financial burden on their families, and many of the children would have no place to live if we had not taken them in. Some of the children have been cared for by the Foundation since it’s establishment 7 years ago. The students’ education levels range from Grade 5 to high school. Some students are in grades below their age level as they are placed according to their Thai language skills.

Our Request 

We are looking to replace our 2 secondhand laptops that are showing their age, and requesting at least 2 personal computers for the children to use when doing homework assignments. We have a printer and internet connection and currently have one PC.

story:
Who are we | The Awakening Foundation

We're an NGO that was started in 2011 with a strong belief that the current education system in India needed a facelift. Since then we have completely devoted our time and efforts in developing new programs and learning modules for a very ignored sector called APS (Affordable Private Schools).

  • We currently work with 20 affordable private schools in Hyderabad.
  • There are 20 internationals in these schools working on English development, Personality development, Computer Education and Extra curricular activities.
  • We've trained 6000 students so far, reached out to 22,000 students and have drafted a school development program that was piloted in 34 schools in Hyderabad for over 12 months.

We're the only NGO in the city of Hyderabad that works in all the aspects that is necessary for a school to develop.

Why APS (Affordable Private Schools)

India faces a major problem of educated yet unemployed youth:

  • Out of the 5 million+ youth that are educated yet unemployed, the students from these schools contribute maximum to that number.
  • Affordable private schools get no benefit, support, resources from the government. These schools have the potential to provide good quality education to their students, but face major obstacles like: Untrained teachers, financial issues, burden of taxes, etc.
  • We work with these schools and have a resource person (International) placed in each school who works with these students and teachers.

The Impact | Fund Utilization

We have been working with over 20 schools this year and plan to expand to another 20 by the end of 2013.

  • We have started a revolution back here in Hyderabad. We've taken a stand to improve the quality of education. We need your support!
  • We have also started programs like Orphan Aid, Environment Awareness and a Women Empowerment program and Health camps. We aim to improve the entire community around the school.
  • We would utilize the funds that we raise from this campaign for the International fellowship that we've started this year.

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate any kind of help and are always eager to work with people interested in improving the society. Please contact us:

  • If you'd like to fund a students education for a year/6months
  • If you have friends who'd like to support an awesome non profit, please share this campaign :)
  • If you want to volunteer/teach in a school.
  • If you'd like to meet us in person to get to know more about the program/NGO.
  • If you have any kind of feedback/suggestions.

Contact Details:

Adithya Sanjay - +91 9885226189 - adithyeah@gmail.com

Karthik Dantu - +91 9177160544 - karthik.dantu@gmail.com

story:
THE PROBLEM

Although much progress has been made in recent decades, persistent hurdles to the advancement of women in STEM (science, technology, engineering, and math) remain. The "leaky pipeline" model describes the proportion of women "on track" to becoming STEM professionals as falling off at every step of the way. Young girls show interest in math and science but leave the fields over the course of their education. 


ABOUT SCIENTISTA

The Scientista Foundation (www.scientistafoundation.com) is a media company that creates online content, campus communities, and events for pre-professional women in science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM). We are dedicated to helping close the shortage of women in STEM.  While many organizations address challenges for professional women, or young girls in science, computer science, math, and engineering, no other national organization focuses on the specific needs of female college and graduate students. We are the largest network of campus women in science, technology, engineering, and medicine (STEM).  


OUR HISTORY

Scientista was started out of Harvard in 2011 by two sisters, Julia and Christina Tartaglia, to address the lack of resources, community, and role models for college women in science and engineering. After placing as a Harvard College Innovation Challenge semifinalist and winning a Harvard TECH prize, they launched ScientistaFoundation.com, a platform and national network that addresses the needs of pre-professional women in STEM. 


WHAT WE'VE DONE SO FAR

Since its founding, Scientista has expanded to 20+ campuses and affiliate organizations at 15 college campuses across the United States (including Harvard, Johns Hopkins, Barnard, Stanford, Loyola University Maryland, MIT, and the University of Michigan) Scientista has also started partnerships with major organizations and media companies, including The Huffington Post and the Association of Women in Science. 

IN THE PRESS

  • See our latest article in the Huffington Post’s “Girls in STEM” column!  http://www.huffingtonpost.com/the-scientista-foundation/what-women-want-from-the-point-of-view-of-a-gen-y-scientista_b_3797868.html
  • This year, Scientista was named by Enable Education as a "Top 12 Amazing Organization for Women in STEM."  
  • Our co-founders, Julia and Christina, have spoken at conferences such as the Harvard Women's Leadership Conference, the Association for Physical Sciences (APS) Conference, and the Rosalind Franklin Society Board Meeting.


HELP US LAUNCH our Inaugural Scientista Symposium - April 5th, 2014 at MIT in Cambridge, MA


Our next goal for achieving our mission is to launch our first conference, the Scientista Symposium on April 5, 2014.  The symposium will be an invaluable experience for undergraduate women in STEM to network with professionals and peers, present their research, and hear inspirational panel discussions and speeches about women in STEM. 

The Symposium is being held on MIT's campus and includes a full day of speaker panels, networking, and presentations by STEM professionals.  The keynote address is by media icon Elise Andrew, creator of the "I F*cking Love Science" Facebook page and YouTube channel.  

Check out our conference website!  http://www.scientistafoundation.com/symposium-2014.html

What Will the Symposium Achieve?

  • Professional-to-Student Networking: Students will have the opportunity to interact directly with our corporate sponsors companies to learn about different fields of work in STEM and career opportunities. Professionals also have an opportunity to sit with students during lunch and breakout time blocks.
  • Research Symposium: Students have unique opportunity to present their research and win a first place, second place, and honorable mention cash prizes.  Through the symposium, they will also develop and practice their presentation skills.
  • Academic and Professional Growth – TED-style talks and panel discussions from prominent women and men in science will highlight key issues in science, career development, and issues relating to women in science.
  • Intercollegiate networking opportunities: Students across the nation will meet, share ideas about their fields of study and past work experiences, and partake in interactive discussions.

How Else Can You Get Involved?

There are multiple ways to join us in achieving our mission!  Help us spread the word about the Scientista Foundation and our April Symposium.  

You can also tweet or retweet us, “like” and share our facebook page, and share our Indiegogo campaign with friends!  You can also share our project and mission with blogs or other organizations involved with women in STEM issues.

Please don't hesitate to contact us with any questions at contact@scientistafoundation.com. We appreciate your support and dedication to empowering women in STEM!

Sincerely,

The Scientista Team

Email: contact@scientistafoundation.com

Research Symposium: Students have unique opportunity to present their research and win a first place, second place, and honorable mention cash prizes.  Through the symposium, they will also develop and practice their presentation skills.
Academic and Professional Growth – TED-style talks and panel discussions from prominent women and men in science will highlight key issues in science, career development, and issues relating to women in science.
Intercollegiate networking opportunities: Students across the nation will meet, share ideas about their fields of study and past work experiences, and partake in interactive discussions.
How Else Can You Get Involved?There are multiple ways to join us in achieving our mission!  Help us spread the word about the Scientista Foundation and our April Symposium.  You can also tweet or retweet us, “like” and share our facebook page, and share our Indiegogo campaign with friends!  You can also share our project and mission with blogs or other organizations involved with women in STEM issues.Please don't hesitate to contact us with any questions at contact@scientistafoundation.com. We appreciate your support and dedication to empowering women in STEM!Sincerely,The Scientista TeamEmail: contact@scientistafoundation.com

story:
Our Story

UpBeat NYC is a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit organization that uses the pursuit of musical excellence and ensemble performance to bring about positive change in the lives of South Bronx children. An “El Sistema” inspired program, UpBeat NYC seeks to address the social and cultural isolation of South Bronx children through year-round, immersive musical training and performing experience. UpBeat was established in 2009 and currently serves over 100 children and youth through its orchestra and early childhood after school music programs. All programming is offered free of charge.

UpBeat Basics:
• All classes, lessons and instruments are provided free of charge
• UpBeat welcomes individuals of all abilities and experience; we believe everyone is innately musical
• All students attend lessons multiple times per week on a year-round basis
• Musicians with a passion for teaching nurture and guide students on an instrument of their choice
• All students learn to read and write music
• All participants perform frequently in small and large ensembles
• UpBeat's music education philosophy emphasizes passion first, refinement second

UpBeat NYC is dedicated to the betterment of South Bronx children’s lives through transformative musical experience. We believe that there is no more effective investment in a community’s present and future than the cultivation of its children’s well-being and happiness and that music has a unique role to play in developing children as powerful agents of their community’s improvement. UpBeat’s priority is to enable children to realize and act on their ability to shape their own lives and contribute to the vibrancy of their family and community. There is an opportunity in the South Bronx to facilitate a collaboration of families and musicians with the aim of elevating local children and in turn the entire community through artistic achievement.


What We Need

Through years of hard work, UpBeat’s success has been built by passionate volunteer musicians and families who believe no obstacle should stand in the way of a child’s musical experience and education. We started this work with no funding and will continue it regardless of our future fundraising results. That said, the number of students we reach and the quality of experience we are able to provide them is very dependent on the financial support we secure. Below are a few of the things that your contributions will support and that will help take this program to the next level.

Special Workshops

This fall we were able to hold several workshops with master teachers in which students made great leaps forward.  After one such workshop on a recent Saturday morning, one student told us, “That was so great! We should do this every week!” We would love to offer more special events and workshops to our participants and your contribution can make that happen!

Transportation

Being in one of the great musical cities of the world, there are lots of opportunities for our kids to be exposed to great music and musical events. But because there are so many of us and such limited resources, the cost of travel often keeps us home. Even subway trips to places like Carnegie Hall, which invites us to free concerts, are at times impossible for many of our kids due to their family’s tight budgets. Workshops like our planned collaboration with the Corona Youth Music Project in Queens will not be possible without funding to charter a bus.

Instruments

An orchestral music program is impossible without instruments – lots of instruments. This can be a very significant cost. Fortunately, UpBeat has received thousands of dollars worth of instruments from generous New Yorkers seeking a worthy home for there violin, cello, clarinet, etc. But these donations do not always keep up with our needs, and we are often in the position of having to purchase used instruments. Maintenance and repairs also present ongoing costs that add up to significant amounts over the course of a year.

Expert Teachers

The teachers we hire to work with our youngest violinists (ages 5-8) are highly trained specialists who meticulously coach their students in correct posture and technique, laying the foundation for a lifetime of healthy playing habits. At the same time, they are instilling in them the joy of music making and the values of teamwork and musical excellence.  These carefully prepared students will go on to form the backbone of the UpBeat NYC Youth Orchestra as they move forward in their studies.

Contributions will also support the ongoing efforts to build our volunteer base, handle instrument donations, manage student recruitment and strengthen parent involvement/communications.

Please over-fund this campaign!

We will be thrilled to reach our goal of $10,000. Every dollar above that amount will help us reach even more of the countless children eager to begin their musical journey.


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!  Please tell everyone and anyone about this project.  Every bit helps! 

Email it, Tweet it, share it and like it on Facebook!

Thank you all so much!

Liza and Rich

http://www.upbeatnyc.org/

story:
Summary

All my life I'm been looking for my mission on this planet.  About a month ago, I finally found it.

I am here to help coaches, authors and speakers get their message out to the world.

You see, there are so many change makers in the world trying to make a difference, but they fall short because they are clueless when it comes to business and marketing.

The result is that their message, talents and skills are wasted!

I am here to help them get clear on their message and marketing so they can attract more clients and ultimately impact the world in a larger way.

In order for me to do this, I need to get MY message out to those coaches, authors and speakers.  For me to do this I need to uplevel my wealth consiousness and business skills so I can shine a light and be the best mentor for these change makers that I can be.

My intuition told me to quit my job and focus on my mission and that is what I am doing.  My intuition also told me to create this indiegogo compaign, so here I am.

I previously bought a ticket and plane ticket to a wealth and business event in Hollywood, which will take place Oct 15-17th...what do NOT have is a place to sleep!  

I need you to help me pay for the hotel!  If I have to sleep in the street I will, but I'd much rather spend the night in a bed so I can be rested and get everything out of this event so I can take that home with me and put it into action to help the people who need my help.

What I Need

$800 - 3 nights at the hotel

$400 - food & transportation from hotel to airports

Indiegogo fees

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about my campaign!  Share my link with as many people as you can think of, especially on Facebook!

Also, adding a comment (public or private) helps up my points for better placement on the website.
